Reviews.Title: “Unique”
Reviews.Author: therealmike
Reviews.Content: It's a typical hollywood apartment building turned into a hotel. Had a huge 1BR with living room and bath. Basic but stylish furnishings, great beds and linens. Old window type AC, windows that open with screens. Everything works, everything was clean. Lots of space. Great service. Took my daughter to brunch at the magic castle, food was good, shows were great, the place is a lot of fun. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: TeerthaG
Reviews.Content: Before staying in Magic Castle Hotel with my family during March 2012, I always felt a little surprised that such a small hotel has been able to maintain its 2nd position in Tripadvisor for such a long time in competition with much larger and more glamorous rivals. After our stay I think I have found the answer. It is the staffs at this hotel, starting from Front Desk to Housekeeping, which has made this a travellerâ€™s favourite. It is not only the service but the way you are getting the service makes a big difference. May be the small size of the hotel helps the staff to cater to individual needs but the main factor here is the positive attitude and it comes through quite clearly. It is not that everything is perfect at this hotel. As other reviewers have mentioned, this is an old apartment block which has been converted into a hotel with a pool in the middle and some part of the property shows its age. Some of the furniture and fixtures needs improvement and looks and feel dated and if you are staying at the upper level of rooms like us then anybody with a mobility issue will have a problem. Of course the lady at the reception helped my wife with her luggage but as there is no elevator at this property you have to climb a few stairs. But apart from these we do not have any other issues with this hotel. The rooms are actually one bedroom apartments with plenty of space. The hotel provides free soft drinks, snacks and DVD movies throughout the day which was a big hit with our son. The breakfast is a small affair with limited choices but whatever was offered was of good quality and enough to start our day. The hotel does not have a restaurant but if you are feeling tired and do not wish to go out then the staff provides menus of a number of nearby restaurants and will help you in placing the order. We ordered pizza on one occasion and the delivery was fast and the taste was good. Of course being just next to the Hollywood Boulevard there are number of eating options nearby covering all kind of budgets and taste. Major tourist attractions like Madam Tussauds, Kodak Theatre and Graumanâ€™s Chinese Theatre are all within five minutes walking distance as is the Hollywood and Highland metro station from where the Universal Studio is just a station away. The area felt quite but totally safe during our stay and we did not encounter any problem even during late evening. The hotel provides secure parking at the ground level but it is not free. Free Wi-Fi is provided and the connection speed was pretty good. We could not find any convenience store nearby and bought our necessities including water from the petrol station next to Renaissance Hotel which is a short walk away. All in all we are very happy with our stay at the Magic Castle hotel and it has remained as one of our favourite during our 16 day vacation even though we stayed with bigger properties and brand names at other cities and will not hesitate to come back at all.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: Markwoodward
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! Took it on recommendation from trip advisor reviews and have not regretted it. It s the little details that make for a great experience. The location is incredible especially for the price. There is parking. A heated pool in a shaded courtyard perfect for the kids. Greeted with a smile and welcome drinks on arrival. Complementary snacks and drinks, great continental breakfast next to the pool. Info on tables telling you what day it is(!), weather forecast for day and what sport, concerts and other things going on that day. Free DVDs to borrow. Front desk so helpful. Only downsides - noise at night if light sleeper, room a bit drabby and when we were there lots of other Brits staying!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for families and great value”
Reviews.Author: Melb-4
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Magic Castle Hotel and loved it. The staff were all very nice and helpful. The apartments were very spacious and had everything we needed. They are a little old around the edges but we didn't even care as the service, location and facilities were excellent. The swimming pool is heated and there's a laundry! There are also free snacks and drinks and a free breakfast! Unbelievable value in a brilliant location! If we're ever back in LA we will definitely stay here again. The kids have both compared every other hotel since then to the Magic Castle Hotel and found them wanting.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Gotigers80
Reviews.Content: One block behind the Chinese Theatre and walk of fame...the perfect location! You can walk to all the Hollywood sights and the Hollywood / Highland subway station is just under the mall - and just one station to Universal Studios. We chose a smaller room ( Next time I would opt for a bigger one!! ) but the service more than compensated for the tiny room on the 3rd floor (no elevator)...sparkling apple juice on arrival, great buffet breakfasts and unlimited snacks and sodas...Reception staff were extra helpful, and the coin laundry (free powder) a real bonus at the end of our trip. Great outdoor pool too. The only place to stay in Hollywood!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: 1moretravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in 1 bdrm suite while in LA. Quick 5 min. walk to Hollywood Walk of Fame and Graumanns Chinese Theatre. Also near Madame Tussaud Wax Museum. Service was great. Everyone at the front desk were friendly and helpful. Parking was very reasonable at $11/night and always found a parking spot. Free snacks, drinks and breakfast were also a plus. We did switch rooms after the first night b/c of the street noise. Our room was facing the main street. The second room was better even though I still heard some street noise. It wasn't as bad as the first room. I will say that the rooms are dated and old. But it was clean and all the other perks make it worthwhile. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff - WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Cain1970
Reviews.Content: I made a call while driving aimlessly around Hollywood and when Gabriela answered that was the beginning of a very nice though short stay. KUDOS to Gabriela and Joslyn at the front desk!! So nice and helpful!!! Nice little outdoor pool, spacious room, discount on the price, free candy/snacks, sodas, laundry soap, wonderful hot cider...and so much more. Pay parking but under hotel gated and safe! Great local near KODAK THEATRE, easy little walk to Hollywood BLVD. Gabriela and Joslyns boss should give them a RAISE!!!! Would very much so stay there again!! ~ Cain

Reviews.Title: “SERVICE & LOCATION MAKE THIS A 5 STAR”
Reviews.Author: KittyKitty1111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of Hollywood, and right off the freeway. I can't even explain how spoiled we felt getting to pick out our FREE candy and FREE soft drinks. They even had loaner umbrellas bc we hit L.A. in the rain. We shared a 2 bedroom suite w/ another couple and even though there was only one bathroom it was fine. The main reason to stay at this hotel is to get admission into the exclusive Magic Castle. If you've been to L.A. before, what a treat to try something new like this. Rooms are clean, pool is heated and service was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, better than we hoped!”
Reviews.Author: natskee
Reviews.Content: We initially drove up to the concierge of the actual Magic Castle but were quickly told to go next door to the hotel so was no problem. When you arrive, bear this is mind! Parking is under the hotel - easy, small charge but nothing drastic and very convieniant. Service here, as everyone says on TA, is outstanding. You get free snacks, 24 hours a day!! And they'll come to your room if you're too lazy to go to reception!! Such a cool touch. We always had a pack of oreos, granola bar and a can of Dr Pepper 'just in case we get peckish' on our way out and way back each day! Even when we checked out they encouraged us to get a bag full of snacks for our road trip to San Diego which we did, and that was great! The lobby drinks and snacks are lovely too, they do it every night. I had cucumber water one evening which was yummy! Another was apple cider, also yum! We had a suite and it didn't overlook the pool or have a balcony but that was fine for us as we didn't chill at the hotel during the day. Room was huge with seperate bedroom/living room/bathroom and a small kitchen linked to the living room. To be honest it was a bit wasted on us, the bedroom was so big we just used that! Pool is open 24 hours and is heated to 85 degrees. I was tempted to have a late night swim just for fun but decided against it - wiuld be nice though I imagine. Location is literally across the road from Hollywood Blvd and Walk of Fame, 2 mins away. The subway is right there too and just 1 stop from Universal Studios. You'll need a car/train to go to most other places but this is a fantastic base and wld stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A short stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: LeeWellington
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is nice. The staff are fantastic and they've gone to extra lengths to help locate a lost item, which was much appreciated. The rooms were a little dated but they're clean. It's worth noting that (if you're a little silly like us), you wont be staying in the magic castle itself, or even go into it. The hotel is very central and in a great location to walk around the boulevard.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: boadiceactrice
Reviews.Content: No matter how many reviews you read about the impeccable level of service at Magic Castle Hotel you will still be blown away by how outstanding the service really is! From the word go at check in all the way through your stay the staff here go above and beyond the call of duty. For example we wanted to go to a nearby Japanese restaurant, not only did the staff of Magic Castle Hotel give us a lift up there (because there was a steep hill involed) but on arrival we had magically been booked in to the restaurant and received a tempura platter compliments of Magic Castle Hotel. That's just ONE example of a long list I could reel off. It is also worth staying just to visit the Magic Castle show itself, a fantastic night out!! Special mention has to go to Gretchen and Jocelyn the ladies at reception who were both just fantastic, so friendly, happy, helpful and chatty, such a pleasure to have stayed at MC! Would not consider staying anywhere else when next in Hollywood!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family centric hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpgiro11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in march - 2 adults 2 children. We were so impressed with the service they were always very helpful offered suggestions and got us anything we wanted. Kids loved the free snacks and DVDs. The room we had (2 bedroom suite) was very spacious the kitchen and bathroom were a little old but the other areas were great it was very clean and serviced every day. Also a really good location. If you go to la on a family trip make sure you visit the la brea tar pits and the museum - really educational and interesting

Reviews.Title: “2 days in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: CJSYD
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in March 2012 and chose this hotel for location near the walk of fame and Hollywood attractions. It is a very close walk to the main street, about 3 or 4 minutes easy walk. The room was comfortable but dated, good value for money. The beds and pillows were outstanding! Breakfast was great by the pool each morning and the staff were very friendly and accommodating to any needs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Campo3
Reviews.Content: You will not find a place more willing to please than here. A welcoming drink, escort to room, and always a smile when we come through. We had a suite (108) that kept us back a bit from the street and pool area which made for good quiet. Decent pool, complimentary continental breakfast was a bit more upscale than most locations, unlimited snacks and drinks were a hit with the family. Easy walking access to Hollywood walk of fame makes for great location to get some sightseeing in. The interior decor can use work and they are a bit skimpy on the pots and pans if you want to be cooking (one pot, one fry pan, no strainer) which can make things a bit tricky but they certainly will do everything possible to make your stay a great one. Shower leaves something to be desired but it was hot and clean and toiletries were nice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, great service and hospitality, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: bonnieginger
Reviews.Content: checked in at 7:30am after a 14 hour flight from Sydney to a lovely welcome from Lisa on the desk....she was lovely and we feltvreally welcome. Great location walking distance to everything. Free breakfast and hot apple cider in the evening. free soft drinks and snacks available all day too.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff, fabulous location, free snacks, lovely pool, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Kokey_Gandor
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Magic Castle Hotel feels like you are staying in the apartment building from the TV show Melrose Place (which is awesome in my opinion). We had a really spacious apartment over looking the pool which is a refreshing change from small hotel rooms in chain hotels. It was clean, tidy and has everything you could need. The staff are fantastic, all extremely helpful and friendly. It's the little added bonus's that make this hotel a stand out though. Free snacks 24 hours a day, drinks, chips, lollies, chocolate whatever and unlimited. One day it was freezing cold and we came back to spicy apple cider in the lobby with biscuits. The staff found out we were on our honeymoon and they left a beautiful local bottle of wine for us named Honeymoon in our room. Every evening the staff leave a note in your room about the next days weather so you can prepare yourself and plan ahead. The staff genuinely care about the guests and go out of their way to make sure your stay is enjoyable. The location could not be better, a few minutes walk to Kodak theatre etc. I have stayed in stacks of hotels all over the world and think this one is one of the best. It might not be the flashiest or biggest but they make up for it with an exceptional service, fab location and all the little extra's. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The magic of Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: acmeharpoon
Reviews.Content: I cannot wait to stay at this fantastic hotel again! An associate has been telling about this place for years and I finally stayed and was completely blown away by the service at this awesome hotel! I loved everything about it - and I am HARD to please as I travel extensively on business year round. From now on Magic Castle is the only place that I will stay at in Hollywood. Thanks, Magic Castle!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle Hotel, LA”
Reviews.Author: KUrquie
Reviews.Content: I can't compliment this place enough. The customer service was excellent - the best I've ever experienced. The staff really couldn't do enough for you or help out more. The accommodation was very spacious, very clean, turndown service was a fab bonus - no complaints about the accomodation. The 'mini bar' was awesome and free - you asked reception for whatever you wanted from a huge range of snacks and soft drinks, and within minutes you had it - completely free of charge. Free popsicles by the pool was another added bonus. The location was perfect - less than five minutes walk from Chinese Theatre etc. Cost-wise, The Magic Castle Hotel was one of the least expensive that I found. The Magic Caslte Club next door was an amazing evening as well. Not being particularly 'in to' magic, I was in absolute awe of the magicians - both those that performed as part of a show and those that performed off the cuff. All in all an amazing experience. I would absolutely stay at the Magic Castle Hotel again and would 100% recommend others to stay there too. I marked the sleep quality 'average' as the pull out sofa bed wasn't the comfiest but not enough to cause a problem

Reviews.Title: “Unique and awesome!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorB325
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in LA! Great staff, location (Hollywood) and apartments. Accommodations are spacious, retro and comfy. This is an older property, very well kept. Ask for balcony apt. Go to Japanese Restaurant. Lie around at the pool, Walk to Chinese Theatre and anything you need the staff will attempt for you. A real hidden gem in the Hills. Watch out for taxi costs-just rent a private limo-same price ($80)..or take super shuttle for $16. Perfect for families who need more space, or extended stay where you want a real home away from home. Great snack bar and lemonade upon arrival. Wonderful DVD collection to rent. I can't say enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hospitality and Key Location”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseBlond
Reviews.Content: Arriving and checking in at the Magic Castle was a pleasure after traveling all day. The staff made you feel welcome and were quick to meet all needs during check in and any need we had during our one night stay. The free continental breakfast was well done and had abundant selections to satisfy many tastes. The location of the hotel is perfect if you want to visit the Walk of Fame, Kodak Theater, Chinese Theater and view the famous Hollywood sign. Our room was a one bedroom facing the street. The building itself is vintage and room is not on par with more modern facilities. However, the hospitality and housekeeping staff are above par and makes the stay at Magic Castle worthwhile. The noise for street side rooms that has been noted by other patrons is appropriate however you are staying in the city so noise should be anticipated. The access to the hotel is controlled and parking is secured. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to see and experience Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Best service i've seen in a long time”
Reviews.Author: wm49555
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here with three others. We got a two bedroom suite for around three hundred. At our arrival Gretchen was very friendly and offered a list of snacks and drinks free of charge to take to our room. In the morning, Ricky had an amazing spread waiting for us and we enjoyed our flavored coffee and our usa today. Lastly, Lisa was extremely helpful in helping us to plan our day in Hollywood. The staff was incredible, thank you to all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: DeluxoDave
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit to Los Angeles and have stayed at a variety of hotels. I've stayed at the Charlie, the W Hollywood, the Standard (both locations), Sofitel, Luxe on Sunset, the Hotel Amarano in Burbank and have rented three homes from VRBO. By far, my favorite is the Magic Castle hotel on Franklin. I like this place so much that it's become my default spot for business trips and our favorite for trips with my two young kids. Why is this nondescript "garden apartment" style hotel my favorite? A few reasons: 1) The location can't be beat. You're in the heart of Hollywood with easy access to the major freeways. 2) You get access to the Magic Castle. While the drinks are overpriced and the food is mediocre, it's an experience not to be missed. 3) The rooms at the hotel are HUGE. They are all one bedroom suites and perfect for the visiting family that needs a kitchen and room for kids to relax. 4) The services is fantastic. Unlike the major chains, the Magic Castle doesn't nickle & dime you at every turn. The wi-fi is free, the snacks are free, they even gave us a free postcard stamp! It's the little touches. The staff and General Manager are all very nice and overly accommodating. Don't let the modest exterior fool you. This is by far the best hotel deal in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “I am confused.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCook
Reviews.Content: Frankly, this is the very first time I have been disappointed in something so highly rated by TripAdvisor. Just quickly: We booked for one night because of a meeting on Wednesday evening in LA, less than two miles from the hotel. We drove in six+ hours, and while it wasn't the easiest to find it was found quickly. I'll start with the positives because they started right away! First off, the staff - wow. They are enthusiastic, helpful, friendly - heck, it's like the Boy Scout motto is part of their training! They offered a glass of sparkling lemonade while I was checking in and while I declined, they took it out to the car to give to my wife. They then directed me to the gated, underground (i.e. under the building) parking, which while not free was certainly both reasonable and unbelievably magnificent in Los Angeles. (Small note - the ceiling is not terribly high, therefore the pipes below the floor are fairly low, resulting in hatchback contact. Worth watching out for.) Due to our meeting time, we could only just put our stuff in the room, wash our faces, and head out. It was at this point we noticed the very nice facial soap with an orange citrus scent. We also noticed that due to the design of the entryway, the door to the room does not open completely. There is some sort of weird panel near the floor behind where the door tries to open. There's a very antique wall heater of some kind just inside the door. There is a slightly musty smell. And when washing our faces, we saw the cracked basin in the sink, but with no time to talk to anyone about it we headed out. We got back around 11:30pm, exhausted, and got undressed and into bed. On taking off my shoes and walking through the room, I found an area where it feels like there are cracks or holes, where the carpet sinks in, between the bedroom and the bathroom. On laying down in the bed, I realized the mattress is ... firm, to be kind. It's on a platform. We also took the time to read the small sign on the bed informing us that if we wanted a top sheet between ourselves and our duvet, we needed to have request it. Exhausted, I put my head down. At this point, I noticed the vinyl shutters in the room do not quite completely close. As our room was on the ground floor facing the street, I had to improvise some receipts stuffed underneath to keep them closed. About the street - there is a window-style air conditioner built into the wall facing the street, which I could see to outside through (a small hole, granted, but it is still there). But that was nothing compared to the continuous and rather loud traffic. All ... night ... long! The windows looked to be single-pane and (upon further investigation of the inside of the shutters in the light of day) hardly sealed. In the daylight, I found a few other interesting items. First, the shower - nice, serviceable, old, loads of hot water, and as is typical of someone my height (six foot one) excellent at cleaning my chest hairs. No matter, a great percentage of places are like this for me. But I also saw on the wall between the shower and the bathroom door, which is quite beat up by the way, some sort of yellowish runny stains on it with an exceptionally disturbing (in this day and age) red one on the (also very beat up) floorboard. Now the fact that the door opens physically ON to the toilet may be simply because of the age of the building and the plumbing design, but the oddly placed pedestal on the sink is quite modern. There are two light switches in the bathroom, one for the light and fan and the other for ... well, I couldn't tell what it did. there is a heating element as well on the ceiling, which looks to be from a mid-50's electric stove top, but it never did a thing. And I feel fairly certain the fan was the prop from the airplane in the movie Casablanca, judging by both its age and surprising level of noise. Throughout the room, the painting job is slapdash. The floorboards are really beat up. The clothes rod in the closet is scary looking, either badly painted and worn or honestly I don't know. I'm surprised at how much I found, considering we had just enough time for me to grab some of the (very good and very plentiful) included continental breakfast and take it back to the room before we had to leave. Again, a truly friendly staff, I cannot say enough about them, but I just did not have the time to discuss it with them. I do honestly believe they would have done whatever they could to improve the situation, but this type of trip prevented me from being able to discuss it with them and frankly considering the reports everyone else seems to have made I was caught off guard by all of this stuff. I know things go wrong, but I don't expect a place rated as highly as this to require me to address this many shortcomings. Had I noticed two other items when we arrived we would have been late to our meeting, as they passed beyond unpleasant to dangerous: the first was some sort of power cable coming from the bottom of one of the outlets, down into the carpet. I do not know where it went or what it was for but I cannot believe that type of rigging would pass code. The second was the fact that the smoke alarm had no battery and appeared to be inoperative (no light). I know that wouldn't pass code. In conclusion, this is a very pretty, funky, cool place with excellent on-site underground parking, a heated outdoor pool, a staff that would make any Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons or wherever proud, in a really great location in Hollywood, but with what I found in my room I just can't come to grips with the fact this hotel is (as of 1 March 2012) the #2 rated hotel in Los Angeles on TripAdvisor. My experience really doesn't seem to match others'. Please see my photos to get a better understanding of what I'm talking about in this review.

Reviews.Title: “There's not a better place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dollybuck
Reviews.Content: Huge accomodations. Best night's sleep after wandering all over Hollywood. No need for a vehicle.Super clean. Super beautiful. Big thanks to our front desk man, Nick, who could not do enough for us!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLucas
Reviews.Content: If Trip Advisor allowed 6 stars, I'd use them. In spite of the quite dated installations, the outstanding service really makes this one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in! My family and I (5 people total) stayed there for three days during our trip to California. We stayed at a double bedroom apartment, which is really large, more than enough to accommodate 5, even 6 adults. It has its own kitchen, with microwave, coffee maker (complimentary coffee and tea) and full sized oven and refrigerator. The beds were very, very comfortable, just what we needed after a long touring LA. One point that needs to be made is that if you're looking for modern, high tech installations, you should look elsewhere (although they did have an ipod dock and flat screen TV). It's the little touches that really make this hotel, such as being greeted, upon arrival, with sparkling lemonade, then finding a big bag of cheddar popcorn and a large bottle of blueberry juice in our room (both delicious by the way). Or the free danish cookies, apple cider and cucumber water at the lobby. Or the huge list of free snacks, beverages and DVDs. Everything about the hotel shows that the staff goes many extra miles to guarantee that the guests leave the hotel with huge smiles on their faces (which we did). All in all, I highly recommend this hotel and wish I could have the opportunity to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Maccyoz
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom apartment for 2 nights in January. The apartment was very large and also very dated - which we were expecting after reading previous reviews. We were in the building next door to the main complex and not around the pool which looked much nicer. We were also at the front of the building so it was a little noisy. The location is excellent very close to many attractions and to public transport. There is a fantastic farmers market on Sundays walking distance from the hotel. Staff were helpful, breakfasts were good. Good option for families.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome thanks trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: MelissaMartin13
Reviews.Content: Just as you said, we loved it hear. The service was outstanding and the staff made our stay very comfortable. The hotel was well located to Hollywood blvd. The hotel a bit old but very clean and comfortable. L have already recommended this hotel to my friends and would come back in a heart beat. Thanks trip advisor!

Reviews.Title: “BEST FRONT DESK STAFF EVER 1”
Reviews.Author: Mike40Toronto
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle and it's wonderful staff literally saved our recent vacation in Southern California. After experiencing miserable weather on the beach in Oceanside(go figure), we decided to head to Hollywood to do some sight seeing. Originally planned to stay just 2 days but extended it to 3. It was WELL WORTH THE MONEY!. Magic Castle is as centrally located to Hollywood Blvd as you can get. Wonderful accommodations, great HEATED pool and so many perks...free snacks, breakfast, movies, popsicles for the kids, etc. The front desk staff was absolutely fantastic. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “If you have kids, you have to come here!!”
Reviews.Author: Olelopaa
Reviews.Content: Just as great as the first time we stated there!! I love the fact that my kids can swim without me worrying about where they are because I can see them right from our living room window, balcony or even when I'm at the front desk. It's a block or so from the Kodak Theater, down the hill from the historic and delicious Yamashiro restaurant. It has a kitchen so you can cook dinner on some nights and save a little. But, the absolute favorite thing of my kids was the free snacks and continental breakfast! Chips, candy, cereal, scones and sodas, Oh my!! Almost forgot, it's minutes away from Universal Studios!!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle Access & Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: patrickstpaul
Reviews.Content: My partner and I selected this hotel solely because it offered access to the Magic Castle next door. For those who donâ€™t know â€“ the Magic Castle is a private dining and performance club for magicians and other similar entertainment professionals. Entrance to the club is restricted exclusively to members, their guests and guests of the Magic Castle hotel. Although weâ€™re not in the field or big aficionados of magic shows, we had read a review about the atmosphere and performances and had wanted to check it out. We had an enjoyable evening at the club and saw some top-notch illusionists, but unfortunately did not see Neil Patrick Harris â€“ he supposedly is there regularly and is on the Board. I was set to submit my hotel review and decided to read some of the others quickly and glad I did b/c my original review just looks like I plagiarized all the others especially regarding the dominant thought on the service. Rather than mimic the rest, Iâ€™ll just say this is how you run a hotel or any customer service business. From the pre-arrival welcome email to check-out, every person we worked with was exceptional -- friendly, professional and welcoming. The manager/owner must have a talent scout background. The room we had was off the pool and used to be a 1-bedroom apartment (I assume). Furniture is basic and I liked the plantation shutters on all of the windows. The kitchen was equipped with essentials and the bed was comfortable. I especially liked the dual closets â€“ one for each of us. While the hotel room may be rather frill-less, the amenities like the complimentary convenience store (my term b/c they had so many snacks, candy and soda to select from I literally felt like a kid in a candy store) and the pastries and juice in the morning was great. After our evening at the club next door, it was nice to return to our hotel and be greeted by glowing candles in the lobby, hot apple cider and a friendly front desk representative. I definitely recommend this hotel to others looking for great service and large clean rooms in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service!”
Reviews.Author: LFCfan01
Reviews.Content: The five stars are for the service (top-notch -- friendly, uber-professional employees who seem to love working there), the value, and the location -- can't beat it, just behind the Kodak Theater in Hollywood. It's definitely an older hotel, with some funky quirks that are purely cosmetic and minor (door was a little hard to close, some of the paint and furniture are a little beat-up, walls are a bit thin so you can hear the neighbors), but all the important stuff (bathroom counter, bed -- basically anything you have to use or touch) is tidy and clean. Free snacks and DVD rentals at the front desk. We didn't use the pool but several families with kids seemed to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwil0ver
Reviews.Content: On our recent around the world trip we stayed at Magic Castle Hotel in Hollywood. From the moment we arrived (very early in the morning) the staff was extremely helpful and professional. We were close to the Walk of Fame, Kodak cinemas and only a short walk to subway stations. It's very close to the busy hub of Hollywood but we felt safe at all times even when we were out watching the shooting of a new movie, at the centre of the main area, late at night. Free and unlimited minibar was a hit with our teenage sons, breakfast was plentiful and afternoon goodies were always available. Rooms are basic but comfortable and clean and laundry facilities were verymuch appreciated. I would suggest to take the HOP on HOP off bus to get arround sightseeing, we went all the way to Santa Monica Beach which was a great day out.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: harfan
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here late November at the start of our 6 week US trip. I had researched accommodation extensively before our trip, and we were very happy with the Magic Castle, it was an excellent start to our holiday. The standout at this hotel is the staff, they were all amazing! They were always friendly and very helpful, it was the best service of any hotel we stayed in while in the US. I had requested a renovated one bedroom suite with balcony facing the pool, and that is exactly what we were given. The suite was really spacious, plenty of room for 3 people, and was very clean. The king bed was really comfortable, and our 15 year old said the sofa bed was one of the best she slept on. We had no problems with noise. Location was perfect, easy walk to Hollywood attractions, and we loved Runyon Canyon nearby. We hiked there 3 times, the views from the top are spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nicoleln
Reviews.Content: Great location...steps from walk of fame, kodack theatre, etc. Very close and convenient to travel from here via subway to places such as Universal Studios/City. Free snack bar 24hrs.... I think that amazingness speaks for itself. Very friendly staff who really know the area and what they are talking about. Heated pool...didn't test out the waters but enjoyed the portable heaters in the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Know your expectations before booking.”
Reviews.Author: Samantha41490
Reviews.Content: As I sit in the lobby after two nights here and look at the "Trip Advisor Certificate of Excellence" I'm wondering if it's my expectations of a hotel that's throwing me for a loop or?? EXCELLENT is the Staff... Every employee, every day, every hour is pleasant, accomadating, knowledgeable and friendly. They are the reason to stay, but even their service does not justify a nearly $200 price tag for a (somewhat) refurbished apartment. The doors and walls are scuffed, the carpet dirty, the vents, doors etc filthy. Better windows in the bedrooms would go a long way toward reducing the significant and unending traffic noise (or earplugs apron arrival) We changed rooms after a very uncomfortable first night to one that was more upgraded, but still with a stained sofa, scuffed furniture etc. It was a but quieter but not by much... The grounds are well kept and I think IF the room, which includes light breakfast but Not parking was in the $125 range I would see it as a value. But no.... Once again... Staff amazing but this place is what I would expect for a much less expensive hotel. Even in LA

Reviews.Title: “Facts about the Magic Castle Hotel and suites”
Reviews.Author: tonysenior
Reviews.Content: BEDS are King size and comfortable, you get dbl sheets with a â€œfeather duvetâ€� and 4 nice pillows ROOMS are kept Spotless and they do a turn down service with the classic mint on the pillow â€œnice touchâ€� LOCATION is within a short walk of Hollywood attractions, Walk of fame is a 3 minute walk away. PARKING is in the half basement and its 11$ a night STAFF is friendly and helpful in any way PRICES very reasonable a Suite is about half the price compared to a brand hotel in the area. POOL Clean and heated to a very comfortable Bathtub like degree Breakfast is included, and it is just the basics, but they keep the buffet area clean and welcoming Extras Free Snacks and free Dvdâ€™s brought to your room 24/7 Consider this when you decide to book a room at this hotel The Hotel is definitely charming, and I find that it is well maintained, I saw the builders quietly sneaking around with tools and new furniture so it seems like they are doing maintenance and upgrading of the Rooms in between bookings, the craftsmen are helpful and polite, and you hardly notice them sneaking around. Our first suite was located next to Franklin Ave, where the street noise is loud in the early mornings, and as far as I can tell there are five rooms at Franklin Ave, with street noise problems. If Noise is a problem for you, then I recommend that you make a note of this when you book your room In our case, and after the first night, we kindly requested to be moved to a different part of the Hotel, and The staff was very helpful, and straight away they got us a new suite in a quiet part of the hotel, and they even asked if they could help us by moving our luggage for us. After 11am They play music at the pool, and I found that it was too loud, and then itâ€™s kind of like a loop where you get to hear the same songs over and over, I have written a mail to the hotel about this, and I got a quick mail respond from Chief Operating Officer Darren Ross and here is a part of his answer <<<<<I will definitely be more sensitive with regard to the volume of the music so itâ€™s not heard in the rooms. â€�And With regard to the music; first of allâ€¦I agree, we should have more songs on the playlist to avoid the same songs being played over and over>>>>> I recommend this hotel My family and I will be frequent guests at the Magic Castle hotel, and I am already looking to book a room for my 2012 Easter vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrisRos
Reviews.Content: In real estate it's all about position position position. When traveling its all about Service Service Sevice and Magic Castle has both. The staff were wonderful, couldn't do enough for you and go out of their way to make your holiday easier. We stayed 3 nights went skiing for 5 nights then returned for another 2 nights. We were really looking forward to returning as it felt like home. Not only did they store some of our bags (no charge) when we returned there was a thank you note and a little gift from the management. Every morning they asked about our plans and next thing they had maps, timetables & journey plans for us. The location, just one block away from the walk of fame, Kodak theatre, metro station, etc, was perfect and the unit style rooms mean you have plenty of space. The free drinks and snacks were always appreciated and the continental breakfast was perfect. They made my son's day when he asked if they had Vegemite and of course they did. Very highly recommend, wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected - perfect for a long stay”
Reviews.Author: djfowler
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. I expected a hotel and found myself in a really roomy apartment. The place looks like a retro apartment building. Pool in the middle and rooms all around with balcony. The staff here are just great. They greet you with a complimentary drink and snack. In the evening they bring chocolates to your room with the next days weather report. You call down or ask the desk for anything and they bend over backwards. Rooms are large with dining table, kitchen and lounge as well as separate bedrooms. Plenty of cupboard space. This place is ideal for the longer stay or for families. I was there for work and found it perfect. You are right in the heart of Hollywood and in walking distance to everything - even the train. Plenty of restaurants in the area or a short cab fare away. The place is not slick and modern but it is comfortable and welcoming. Its also great value. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Porko
Reviews.Content: Great choice. The location was perfect and central to everything. Great place to stay for tourists as it is only one street back from Hollywood boulevarde. Short train ride to Universal Studios. We quite often approached hotel staff when we needed help with directions, bookings, etc and nothing was ever a problem. The rooms were very big and clean (we stayed in a one bedroom apartment), beds were comfortable. Endless supply of free drinks and snacks on hand whenever required. They woudl even deliver them to the room for you. Breakfast was continental - wide variety of cereal, fruit, yogurt, bread with spread, cakes etc. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: swoopbns
Reviews.Content: Actually saying Hotel is wrong. It is more like a 2 bedroom apartment with 2 bathrooms and a huge living room and a fully functioning Kitchen. Location is walking distance to the Hollywood strip. But the absolute best is the service. They will do anything for you. We mentioned we were thinking of going to disney really early and they offered to start the breakfast earlier then scheduled if we wanted. But they were correct the traffic was fine and we didn't need to. Free snacks. My daughters timed them 1 min and 16 secs from the time ordered to time delivered both times they ordered a bunch of snacks. Amazing. Only problem when my daughters came home they said this isn't home. The Magic Castle Hotel is. Met a lady there from Australia. Her second time staying at this Hotel. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend this place enough one of the best I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: flyingkiwi84
Reviews.Content: I could write pages on the Magic Castle Hotel the staff and added extras made this place. All the guys behind the desk were great but Nick in particular went out of his way to help us he was awesome and very approachable. The free snacks, movies, weather forecasts left on our pillow and all the other touches make this place amazing. If you're going to LA there is no where else you should look at. The rooms have everything you need and are very clean. HIGHLY recommend - go there

Reviews.Title: “Magic indeed!”
Reviews.Author: Josee D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from Jan. 30 to Feb 2 and was amazed by the service! I chose this hotel based on its excellent reviews on this very website, and I was glad I trusted the other users' advice. Very well located, one block from Hollywood Boulevard, close to a grocery store, a gym and a drugstore, and to the Chinese Theater where all the city tours start. We were given a room upgrade (from a single to a suite) at no extra cost. Lovely, lovely staff - thank you to all of them, who treated us so well. Amazing selection of free snacks and complimentary (and healthy) breakfast. I will definitely recommend this hotel and go there again myself!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff compensate for basic interiors in self-catering units”
Reviews.Author: GlobalFamily
Reviews.Content: The five of us (two adults, three kids 5-11) stayed in a two-bedroom unit for five nights over Christmas. + The staff were genuinely warm, welcoming, and helpful + The breakfast (continental but ample) and free snacks policy was a big winner - even though we had the full kitchen it was easy just to use the breakfasts available rather than preparing every morning + The pool was warm (it was December!) and great for those "We've had a full day with the kids and they still have energy while we're exhausted" moments + The location was great - while walking the one block to get some things from the pharmacy we found ourselves standing on the Hollywood Walk of Fame! - The furnishings in the room are fairly basic, a bit worn, and while clean, not in great condition. If Magic Castle were to invest in a refurbishment this could be an excellent hotel, especially for those who value having a kitchen so that they don't have to worry about searching for a restaurant, hoping the kids keep it together for the meal, and paying the price to dine out.

Reviews.Title: “best in la”
Reviews.Author: bemy
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights before xmas in 1 bedroom suite nothing but praise for this hotel room staff are simply the best will stay again jeff

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Mikael J
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Magic Castle three times total, the last time now in january -2012. It's the best hotel i have ever stayed at in L.A/Hollywood (even in the US actually). The hotel is great, but what really makes it stand out is the guys who work there. They make the place awesome! I have never experienced such service before at any other hotel. Free wifi and breakfast is a plus. Good parking to (10 bucks a day or something like that), always available spots in the garage or right outside the hotel. This is my 1st choice when I'm in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Magic Castle!”
Reviews.Author: Eve H
Reviews.Content: Due to all the rave reviews, I was really excited about staying at the Magic Castle and I was not disappointed. My family thought the name of the place made it sound like I'd booked some zany, dodgy, weird place but they soon saw it was welcoming, clean and comfortable and were very impressed with all the little extras like the champagne and chocolates in our room on New Year's Eve. Breakfast by the pool was really pleasant or you can take it up to your room if you choose. For 3 nights the 4 of us managed fine in a spacious 1br unit with our teenage daughters sharing the pull-out couch but I'd book a 2br for a longer stay. It was a brilliant location for a 3 day stop-over in LA. On our first day we just walked around the corner and we saw the sights of Hollywood Blvd and jumped on a cheesy but fun tour of celebrity homes and had dinner at Mel's Diner. It was really crowded trying to take photos next to the the stars but because Magic Castle was so close we came back early before breakfast one morning so every one in the family could get a clear shot with their favourite star!! The 2nd day, just around the corner again, we hopped on the HopOn/Hop Off bus and went to Santa Monica. Easy and entertaining stroll to Venice Beach and back again. Back on the bus just enjoying the sights of different LA neighbourhoods. The next day, just around the corner again, we hopped on the subway train to spend a fabulous day at Universal Studios. Every time we came back to the Magic Castle we were welcomed with offers of snacks, hot apple cider etc.. It was really nice. The only negative, as others have mentioned, was some car noise on the road all night ..our daughters couldn't hear it at all from the lounge room but it bothered my husband and I somewhat in the bedroom... if you are a light sleeper you might want ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay.....”
Reviews.Author: Mayaelena
Reviews.Content: Going out to L.A. for a family wedding, the family stayed at this establishment. The staff treats you as their own family. Snacks and soft drinks are complimentary. The rooms surround an outdoor swimming pool. Our room was like an apartment with a bedroom, dining room area, living room and kitchen. Well worth the money! We were blocks away from Hollywood Blvd, stores, restaurants and tour buses. The hotel was immaculate. It was like being at home.

Reviews.Title: “Magical, indeed!”
Reviews.Author: bostonia-a
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled in to the hotel, we were wooed and wowed. My wife and I were traveling with my sister-in-law and her two young children. When we made the reservation, we mentioned we had an infant. Upon checking in, the desk agent came to the car with sparkling lemonade as a toast to our arrival! The hotel room was wonderful -- simple but clean. The staff had put a crib with bath toys and baby soap in the bedroom and turned up the heat -- a sweet, thoughtful gesture that totally charmed us! Like everyone else has said, the staff and service are amazing. Bend-over-backwards accommodating. I'll be honest, I was apprehensive about some Hollywood/LA snootiness -- not here. Everyone was friendly and personable -- and clearly liked kids. From the never-ending snacks and drinks to the DVDs, the heated pool, the amazing breakfast, and delivery recommendations, this place was custom-made for family travel. It was a relief to come back after a day of sight seeing to collapse in the pool after noshing on snacks. Can I move in?

Reviews.Title: “Magic location & service”
Reviews.Author: FitzySyd
Reviews.Content: As so many readers have noted, the service here is outstanding. The staff are almost magical in anticipating your every thought. The rooms are spacious, the pool warm and inviting, the snacks ensure the children are considered and the breakfast is well received. The rooms themselves are quite dated and if you want opulence or modern fit outs, this is not the place for you. However, if you want a warm reception, great location and room to spread out, the Magic Castle is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: kate h
Reviews.Content: I never get round to writing any reviews, but this hotel is amazing! i stayed here in August with 3 family members, and it couldn't have been better! The staff were so friendly and welcomed us with homemade lemonade and throughout the stay you are welcome to any snacks or drinks you would like. They were helpful with arranging tours round LA and recommended restaurants and places to go! We only stayed here for two nights but i would definitely stay here next time! The 24 hour pool was amazing, and there were always fresh towels waiting and floats and beach balls for children. The hotel was so close to shops, attractions and easy access to everywhere. The hotel was definitely 10 out of 10! Although our flight back to Las Vegas wasn't till the afternoon, they kindly looked after our bags whilst we went out, and let us eat our lunch by the pool and we were still able to have the snacks they kindly offered! Also, the cucumber water wsa refreshing and a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Return trip ...”
Reviews.Author: AJD57
Reviews.Content: The final five days of this years trip were spent at the Magic Castle - again. It was like arriving to stay with dear old friends. The amenities at the Magic Castle continue at their traditionally very high standard - breakfast, rooms, laundry, pool and on and on - absolutely nothing to whinge about. Notwithstanding the quality of the facilities and the amenities the very best thing about the Magic Castle are the staff - one and all. There are some new people there since our last trip and some have gone but the absolute common thing about the staff is that they are the Magic Castle! It may sound trite to say but going back to the Magic Castle is like going to see some really good friends. The absolute worst thing about the Magic Castle is having to leave. We'll be back - again ...

Reviews.Title: “Another very satisfied customer!”
Reviews.Author: WernerZ
Reviews.Content: Well, my wife thinks the Magic Castle was the nicest hotel in terms of service quality that we have ever stayed at. Nice work Tripadvisor and reviewers! Nice refreshments at check-in, nice big room(s!), and great location for checking out the sights around Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood with the family”
Reviews.Author: Missysperson
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay over New Year's Eve. We had tickets to see Wicked at the Pantages and wanted to stay in Hollywood. This location is close to the Metro and the Pantages is across the street from the Metro so that worked out well. The hotel is in need of remodeling. It is kept clean but the furnishings are shabby. The hotel staff are terrific and will help with everything. We had wanted to cook while we were there but the kitchens are not fully equipped and we had to scrounge for pots and pans along with some plates and bowls. I thought the place was overall average but because of the location and the terrific staff I gave them a very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large suite, what more could we want? We got it!”
Reviews.Author: whitesnowflakecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of a 5 week visit to the US and could not have been happier. The suite was huge, large living dining, kitchen and separate bedroo with king sized bed. The included breakfast was more than adequate and constantly replenished. The laundry facilities were much appreciated and they only charged $1.25 for a wash and the same for drying plus gave us the washing liquid at no charge. Fabulous location, central to everything. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: djmarshall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our world trip and found it to be an awesome place. Great value and excellent service, central location and very accommodating. Will definately stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and heaven for kids”
Reviews.Author: therudies86
Reviews.Content: All the positive comments are spot on. The hotel is old and a little tired but none of this matters with wonderful staff and generous inclusions. The kids thought they were in paradise when told of the free, unlimited and extensive snacks available and DVDs for free use. I loved the weather and chocolate service, free newspaper delivered each morning and no expectation of any tips. A full laundry with washing liquid provided was icing on the cake for a weary traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cairnsgurl
Reviews.Content: With only a couple of days to spend in LA, we wanted a place that was right in the action, and we certainly got it with The Magic Castle Hotel. It was a very short walk to the main strip (where you can see the Chinese Theatre, the Star walk etc) and numerous restaurants and shops. The location was great, the rooms were massive, (especially after spending the days previous in New York and Tokyo hotels!) and the pool is heated. They also provide breakfast each morning, which you can take by the pool. The staff at the Magic Castle could not do enough to help us. We were trying to book our rooms from Tokyo, with a funny borrowed laptop, and the staff were very accommodating with my numerous requests. On arrival, they answered every query we had, gave us great recommendations and tips, and when we got to our room there was a birthday cake and balloons for my husband, along with a handwritten card! What a beautiful touch! They also recommended that we try a restaurant up on the hill (can't remember what it was called), and their recommendation was spot on - delicious! They also arranged to drive us up there, and collect us once we were finished, and even arranged for an entree to be sent to us on them. Would very very happily stay there again. With people in our group ranging from 24-60, everyone was happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magic”
Reviews.Author: BaliBarbara
Reviews.Content: What amazing service- It truly is exceptional and such a delight to experience. Our family of five stayed for 4 nights between Xmas and New Year. The hotel was clearly very busy and even so everyone was so friendly and literally couldnt do enough to assist and make us feel welcome. When asking for directions to the Lakers game on our first night,not only was a map printed for us but detailed directions given, even down to which platform to wait for the train on- thanks Zee!,We have travelled a lot throughout the world and the service at the Magic Castle stands out as the best ever. Well down to all the staff and managment for creating such a special place-you are 'magic'

Reviews.Title: “Simply 'Magic'”
Reviews.Author: Daveb88
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom apartment during December. The staff were fantastic and willing to help you, they organized / made arrangements when necessary and no job seemed to hard, they were very organized with cards showing directions to every attraction you could possibly think of. We loved our room, very spacious clean and presentable, the King size bed was very comfortable and loved having the kitchen and dining area. Loved the free snacks and soda offered to guests (unlimited) which you can get from Reception, there is also a good list of DVD's to borrow. The hotel is only a 3 - 4 minute walk from Hollywood Blvd near the Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre and Hollywood & Highland offering plenty of things to do, eat and see. I have never stayed at a hotel with such friendly staff. Nothing is too hard for them and they genuinely gave us the impression that they wanted to make our stay an enjoyable one. You must stay at this hotel, I would definately come back and stay again if we come back.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have ever stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessie P
Reviews.Content: From the welcoming lemonade when we arrived, to the complimentary snacks, DVDs, and gym passes (and of course the constant stream of hot apple cider and cookies!), the Magic Castle Hotel was the best hotel we have ever stayed at with the best service we have ever experienced. Even when my partner forgot his suit jacket and tie for the Magic Castle Club (it has a very strict dress code!), Jason at the front desk offered the clothes off his back and then left a bottle of red wine in our room when we came back from the Club! A perfect location in Hollywood, lovely rooms and the best hotel staff in the world - this is a MUST stay for everyone visiting LA. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Better Service...”
Reviews.Author: buddog245
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Magic Castle a few nights over Christmas week. If you're looking for a new, modern type experience, the Magic Castle will disappoint. If however you're okay with an older style hotel, no reason to look further than the Magic Castle. The staff is the best we have ever experienced. The location is totally central (other than for the beach). The room, we had the one bedroom suite, has everything you'd need and extra space. And, the Magic Castle provides free parking, snacks and soda. After staying at the Magic Castle, you will question why other hotels don't follow their model of service and value. Well done, Magic Castle! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Magic Castle !”
Reviews.Author: stephen c
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle Hotel came highly recommended to us and we are so glad we stayed there. The staff were excellent in every way - nothing was too much trouble and they went out of their way to make our stay one to remember. The rooms were clean and welcoming - the breakfasts very pleasant by the pool, the free snacks, hot cider and biscuits very handy late at night. We were first timers in Los Angeles and the hotel seemed very well placed to make the most of Hollywood attractions. AAA+

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely magical!”
Reviews.Author: brantosl
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely deserves the credit it gets on Tripadvisor! It's not cheap...but then again what is in Hollywood? This is a fairly small hotel that makes you feel like a guest not just a room number. From the warm welcome where they personally walk you to your room and the tray of cookies and cider in the lobby to the complete and complimentary snack list (i.e. you want a coke and a kit kat just ask!) this place takes care of your every need. The rooms are spacious we had a 1 bedroom king with a large flat screen and pullout that was perfect for the kids in the living room. The bathtub had jets to make up for no hot tub but the heated pool was great and is open 24h. Really close (1 block walk) to Graumann's Chinese or Kodak theatres) so its nice to leave your car here (my only complaint is $11/d parking charge). Kudos to the hotel for the nice cupcake and balloons they arranged for my daughter's birthday. All in all so much good any complaints are very minor details that certainly don't take away from how pleased we were with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LA Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Melinda3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights-Dec.3rd-10th. We upgraded our room to the one bedroom suite and were very glad we did. Everything was clean. Front desk staff was very helpful. It was a great central location to see the sights. Loved being able to walk to Hollywood Blvd. with entertainment, shopping and restaurants close by. Would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: I shall always appreciate the welcome and friendliness of the staff members right from when I arrived, nothing was to much trouble and only to willing to help in any way possible. The team at the hotel can be very proud of what they do and I cant say a big enough thank you to them. Fully reccomend at stay here and so central to Hollywood.........Thanx Magic Castle Team Dave M New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and welcoming place to stay in the middle of hollywood”
Reviews.Author: brissiechris
Reviews.Content: Our family loved our stay at the magic castle. We were in a 2 room apartment which gave us plenty of room to spread out and relax. The apartment was quite old, and we got a lot of noise from the road, but the furnishings were comfortable. The best thing about the Magic castle is the staff - they are welcoming, very informed - lots of great information about how to get around - and made sure that our visit was as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. The magic castle offered free breakfast - cold cereals, coffee, a reasonable selection of fruit and warm pastries. Our family could pick and choose from healthy options to the full-blown candy-cereal experience, so everyone was happy. we appreciated the free snacks available 24hrs and we did stock up on crackers and cookies for our day trips. We had a great visit

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and welcoming staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: BusinessGuide
Reviews.Content: Very much impressed by warm welcome, very convenient and secure parking under the building. Very spacious and clean apartment about 5 minutes walk from the bustling Hollywood Blvd. Amazing feeling of being home. Andrey and Stella

Reviews.Title: “best place in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Dragoon2009
Reviews.Content: I have been coming here for over 8 years now and it gets better every time. From the Prosecco to the Cucumber Water, you wont find another place even close to this in comfort and customer service. Ms Crookes is anticipating a frequent guest program and I am sure it will be different than the chains. This is a family hotel and you feel like home when you check in. The entire staff is A1 - no kidding - ready to help you do whatever. Park the car and walk, suites are HUGE and well equipped. There is a new Fresh and Easy grocery under the LA Fitness 2 min walk - and a plethora of Kodak Theater elements for entertainment. Its a family place and the pool doesn't close at 10 like everybody else.

Reviews.Title: “Where else would you stay.”
Reviews.Author: Runaustralia
Reviews.Content: Our 2br was ready even though we arrived early 10am after a long flight from Australia.The rooms are very comfortable and all 5 of us had ample room.(lighting can be improved)Service by all is second to none! Thankyou! Some comment that it is a 5 min walk to Hollywood Blv but it's hardly a 2 min walk.So positions perfect.Would not hesitate recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Lil-Barthy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first leg of the trip. We arrived early and the room wasn't ready yet but the staff were so friendly. They held our bags for us and offered us some nice cool drinks. Once we checked into the room we were surprised at how big it was. We stayed in room 208 and I would stay in that room again. It was nice, clean, quiet and very spacious. The continnental breakfast was yummy, and they always had fresh cuccumber drink when you returned to the hotel. We didnt take advantage of the free snacks, but it was nice to know they were there. You had to request these from the front office. They werent in your room. The hotel is about a 5 min walk to Hollywood Boulevard. We hired a car and the car parking was about $11 a day. They didnt charge us for the car parking..I offered but the guy said don't worry about it. So I said I want to leave the money for the car parking as a tip for the housekeepers as they were fantastic. Each night there was a mint on your pillow and the next days weather forecast.. just a nice little touch. The price and location make this hotel great value for money and the staff and so friendly and extremely helpful! We didnt get a chance to check out the Magic Castle restuarant - we will do that next time. I highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Star Quality”
Reviews.Author: HelloGeoffers
Reviews.Content: This place lives up to the hype. These are converted apartments and so are designed for living in, spacious and comfortable if a little dated. What really makes this place special is the service and the added extras that you just don't get elsewhere for this kind of money. The staff are genuinely friendly and helpful and we got a great level of service from everyone we dealt with. Starting with the receptionists who gave us a great orientation at the start, were very patient when I couldn't get the room DVD player working and gave us a free late check-out, to the maids who really went the extra mile with the cleaning, even doing our washing up for us. The added extras were a nice surprise. They offer a free min-bar for drinks, chocolate and munchies. You can choose from an extensive list of DVDs to watch in the rooms. The parking is free and right beneath the hotel. The cold buffet breakfast is included in the room price and is fairly decent. You can eat it at tables by the pool but we preferred to eat it on our pool side balcony which was fine. If I was being picky then I would say that a couple of things in the living room could have done with updating. The couch was a little worn and the TV in the lounge which was as old as the hotel itself (there was a large flat screen LCD in the bedroom so no big deal). That said, the rooms are well equiped, everything was provided for and worked well, the bedroom nicely done and bed amazingly comfortable. Other stuff........Location great. Very clean. Pool is small but well heated for late season swimming. I wouldn't hesitate in recomending this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not a wonderful place -- there are better”
Reviews.Author: gwhizrd
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel used to be an apartment building that was converted into a hotel. It's an odd lay out and there aren't any elevators so pack light if you want your baggage in your room. The bed in our room was rock hard (not kidding). A person could break a tailbone if they weren't careful when sitting down. Room wasn't especially clean. There are way better places to stay in LA, but if you just gotta stay in Hollywood it's probably a decent alternative to the high priced hotels in the area. We were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “HOLLYWOOD'S GREATEST ILLUSION”
Reviews.Author: Gary C
Reviews.Content: Magic Castle should not be rated # 2 out of 292 hotels in Los Angeles. No way. It is definately NUMBER ONE. My new bride and I stayed three nights Nov 22 to Nov 25th/11...loved the welcoming attitude of the staff - where else do they come out from behind the counter to toast your arrival! The night we checked in we found balloons, a chocolate cake, two glasses AND a bottle of wine complete with a personalized Congratulations card!!! Only beef was the firmness of the pillows (I prefer less fluffy) but by the time we were checking out they had provided me EIGHT pillows, more than enough to make me comfortable!!! What other place offers a free minibar list and free DVDs to boot! Throughly enjoyed the very clean, heated pool and the walking convenience 4 minutes to Hollywood Blvd. Very convenient, and easy to access parking garage. We left our car there and walked over to Jimmy Kimmel Live taping and another day left our car to ride the Subway to Universal. A little misleading in that we thought the hotel was part of the Magic Castle itself when in fact it is adjacent in what appeared to be an old apartment builiding. All in all, not at all disappointed though. Even though there's no fitness center they set us up one block away at LA Fitness; nice touch! The building across the way out back decided to run a loud carpet steam cleaner hose out their back door at 8 in the morning, but that was not something the Magic Castle had any control over. Fantastic, incredible sized rooms with TWO large televisions! Full kitchen. Fabulous water pressure in the shower. USA Today on the doorstep every morning and complimentary muffins, toast, tea, juice etc each morning poolside. The staff seemed to remember me every time they bumped into me! We think they really mean it when they say "sorry to see you leave". Gary and Andrea

Reviews.Title: “Great introduction to LA!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn F
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Magic Castle Hotel. It was only one block away from the Chinese Theatre/hollywood boulevard so great location for a start. But even better was the fantastic staff and service. Everyone was so helpful and friendly. The complimentary snacks and coffees etc were just a really special touch and make a really big difference, as does the free wi-fi. We were given a beautiful, large, newly refurbished room which we loved. We would definitely stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and value”
Reviews.Author: Winterbourne
Reviews.Content: The staff really goes the extra mile here. The breakfast buffet is generous, the location is good if you want to be near Hollywood Blvd, and the parking is inexpensive and convenient. The common areas have a lot of old-Hollywood charm, although the back area and our suite could use some remodeling. The bedroom was up to date and cushy, though, and we really appreciated the touches you usually expect from more standard hotels, like bathrobes, local magazines, LA Times, coffee maker. Overall, pleasantly quirky with a historical feel.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, good location, great service. Rooms are a tad old though...”
Reviews.Author: Pisces_82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights and all was good. Only gripe was tt e rooms though big, were a little old and showing its age. Creaky cabinets, chipping paintwork, tt sort of thing. It's not wheelchair accessible either, so dun lug huge and heavy luggages here, lest u get rooms on e 2nd or 3rd floor. If you r into shopping, might wanna consider staying near the 3rd st promenade instead. More buzz, shopping and dining options there. Could get a night's stay in e holiday inn there at a lower price too... Better value, IMHO.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Suites”
Reviews.Author: LouiseACT
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located closed to the Chinese Theatre with shops, subway and bus line all close. We found the hotel staff went out of their way to welcome us. The breakfast was great and the help yourself snacks at the front desk were greatly appreciated. Our family stayed in the apartments which were well appointed and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “A must-stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: AGL2309
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to California to celebrate 20yrs together. When we arrived at the Hotel they greeted us with a smile and updated us to a Suite. The room was perfect, homely and comfortable with lots of room. A special surprise for us was to find a congratulatory card signed personally by the Hotel staff with a beautifully boxed chocolate cake for our anniversary. It was a very special touch and I immediately felt great about the place. In fact it's the personal touches that make this place so perfect - complimentary snacks whenever you need them, turn-down service, and a friendly breakfast set-up poolside each morning. The Hotel is in a great location, just a simple walk down the street and you're on looking at the Hollywood Stars! It also has a very 'Melrose Place' feel - cool and relaxed, and a bit nostalgic. This place would be great with children too as they have a good sized heated pool. Be sure to book, it's great in every way.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: emma_donnelly
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for 2 nights on the 16th and 17th of November 2011 as part of our 2 week trip of the USA for our honeymoon and we couldn't have been happy with the overall experience we had at The Magic Castle. The location is amazing. One road back from Hollywood Boulevard and if you have car very easy to access all of LA. Also FREE PARKING. The complimentary breakfast is awesome and the free snacks and DVDs are just great, something we have never experienced anyway in the world. The room we had was massive and for how old the hotel is it was absolutely fabulous!! Now most importantly the staff are ABSOLUTELY fantastic! I had a few issues with a my Visa and with the help of Zeeshan & the staff on that morning it was easily organised and able to be sorted all there and we were able to enjoy the rest of our trip. Of all the places we have stayed the service here is above anything we have experienced! Thanks to all the staff at the Magic Castle. I can not recommend this hotel enough!! :) :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Value.. great Service and Parking!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrixStone
Reviews.Content: As many have mentioned, the location of this hotel is very convenient for walking down to Hollywood Blvd by just walking down Orange Ave. The hotel is quiet and quaint. Yes, it is old and a little worn but clean. The staff is very helpful, cordial, professional, and will do anything they can to help ensure your stay is enjoyable. Also, great about this place is it has underground parking.. Parking is a premium in LA / Hollywood so don't discount this hotel feature. The only downside was the bed which was hard but i would not let it stop you from staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't rave enough about this place!”
Reviews.Author: collarfamily
Reviews.Content: If you go to Hollywood, you have to stay here! We were travelling with our 2 kids 5 and 8. The rooms are huge, though not brand new or anything flash, this place was our kids and our favourite place to stay during our entire 6 week trip to the states! We were all made to feel so special by the staff! The kids loved them and my daughter ever drew a picture to give to the lovely lady on reception when we left. They loved the free drinks and snacks at reception and we loved the 'local' knowledge from the staff on everything from transport to family friendly restaurants etc. Amazing, amazing, this is what I call customer service....you love the vibe so much, the breakfast, that you overlook the flaws in the accommodation rooms (not that we could pick anything!) They have an onsite laundry which is handy and walk over to Hollywood Boulevard. We would definately come back and stay here again. Thank you everyone there it was the perfect end to the time in your country!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly friendly staff, great location, big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: totino20
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying here and were so happy with the wonderful service. The free mini bar snacks are great for when you need a little bite to eat. The continental breakfast is convenient, not the most amazing food, it's all pretty sugary stuff besides the fruit, but good to get you started for the day. The location is great, about 2 min walk from Hollywood highlands (the major tourist spots in Hollywood). The staff are always ready and more than happy to assist on any way. The bed was sooooo comfortable, we slept so well! The rooms are a little dated and sort of smell like an old apartment, but they are spacious and clean and that's what counts! there is also a kitchenette, although we didn't use that. So summarize, this is a great place to stay if you want to feel welcome and taken care of!!

Reviews.Title: “Saved my trip”
Reviews.Author: heattvc15
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel Ocober 17th after a night in Las Vegas, where I came down with the worst head cold I've had in years. By the time we checked in, I was a walking zombie. The front desk noticed right away that I was not well, helped me with our luggage, and went out for medication. THANK YOU Z, Kristin,and Marcus. They even made dinner reservations, for that night and our night at the castle. The room was perfect, we snagged a balcony and ate breakfast there each morning. The location was perfect for first time visitors to LA, lots of sight seeing within walking distance. And secure parking! We also loved the free snacks and drinks - at any time we asked! We would not stay anywhere else no matter what we were offered - this place could not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, 1 block away from Hollywood Blvd”
Reviews.Author: Jasmineo84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work and was a pleasantly surprised. The service was perfect, rooms were well equipped with a full kitchen and living area. I enjoyed their snack menu they had and the complimentary glass of lemonade on arrival. The hotel isn't the SLS or Andaz but is in my opinion the best location and value for money. This is my second stay in Los Angeles and can't wait to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Hollywood. Different Than I Expected.”
Reviews.Author: Durwoody
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on the rave reviews from Trip Advisor. They were spot on about the excellent location and the wonderful service provided by ALL the hotel employees. From all the rave reviews I was expecting a really beautiful hotel. This hotel seems to actually have been an older apartment complex that was converted to a hotel.
