The rooms themselves are like a small apartment. The furniture is older and well used, but maintained okay, but seemed kind of bare bones. The sofa was really saggy. There was a small kitchen with dining table and chairs. Bath products were the Taracco brand which is wonderful. We had a room with a balcony, but there is NO privacy. The balcony overhangs the pool and you could have a conversation with your neighbors without shouting because they are so close. It is a small complex of rooms. The hotel seemed pretty secure with access mainly through the garage or the front lobby doors only. The housekeeping service prior to us being checked in was not too great because there were spider webs hanging from the ceiling and on the walls. The garage was great. They charge about $11 per night, but it is steel door gated and accessible only with the insertion of a room key...very safe. The "mini-bar" , which is free, is not in the room. I kept looking for it when we arrived. They provide you with a list, you just them what you want and they give it to you at the front desk. The hotel itself is about 2 blocks from Guaiman's Chinese Theater and the Hollywood walk of stars. Be sure to ask the front desk personnel about recommendations for eating, sight-seeing, etc. We were there when there was a movie premiere and Twilight stars putting their hand prints in the cement. Needless to say, there were a lot of Twilight fans during this time, but it did not stop you from getting anywhere UNLESS you wanted to drive down that particular section of the street. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for the wonderful service provided by the friendly staff, security and prime location. The hotel itself is only average, but if you know that going in, your expectations will be realistic.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the others when visiting Hollywood! Stay at Magic Castle!”
Reviews.Author: Hutcho2033
Reviews.Content: For our Honeymoon, my newly wed wife and I stayed here for our first few nights in Hollywood. We booked it as it seemed quirky and was much cheaper than the more "famous" and "glamorous" hotel opposite the Chinese Theatre that we stayed at for the next half of our Hollywood stay. We can honestly say that if we had our time over again, we would definitely stay at the Magic Castle over the other one any day! Upon arrival, we were welcomed by Nick who would have to be one of the nicest and most helpful hotel employees we'd met over our month long stay in the US. When we entered our not plush but very clean and comfortable "home", we found they had given us a complimentary bottle of wine, desert and a lovely wedding congrats message. You'd be surprised how many of the big and more popular hotels didn't do this throughout our trip. As others have said, their breakfast is free and is awesome. Cerial, pastries, juices, fruit... More than you could ask for. They also freely offer you free snacks throughout your stay. Thanks for the Peanut M&M, Nick! Free hire of a great list of DVD's, Very helpful travel tips and never too busy to help you with anything you require. Nick advised us to visit Yamashiro Japanese restaurant thats located on the hill behind them. We did have dinner there, and were very glad we had. Strongly recommend it if you have time. So, if you're after a Hollywood stay with a hotel that has more value, personality, helpful employees, intimacy with thier customers and close vicinity to Hollywood Boulavard than the others, stay at the Magic Castle!!

Reviews.Title: “Special place. Welcoming and fun.”
Reviews.Author: BradleyMom_2011
Reviews.Content: I had thought of staying in a chain hotel for predictability, but decided to roll the dice on a more boutique type hotel, and am SO glad I did. My great experience at the Magic Castle will probably change my attitudes about small independent hotels vs chains for all my travel choices in future. So much more fun, personal, friendly, and a little bit of an adventure. I stayed at the Magic Castle with my 5-year-old daughter a year ago, to vist friends in LA and go to Disneyland. I just came across some souvenirs as I was cleaning out a drawer and I realized I never reviewed it.. We had a wonderful time. The staff made my daughter feel like a princess, everyone had both a strong service mentality but also a fun demeanor. The pool area was low key and friendly, with snacks as a bonus. The room was very comfortable and had everything we needed (more like a stylish simple, comfortable apartment), and the location was perfect for us. It has a kind of "mid-century style meets fantasy castle meets cool nice people in the 21st century" vibe. We loved it. Special place.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Wow!!! What a staff!!”
Reviews.Author: 13shelley13
Reviews.Content: I was REALLY nervous about visiting Hollywood. My daughter and I were in town for the NEDA convention and stayed here at the Magic Castle. It was amazing from the minute we were dropped off from the airport!! We were there about 3 hours before check-in time, but they graciously offered us snacks, drinks and checked to see if a room was available. They got one ready and we were checked in!! Lisa, Nick, and the rest of the staff were amazingly helpful throughout our 3 day stay. From helping with restaurant recommendations to scheduling our shuttle back to the airport! We walked everywhere!! The hotel itself is so charming, even though it is rather old. It is very well maintained. I would trade the luxury of the fancy hotel down the street for the customer servie we received at Magic Castle. If I ever return to Hoolywood, this is where we will stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “A real little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Gl0betr0tterAnnie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on a girls USA road trip and can honestly say this is one of my favourite hotels I have ever stayed in. I booked online with the hotel direct and from the first contact to book right through to waving goodbye upon leaving the service was never anything short of first class. We chose a one bedroom suite and with 4 girls sharing this was ideal. The suite was huge with a massive lounge/dining area, large kitchen and equally large bedroom. The place was spotlessly clean and nothing was too much hassle. We only had enough towels for two people but a quick call down to reception and the extra towels were with us in less than 2 mins! The staff here are one in a million and nothing is too much trouble. They made reservations for us, advised on where best to go for a night out and one of our party stayed on their own one day as the others were taking a trip, they made sure she was well looked after and gave her great advice on places to go to fill her day. Upon arrival you know straight away that this is quite a different hotel to the norm - the free 'mini-bar' at reception was fantastic with a huge choice of drinks sweets and snacks for free 24hrs a day. The free ice-lollies by the pool was also a lovely touch.(the staff even insisted on giving us a bag of goodies to take with us for our journey when we checked out!!) There is no restaurant in the hotel however the lady on the front desk provided us with take-out menus and helped us to order food in. The main advice I can give anyone who stays here is to ask the main desk to try to book you for dinner at the exclusive adjoining 'Magic Castle Club' Dinner was slightly pricey however we had a fantastic meal and this also grants you entry to the Magic shows which were out of this world and a definite highlight to our trip. Location is great and if you're looking for somewhere a bit different with great value for money in the heart of Hollywood then I cannot recommend this place enough. It truly was magic by name and magic by nature!

Reviews.Title: “Great, family run business that cares for customers”
Reviews.Author: Penny M
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this hotel by chance, and what a find! All the staff were very attentive, without being pushy. The location is first class, walking distance (5 mins) to Hollywood Walk of Fame. This also gives really easy access to tour buses. We decided not to use a tour bus, but to do it ourselves. The hotel took the time to find out what we wanted, and helped to sort out a route. Overnight parking was only a few dollars, breakfast was continental and plentiful. Don't think this hotel is pristine, it could do with some TLC, but the staff more than make up for the scuff marks on the walls. An example of the little touches that make the difference, the day we left (early to drive to San Francisco) we were asked if we had taken breakfast. As we had already had breakfast, we were then given sweets, crisps and drinks for the journey. How many hotels would do that!! It makes a holiday to be greeted with a smile each day, and this hotel certainly helped to make our holiday - thank you.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: lopernc
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle Hotel is such a fun place to stay if you want to be in walking distance to Hollywood. Our suite was very large, clean and comfortable. The people who work there are so friendly and helpful. Everyday there is a delicious free breakfast which includes pastries, yogurt, fruit, cereal, beverages, etc. Want a diet coke or a snack, just go to the desk and ask. While staying at the hotel you can make reservations at the Magic Castle which is a lot of fun! The hotel is just a couple of blocks from the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Kodak Theater, shopping and many other activities. Jason and Z were our greeters when we arrived and they set the tone for our week. If you are expecting a 5 star hotel then you should not go here but if you friendly, fun, clean, free Wi-Fi, free parking, free snacks and location then you have found the place for a couple or a family with children.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it .... you won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: LicoriceLegs
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on recommendation from my niece & husband who have stayed there 3 times. So glad we listened! We loved everything about the Magic Castle Hotel & highly recommend it for many reasons. We arrived at a horrible hour of the morning, around 5.30am & were pleasantly surprised when we were offered a room to have a lie down & freshen up which we did until our rooms were ready. Just having that offered to us was pretty special as were were totally stuffed from our long flight & the thought of having to hang around waiting for the correct check-in was quite daunting. The breakfast on offer is totally fulfilling, with around the clock snacks on offer - never before have we found this type of service! An offhand mention of needing a coffee led to one of the staff surprising us with a tray of freshly brewed coffee right to our door! This hotel is so pleasant, the staff are so accommodating, and like my niece, they are top of my list for hotels in LA. Thankyou for being so attentive. The location is great .. I really can't fault the Magic Castel Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in which I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: am84
Reviews.Content: I think the title says it all. Amazing hospitality that cannot be captured in words. The staff went above and beyond to ensure that our honeymoon was nothing short of spectacular, complete with wine, balloons, and cake upon our arrival. The rooms are actually spacious apartments that are clean, neat, and comfy. The location is a 5 minute walk from Hollywood Boulevard, putting you right in the middle of all the action. If you stay anywhere else while in LA, you are truly doing yourself a disservice. Thank you, Magic Castle Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location.”
Reviews.Author: biancargl
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 days, huge room, very well located hotel (2 blocks from Chinese theater, drugstore and market a street away). Could use new towels. Good breakfast. Minibar for free (more than 20 items, just choose and ask the front door staff - watch the calories!!). Overall, a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Really couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: porkgrill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle as part of our West Coast drive, and really didn't know what to expect of California, especially Los Angeles. However, our stay there could not have been made easier or more enjoyable then by staying here. Deceiving from the outside, the hotel boasts wonderful facilities including a pool, fantastic sized rooms with all mod cons, underground parking (which is a gift, believe me), WiFi - The location is perfect for all the Hollywood landmarks (Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre, Hollywood Sign), and in terms of value, its a steal. The general staff were also exceptional, always willing to help and polite and approachable, but the icing on the cake is surely in Darren Ross, who is the General Manager. Darren took time out from his busy day to chat with us about a variety of things, but more importantly to give sound advice and recommendations which only enhanced our holiday all the more. Darren suggested that we try the wonderful Japanese place just up the hill, which was a wonderful evening. Without him, and The Magic Castle, our stay in LA would have been all the poorer for the experience. This place is a little gem you really would be mad to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: AlohaLadyHonolulu
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is an amazing little hotel just off Hollywood Boulevard. It's within easy walking distance to the Hollywood attractions and right next to the Magic Castle Club. The rooms are spartan, but very clean and have lots of space. The best thing about the hotel was the wonderful staff who were so very, very accomodating. The service is excellent and the fun and entertainment at the Magic Castle was absolutely amazing. I highly recommend this place if you want to be in Hollywood and have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Best service.”
Reviews.Author: bhavana_praveen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is supposed to be a 100 odd year old castle, so they seem to have retained quite a few things ,the service and the staff members were so obliging and so polite, the rooms were huge with a kitchenette too......I definitely had a great stay here,it is just one street away to the Hollywood walk of fame except for there are no bell boys and no elevator and we had to carry all our luggages . Breakfast was complementary,the minibar is unlimited and complimentary too.not an usual hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle is Magic!”
Reviews.Author: JulzieJ1
Reviews.Content: Booked a room here after reading all the great reviews and because it's so reasonably priced for Hollywood/LA. Three of us stayed in a one bedroom suite. There was plenty of room and the bed was really comfy. The place doesn't look brand new but it's clean. The pool looked nice although this was a whirlwind trip and sadly no time to swim! Wished we had time to check out the Magic Castle club next door (we definately will on our next trip - especially since it has since featured on Hamish and Andy!). The staff were first class, very friendly and helpful. As soon as we arrived we were offered food and drinks from the free mini bar (such a neat idea). Breakfast was also great, you can eat it down by the pool or take it up to your room and eat it. The location is within easy walking distance of Hollywood Blvd etc. Obviously LA is a pain to get around at the best of times so not having to drive/taxi to something is a bonus! We will definately stay here again when next in LA!

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for an Hotel in LA, look no further!!”
Reviews.Author: sdacos
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is simply magical! After a long journey, we had a warm welcome with a glass of lemonade, after we were taken to our massive apartment overlooking the heated pool. The staff were absolutely brilliant, they helped us to get the best restaurants, tickets for Disneyland / Universal Pictures/LA tours. Nick was extremely knowledgeable about everything! We stayed a week in there and i really felt at home, you even can do your laundry there! I have also to praise the breakfast by the pool, just delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: justcris
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in February 2011 for just one night with my boyfriend. We were very sad that we could only stay for 1 night! As soon as we got in, we had cookies and drinks in the lobby while we were checking in, and were upgraded to a bigger suite than the one we booked. It was really nice and huge. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was pretty good too, we had it outside near the pool because the weather was nice. As we were leaving for San Francisco, we had a lot of free snacks to go and asked for directions and again, everyone was super helpful. Plus the hotel is in a great location, I wish we had more time to walk around. Will definitely stay there again if I go back to LA!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephen V
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is an absolute gem, right in the heart of Hollywood. We can't recommend it more highly. The welcome was first rate - just what was needed after a long haul flight with kids, and this set the tone for the service we received over our 3 day stay. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff and the hotel manager was excellent. He has clearly put his mark on this place and really went the extra mile to make sure we had a memorable stay. He succeeded...we will not forget this place. The hotel itself was really relaxed and had a proper Hollywood feel. It oozes character and comprised a series of rooms set around a pool, and rooms overlooking the adjacent roads. Ask for a pool side room, open your sliding doors and chill out. This is not a modern fanchised hotel, so if you want heated bathroom mirrors, brown suede head boards and the feeling that you could be anywhere in the world, go somewhere else. This place is perfectly clean and has bags of character and charm. The location is great. You can be in the hustle and bustle of Hollywood Boulevard in five minutes and retire to your peaceful bolt hole when you feel a bit tired. Once inside the courtyard, you feel completely relaxed. Breakfast is really good as well. Muffins, coffee, fruit and yoghurt by the pool gets the day off to a good start. Underground parking is also very reasonable. ($10 per night as opposed to $35 in San Fransisco). If we go back to LA, this would be the first place we look to for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “What A Find!”
Reviews.Author: Martin1964
Reviews.Content: We booked Magic Castle on the back of TripAdviser reviews and what a find! We stayed 21st Sept through 25th sept. Arrived after a long flight, parking was easy ( and cheap). Were welcomed with a glass of cold lemonade, great check-in. Got to our room to find balloons, a card and a fresh backed cake wishing us 'all the best for our 25th anniversary'. All staff are fantastic and sincere, the position as said before is pretty much um-beetable. If you are planning a trip yo L A book this place you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: jjjeh
Reviews.Content: You've read the reviews. This place is a block from the craziness of the center of Hollywood Blvd., right where you want to be to see the sights, but in a quiet neighborhood. The place is a '40's converted apartment complex so the rooms are funky yet really cool. Free snacks, Great service and help, and parking. The hill above the hotel offers amazing views of Hollywood. Easily THE BEST hotel experience I have had at many places for many years.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: king_well
Reviews.Content: Checked in by staff pleased to see you and a cold drink. Helped to the room with our bags and given advise about the hotel and local area. We entered the room and as said in other reviews, there was a smell that could best be descibed as musty but it was not over whealming and nothing the sceneted candle we travelled with didnt disguise (thanks to other reviews we went prepared). The room was a one bed aprartment with a large seating area that went into a functional kitchen. The bedroom had a comfy large bed and decent storage space and the bathroom was of a decent size. Both the lounge and the room had a tv with the lounge having a dvd player should you want to hire a film for the front desk free of charge. Hotel overall was medium in size with with all the rooms surrounding the small pool (small but great for a relaxing dip). Accommodating and cozy, great to come back to at the end of the day. Breakfast was a nice and set you up for the day and the free mini bar was fantastic....crisps, sweets and soft drinks when ever you want! What makes this hotel great is the location. Right on Franklin Avenue behind the Kodak Theatre (home of the Oscars). Walk Left from the hotel across the street onto Orange and within 2 minutes your on the Walk of Fame! Great for walking to everything and safe to do so. Parking at $10 a night! Bargain! Find cheaper in Hollywood (where parking starts at an average $30 a night) I'd be surprised. The hotel team........Never have I come across such commited, friendly hotel staff. Each staff member we spoke with couldnt have done enough. Nothing was to much or little. I'm terrible for remembering names but everyone stood out and is an asset to the hotel. Special mention to Nick. By error and an embarrasing one, I locked the car keys to the rental car in the boot!!! We had to be at LAX in within 3 hours for a flight and all seemed to fall apart. Nick tried calling Alamo with no luck (Sunday hours) to which he said he would call Triple A to have them come out and assist which would be approx $150. Ouch! Nick called them, advised he himself was a Triple A member and could we be assisted under his membership........they said yes, were at the hotel in 15 minutes and had the keys out in seconds.....no missed flight and no $150 fee! :O) Nick.....thanks again so much. You really did go above and beyond your job role and we will always be appreciative of your service. To the hotel management, you have a fantastic team, everyone stood out equaly with Nick always that bit more. For a great stay in Hollywood.....stay the Magic Castle.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a capital S”
Reviews.Author: Miranda11111
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3 to check-in and found that we had to wait 15 minutes for our room. To compensate for this we got a free upgrade to a one bedroom suite for our stay! It is all the "little" things that make this hotel stand out. Free drinks and snacks throughout the day, free breakfast, but mostly very very friendly staff. On the day we had to leave we could also extend our checkout time to 2pm. The location is very central in Hollywood. The beds are very comfortable. And the place just looks adorable (reminded me of the show Melrose Place). All in all, you won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: buff272
Reviews.Content: Love this place here on our honeymoon ,arrived to a glass of bubbley and cake ,friendly helpful staff ,nice pool , and right bang in the middle of hollywood , spacious rooms , would defo stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Magic at the magic castle”
Reviews.Author: BettyboopAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have just spent six days at the magic castle and I could not say a bad word about the hotel. We had a wonderful experience, helpful, friendly from desk staff and wonderful housekeeping. The breakfast was sufficient to start the day and plentiful. The kids love the pool and the free snacks, the rules are relaxed which made life so much easier for us. I highly recommend this hotel, this is out first trip to the USA and we could not have asked for a better first impression.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Hollywood, exemplary service standards!”
Reviews.Author: Seamo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for two nights whilst 'doing Hollywood' and really enjoyed the experience. Having located the hotel it proved easy to park in the secure underground car park which the hotel offers. Check-in was very friendly, with loads of great advice offered to maximise our stay, including maps, restaurant tips and advice on how to get to places such as Universal Studios (one stop on the subway) and where best to view the famous Hollywood sign. Our room was next to the pool and was well-equipped with loads of space and a full kitchenette. We didn't use this but appreciated the full size fridge in particular. The bedroom was large and the bathroom was also of a good size, with a good shower. Tea & coffee facilities were available and the wi-fi internet was quick & worked well, which was important to us. A big plus for the Magic Castle is it's location, just one street and a five-minute walk from Hollywood Boulevard and its attractions such as the stars in the pavement and the Kodak theatre. Likewise the subway station for Universal was just ten minutes away and could hardly have been more convenient. The stand-out feature of the hotel though was its people and its service. Bigger and "better" hotels should send their managers to stay here to see how it's done! From the personal welcome and tips at check-in through to the free snacks & sodas available from the front desk upon request, the level of helpfulness could not be bettered. Nothing was too much trouble and the free breakfast, including pastries, juice, coffee and fruit typified the standards being achieved. Well done and thank you to everyone involved in running the Magic Castle - great job! In summary, I would recommend the Magic Castle Hotel to anyone wishing to experience a night or two in Hollywood. Why would you want to stay anywhere else is beyond me?

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kyarorin
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks in California and stayed in a couple of first class hotels - but this hotel was the favourite by far. We were only able to stay two days because it was booked up. Next time we will plan ahead!! Hollywood Boulevard with the Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre, Madame Tussaud's etc. etc. is literally a block away and is a nice residential area so very safe to walk. The pool area is lovely, with lots of towels to use and staff circulate with popsicles. We hit the tourist areas early in the morning when it wasn't crowded and spent the afternoon by the pool. The kids loved the unlimited snacks and drinks at the front desk. Our room was like a little apartment. The decor is dated, but we still loved it and would definitely love to return and recommend it highly!!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Magic in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: Claphamite
Reviews.Content: A great hotel well located only a 2 minute walk from the Hollywood sights. Warm greeting from the very helpful receptionists, rooms were very large and modern and the light breakfast is an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: pacpet
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with most of the reviews, the staff go out of the way to be of assistance. Rooms are dated, but very clean and well maintained. Close to all of the hype of Hollywood. If you are thinking of doing dinner at Castle (magicians) you need coat and tie and cocktail wear for the girls, didn't know this one so was disappointed not to go. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royality”
Reviews.Author: hugh23350
Reviews.Content: This location has an awsome staff. This is second visit this time with my grandson to celebrate 8th grade graduation to see Hollywood. Unlimited free snacks and drinks at the front desk. Heated pool where you are given popsicles. Needless to say my grandson enjoyed our visit and understood why his cousins raved about their stay. Being a heavy coffee drinker really appreciated being served a fresh pot with snacks by the pool. Friendly place that i talk up to anyone going to LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Awsome Staff”
Reviews.Author: KRANDCO
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to use the word awsome to describe anything because it is so overused and misused. However there is no other word to describe the staff at the Magic Castle Hotel. This was our second stay in as many years to celebrate my birthday but this time we were joined by three other couples after having bragged so much about our stay the year before. Since there were so many of us I made the reservations several months in advance and also asked them to make reservations at the Magic Castle Club and Yamishiros Restaurant for us. Prior to our arrival I had to have called at least 5 times with changes or special requests of one sort or another; most of which were pertaining to the restaurant or Magic Castle Club reservations. Not once were my requests met with anything but "No Problem, we'll take care of that and e-mail you confirmation" and each time confirmation was waiting by the time I got to my computer. When we arrived the staff immediately remembered us and you would have thought we were part owners. Our friends were in awe and wanted to know how well we had tipped them the last time. (Actually, we had only left a tip for the maid) During check in one of the group mentioned we were celebrating my birthday and all of a sudden everybodys room was available but ours. (Late checkout, the maids would have it ready asap, etc, etc) Some 20 minutes later our room was ready. When we entered, on the dining room table was a fresh baked birthday cake with with my name on it, ballons tied to each of the dining room chairs and a birthday card from the entire staff! How they did that we will never know since we were standing on the paitio not 10 feet from the room the entire 20 minutes we were waiting. What a suprise! Once again our friends were awe struck and wanted to know who we knew. During the entire weekend we were greeted by the most friendly and helpful staff I have ever seen during continental breakfast on the patio (by the way the croissants are to die for), when requesting the shuttle to Magic Castle Club or Yamishiros or returning to find mulled cider and pastries waiting in the reception area each evening. (This was March) Normally I would mention the great location, absolute spotlessness of the rooms and other amenities but many of these things have already been mentioned in other reveiws. Besides, even if the place were a dump (and it is far from it) I would stay there because of the staff! To close, it is September and our trek to the Magic Castle Hotel, Magic Castle Club and Yamashiros for my birthday is now truely become a tradition. As soon as we can all decide on a weekend, I will be making our reservations for next March. Oh, and there will be at least 2 new couple joining us this year. That's because I know someone (actually everyone) at the Magic Castle Hotel! If your going to stay in the Hollywood area, you can't find a more wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: hotelevaluator_11
Reviews.Content: Our stay of one night at this hotel was wonderful. There was plenty of accommodations for everyone. The minibar was offered at no additional charge: drinks, snacks, etc. In the small but nice lobby, there was a mini-buffet with snacks and other drinks. The outdoor pool was wonderful and all the balconies are surrounding the pool area, some with private balconies. The staff was very kind and was always there to help. The bed was very comfortable and the room was spacious. After many years of traveling, I can say that this hotel is one of the best and is memorable! You won't regret your choice!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Time - the BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: pare10s
Reviews.Content: We just spent a 3 night/4 day Labor Day weekend there for our anniversary and had the most fabulous time at this hotel. While it is an older hotel and our room was small (our choice), everything else made up for that in spades. We were greeted by the most friendly and accomodating staff and our room was very comfortable. We loved the nightly bed turn-down (with chocolates and next day weather report) and the presentation of the continental breakfast was far better than most as well as tasty. We parked our car (secure underground parking) and did not move it for our entire stay as we were in the heart of Hollywood "action" and could walk everywhere. The staff made sure we had nightly dinner reservations and timely transportation. And many thanks to Jason for outfitting my husband with jacket & tie so he was correctly dressed for one venue (he had left those @ home!) . Popsicles @ the pool were a wonderful surprise and everyone there treated us with the utmost customer service and friendliness that is hard to find. We loved it there and hope to be able to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Staff make the hotel magical”
Reviews.Author: lindyloo6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in Sept during a 3 week road trip, booked this hotel purely on the trip advisor reviews as the previous year had stayed at the hollywood and highland marriott hotel. The magic castle is just off the main road, the property is set up a steep drive and there is only limited amount of parking at the front of the property. we parked the car in the underground car park and went into the reception area, which is a little square room with a hatch, we were met by staff who gave us a welcome drink and gave us information as to our room and stay, they gave us a sheet of paper with different snacks, choc and drinks on and told us we could tick which ones we wanted everyday and go to get them from reception which was a nice touch. Our room was in the far corner of the hotel, and several steps to reach, no lift. the room was big and had a kichen and living area separate bedroom with ample wardrobe area. Free toiletries in the bathroom which were of good quality, There was a large balcony which overlooked the pool area, The room was a bit dated and at first i have to say i was disappointed thought it looked a little scruffy to the previous hotels on my stay. There was a free breakfast which was ample served in the little reception but most people ate around the pool area, although there were not many tables. Every day the staff would put a little card with the following days weather forcast under your door also a morning newspaper which was free, The selling point of this hotel is absolutely down to the staff, they were the added extra to ensure this hotel remains high on the trip advisor ratings, they would come round the pool and give you ice lollies and would think nothing of printing out maps for you, We took a parent away with us on his first USA trip if we were to go to LA again as a couple we would prob consider staying here as we are fine to walk,however the 3rd adult in our party found the lack of lift and steep hill a bit of a challenge after a while, Well done to the staff here you really do deserve your high ranking on TA!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, like a home far away from home”
Reviews.Author: Sandy W
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in the Magic Castle Hotel. It is a really great choice in Los Angeles. First of all, it is extremely well located, the Chinese Theater being a 3 minute walk away and you don't have to be afraid at night of the walk back to your hotel. What really makes this place so special is the staff and the perfect costumer service At your arrival everyone makes you feel so welcomed, and with a welcoming drink you get a heap of informations and brochures about the city. Every time we adressed a staff member they were very nice and answered all our questions with competence and friendliness. All our deeds were immediatly satisfied. You have a really nice continental breakfast included that you can have by the pool or on your private balcony, you can borrow free dvds and get complimentary snacks and drinks. The parking is really not expensive for L.A. and it is highly secured. Spacious is the least you can say about our room. It was 500 squarefeet, including a fully equipped kitchen, a spacious living room with a spacious balcony including a table and two chairs, a quiet and cosy bedroom including a lot of incorporated wardrobes and a nice little bathroom. Air conditioning in the living room/kitchen and in the bedroom, as well as a television in both rooms. The rooms are not new and might be a bit used but everyting is exremely clean and you really have a feeling of coming home in the evening and even wish you could spent more time at the hotel. All the rooms are located around a courtyard including the pool, it is really cosy. The pool itself has a nice size and depth, is not too cold not too hot and can be used 24 hours. We really loved this pool. I highly recommend the Magic Castle Hotel, it is not a luxury hotel but it is an oasis in the big city and a home away from home, and the staff make you feel like a V.I.P. Thanks a lot Magic Castle Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “old smelly rooms/great service/nice location/lots of Oreos...”
Reviews.Author: San2rini
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Magic Castle for 3 nights during the second week in August 2011. The staff were very pleasant, especially Gabby who was very helpful. We were provided with a glass of refreshing lemonade upon our arrival. The free mini bar was definitely a highlight. You can purchase laundry detergent for $2 to wash your clothes, very convenient and saves you from running to a Laundromat. The hotel is located in a great location just one block from the walk of fame. But...we were told our room was one of the renovated rooms, so I would hate to see what the other rooms look like!! The air-con unit was so old and noisy that we kept getting woken up by it throughout each night! The bathroom was tiny, 2 people cannot fit inside at once, just to give you an idea. The toilet seat, although Iâ€™m sure(hope) was clean (although I disinfected it again myself) was soo old and deteriorated! It looked like it was once white, but has turned into a creamy, yellow colour. Surely they could spend $15 to buy a new plastic toilet seat. The lights and fan in the bathroom were soo rusted I literally thought it was going to fall down every time I shut the door. If you are tall and a little on the chubby side you will have difficulty sitting on the toilet seat as it is soo close to the wall and the shower, there is no where to put your legs...but the bed and bed lined was nice and comfortable. You just need to weigh up how much time you need to spend in the bathroom versus how many free oreos you want...

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to Hollywood this is the place to stay - brilliant customer service”
Reviews.Author: Chez03
Reviews.Content: After a 3 week trip travelling around Vancouver, Arizona and California the Magic Castle was one of our last Hotel stays. What a good choice - we arrived to a welcome champagne flute of cold lemonade, our room was very spacious, modern, clean and had all the comforts of home. The outdoor swimming pool was heated and open 24 hours so we enjoyed some early evening swimming. It was located one block away from the Hollywood Walk of Fame and all the attractions, and the car park was under the Hotel so the car was secure and cool. If all this was not enough we were given a full list of DVD's, soft drinks, chocolates, sweets and crisps which could be requested at Reception or delivered to your room, free of charge this was a novelty for the 2 teenagers in our party. Breakfast was served in the Reception area and you could sit by the pool or take to your room. There was also an up-to-date newsletter of the weather, the day's activities in the area and we were so lucky we got to witness a celebrity being presented with his walk of fame star. This Hotel has got it spot on - well done Nothing was too much for the staff

Reviews.Title: “Great little world.”
Reviews.Author: kpregan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days in August. What a great place! The location is perfect for getting around the Hollywood area. The staff was outstanding. While checking in, we were given a champagne flute of sparkling lemonade, and they were very welcoming. We had a beast of a rental car that they would help reserve a parking spot with orange cones. Our two bedroom room was very comfortable, and having the rooms all facing the pool gave it a great communal feel. The kids loved the snacks and soda available whenever they desired. My wife is still raving about how great our stay was here. We will definitely recommend this to friends and if we stay in LA again, it will be here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Melbatoast1950
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights after staying 2 nights in a Beverly Hills Hotel. The Magic Castle will be our choice for our next trip to the Los Angeles area. All of the employees were accomodating and very helpful on any questions we had. They even made our reservations for the Warner Bros studio tour and called a taxi for us. The free snacks, movies, and breakfast (which was yummy) are an added bonus to the great location, only a couple of blocks from Hollywood Blvd where there seems to be lots going on all the time. We were lucky enough to attend the dedication of the star on the Hollywood walk of fame for Ed O'Neill thanks to the Magic Castle (they have notices on the breakfast tables telling you what is going in the area currently).

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS; FABULOUS; FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: SueΦl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August and loved it; We flew in from New York and from the moment we arrived it was like we were royalty!! We received a wonderful chilled welcome drink - it was gorgeous, and when we were checking in, we were upgraded to a suite!! The Hotel provides FREE snacks & drinks throughout your stay; DVD's: and a lovely free breakfast; Zeeshan would have to be the BEST employee I have ever come across - period; NOTHING was too much trouble - he arranged our tickets to Universal Studios; our taxi; and the wealth of knowledge and tips he provided were invaluable; We only had 2 nights here & wished it had have been longer!! The Hotel is about a 3-5 minute walk from the Walk of Fame & is in a great position - BUT - the Hotel is so nice, relaxed & welcoming, you really dont feel like leaving. This is one hotel that REALLY DOES KNOW the meaning of hospitality!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Sojourn3
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Rooms are spacious though some are more modern than others. Furniture is basic but completely adequate. Pool is open 24/7 and they encourage use at any time. Kids LOVED the pool and hotel. Free popsicles, candy, soft drinks whenever requested. Air conditioning didn't work well in room and had to ask twice to repair. Maintenance worked thoroughly for a long time and fixed it. Kids recieved "presents" when we first checked in. Parking is $10/day under hotel. Spaces tight but convenient and in line with other lots around. Near several main attractions. Walking distance for some. Use car otherwise. Trader Joe's and Ralph's supermarket nearby and can use cooking facitilies in hotel room when needed. Many foreigners, couples and families stayed there. Breakfast is continental and doesn't change day/day so might be bored with it after a few days but completely met our needs. Many restaurants (all ethnicities) around hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! Have already reccommended to friends, and we will also be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katrina D
Reviews.Content: Coming from Australia and not knowing where to stay in Hollywood (first time trip), we (myself and my dad) were advised to stay at The Magic Castle Hotel. Well, we are so glad this is where we ended up staying!! We loved this place, and the staff are amazing!! Only one block away from Hollywood Bvld and all the hustle and bustle, yet, when you're back at the hotel, you feel relaxed and miles away from the busy Bvld. The rooms were neat, tidy and clean, and the beds were very comfortable!! Also not far to go to Universal Studios and Warner Bros. and you can hop on a tour bus down on Hollywood Bvld to see the main sights!! The best part of this hotel is the staff........they can't do enough for you!! They are always there to help, answer questions etc. The free snacks and drinks all day are a bonus, and the breakfast is light and fresh. Loved the pool, again, always kept clean, and was very relaxing to lay around with soft music playing in the background. Although we arrived quite early in the morning, fully aware that our room would not be ready, the staff immediately welcomed us, looked after our bags, and offered plenty to drink and eat while we waited. We loved our stay at the magic Castle Hotel, and have already reccommended friends to stay there, which some have gone ahead and made bookings, and we will also be back again, hopefully very soon. A BIG shout out goes to "Z"...............man, you were amazing and we loved your warm and friendly attitude!!! Look forward to coming back!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, Great For Families”
Reviews.Author: sandiegotraveler411
Reviews.Content: I haven't done a review here for quite some time because nothing has really compelled me to write either a pro or con review. Let me just say that I have literally traveled the world and the service at the Magic Castle Hotel is simply unmatched. Now keep in mind that this is not a 5 star pretentious cookie cutter hotel and if that is what you are looking for, this is not the place. But if you are looking for a great location, spacious rooms/suites, unequaled service for families and reasonable rates, look no further than the Magic Castle Hotel. Here are my thoughts: -Suites are large and good for families or others willing to really get the most out of the room. You should note that some rooms are not yet updated so ask for one that is. If you get an older room, know that they are decent but definitely somewhat worn and outdated. However, everything else makes up for it. -Staff couldn't be better. The GM Darren was amazing as was his staff, with white glove popsicle service for the kids, free snacks and smiles and friendliness all around. I can't stress enough that these people make you feel at home and very comfortable. THis comes from the top and Darren does an exceptional job with this very caring staff. It is THE difference maker. -Nice touch with welcome drink, continental breakfast, free snacks, dvd'd and wireless internet. They don't nickel and dime you to death. -Spoke to Darren at the pool area for quite a bit of time and he made many recommendations for us including a great dinner at The Farmers Market in The Grove which was a great experience. -Pool small but decent. Not a luxury resort pool by any means but the pool is enjoyable after a long day of tourism. -Location is superb, just a block from Kodak Theater, Graumanns, Hollywood Blvd and minutes from Beverly Hills, Universal and much more. Very central and convenient. Overall, very impressive. I stayed here before on New year's Eve and it was a different vibe (more of a party atmosphere) but if you are looking for a great place to stay in the LA area, this is the place. It was likely an apartment complex before being a hotel and has a Melrose Place type of feel. As unconventional as it is you simply cannot go wrong with this place. It is almost perfect now and when all the rooms are updated it will be incredible. Thank you to the Magic Castle Hotel for realizing that great service is so essential!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Customer Service makes it worthwhile!"”
Reviews.Author: healmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights-must say the staff and customer service is truly the highlight of this hotel. They could not have been more helpful and friendly. The hotel itself is wonderful for location, within walking distance of the strip. Rooms, well, they really do need updating. For the most part clean but....the carpet in our unit was pulled and stained and there were many scuffs on the wall. The first morning on the way out I mentioned that a lightbulb in our bathroom needed replacing and that while they were doing that they should consider dusting both the lightbulbs and the exhaust fan as they looked like they had not been touched in a long time-there was no cover on the fan and the dust was THICK! The staff say that was unacceptable and would take care of it. upon returning the lightbulb had been replaced but no dusting had been done-very disappointing! Overall a good experience but seeing the dust and carpeting really turned me off as being able to recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, oasis, like being at home”
Reviews.Author: HHKS
Reviews.Content: I don't really know where to start. Everything about this hotel is fantastic. We have stayed in 5 star hotels all over the world and have never been made to feel as welcome as we were here. you are not just a number at the Magic castle you are a member of the family. 1. Check in We were met by Liza and Z with a cool glass of lemonade, They then proceeded to check us in, show us to our room. We were then given a list of free snacks, drinks and DVD;s that we could get from reception at anytim, Well we were overwhelmed. Lisa then gave us a map and recommendations of where to eat. She is amazing and her knowledge is great, so just ask her. 2 The room What can I say. It was huge, Obviously at sometime has been an apartment, so we had a bedroom, bathroom, pull out sofa bed, table, microwave, fridge basically everything you could need, It was a bit bit battered around the edges but spotlessly clean, Free shampoo etc and a free safe in the room. We had a room on the groung floor by the pool so it was amazing. 3 The people Oh my god. I do not know what to say. Brilliant just doesn[t cover it. They are all unbelivievably knowledgeable about the area. From the housekeeping and maintenance staff to Gretchin the deputy manager they all had a snile on there face no matter what time of day or night it was. I swear Gretchin must have lived there as she never seemed to go hame. They are the nicest staff we have ever met, 4. The Hotel Amazing place, fantastic location, one block from Hollywood Boulevard. Free wi fi, Great pool. Nothring to much trouble. Lovely breakfast, If they don:t have what you want to eat just tell them and I can guarantee you the will get it for you. DO NOT even consider staying in another hotel the magic castle ihas it all

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..superb service!”
Reviews.Author: mayito2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel to attend a concert at the Hollywood Bowl (conveniently nearby). We had dinner at the Yameshiro restaurant (delicious!) after being conveniently shuttled there by the Hotel staff. After dinner, we called the hotel again, and asked them to retrieve our tickets to the concert (which we had left on the kitchenette table in our room). They brought our tickets, shuttled us to the Bowl, and put our leftovers in our kitchen's refrigerator, then picked us up after the concert! What service! We love this hotel and will return again soon. All the staff were friendly and attentive but we would like to single out Gabi for going above and beyond to make our LA experience memorable...we definitely will be back! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seb_paris
Reviews.Content: It was our 3rd time at this hotel and once again we haven't been disappointed at all ! We had been so happy the first 2 times at this hotel that when we have planned to come back to L.A it was crystal clear that we would book a room at the Magic Castle Hotel and this time has been even better than the past ones ! 1- All the employees are very nice and they know how to welcome perfectly their guests. Marcus at the front desk also took the time to call us when we arrived in our suite to check if everything was ok ! 2- we requested to have a renovated room (because they have started to renovate the rooms) and beyond having accepted to give us a renovated room they also upgraded us! The room 223 is a gem : very nice living room with a TV, very clean and pleasant kitchen with a fridge, a coffee machine and everything if you don't want to go outside for the dinner and if you want cook for your family. The bedroom is exceptionnal with a very comfortable king size bed, a TV ... and the bathroom is also very great with a shower and a bath ... honestly if you're not satisfied with that I'm wondering what will satisfy you 3- A bottle of wine and a welcome message were in our suite 4- The location is at a walking distance of the walk of fame (5min max. ) and it was very pleasant for us to walk 5 min to attend the Iris show at the Kodak Theater without taking our car 5- The breakfast is delicious and you can appreciate it more close to the pool ... The view gives you the feeling that you're like in the Melrose Place TV series 6- You can benefit from free food at the front desk whenever you want such as diet coke, coke, m&m's ...It's not essential but very appreciable when you want to chill outside close to the pool checking your emails ...(because the wifi is also included and free) The Magic Castle Hotel is definitely a place to go ... and to stay - We will definitly come back here and we will also recommend this hotel to our friends and family if they plan to go to L.A Thanks the Magic Castle Hotel you made our trip in L.A AMAZING !!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, incredible service”
Reviews.Author: ma0ffst
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here during the final week of out honeymoon to Los Angeles. We booked our stay here based on reviews on Tripadvisor, and we're so glad that we did. One of the main things that was coming out from the reviews was the great service provided. The Magic Castle did not let us down. The front desk staff were incredible - after I had booked my room online, I contacted the hotel to ask them for a few favours. Nick on the front desk booked us a taxi to pick us up from the airport, booked us a table at a top restaurant, and also booked us baseball tickets - this was before we had even set foot in the country! When we were arrived, we were amazed that the room we booked was actually an apartment, with a separate bathroom, kitchen, lounge, and balcony overlooking the pool. We loved the fact that the pool was open 24 hours, as was the front desk, where we could get complimentary snacks and drinks whenever we wanted. Most hotels in the USA (from what we have seen) do not come with breakfast when you stay, but this one provides a complimentary continental breakfast. The hotel is also just a 2 minute walk from the main area of the Walk of Fame, so it's perfect for tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Los Angeles!”
Reviews.Author: WiggyTravelBug
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my family while visiting california. It didn't take long after our arrival to realize just how great the service was. The staff truly cares and makes you feel at home. We only stayed here for three nights and i didn't want to leave! Usually we stay in hotels such as four seasons, fairmonts, and even ritz carltons and I would put this hotel right up there with them. I would recommend this hotel to everyone that comes to L.A. You will not be disappointed! Hope to visit again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Magically Unique”
Reviews.Author: irishhadc
Reviews.Content: We were greeted graciously and given a champagne flute of sparkling lemonade by the pool while we waited to check-in (we were early, but it was no problem) then the 'shoe dropped' so to speak. I booked the room way back in February (I'm a planner) but it was obvious they had overbooked because we were being 'sold' a different room at the 'sister' property up in the Hollywood Hills (right above the other property, literally a very short walk up a hill) but......... the rooms were cheaper, older and lacked the finishes that some people may require....but we agreed to look at the other room--I walked over to the balcony (which the room below didn't have) and told my husband---tell him we'll take it! The view was to die for!!!!! Capital Records building---downtown LA, okay the Hollywood sign was blocked by one house but we could see it just walking along the path from our room. We were carted up and down the hill whenever necessary by an employee in a nice SUV. The hill hotel had it's own pool and had a kitchen area (the lower room didn't). It was clean and had a tv and sitting area and that balcony/ not hollywood glamorous but if a view of LA skyline while laying in bed floats your boat---take the hills room if offered (rm. 504 is the highest room)----- continental breakfast so -so but free mini bar at the front desk is awesone----they have a list of snacks and sodas that you can just walk up and ask for free of charge---they'll even deliver up to the hills rooms-----my husband was like a kid in a candy store (they had lots of candy to choose from)---I guess i should have started with the fact that it was my 2nd wedding anniversary during our stay at the Magic Castle and had totally forgotten that I had mentioned that on my online booking in Feb. anyway we were presented with a balloon bouquet, a delicious cake and a bottle of wine!!!!!!!!! I was so overwhelmed and surprised. What a classy place! The staff is impecable. luv ya Zeeshaun!!! This hotel is a block or two from the walk of fame and close to everything (walking distance) LOVED IT! If you want to spend about $100 a couple with tax and tip try the Japanese at the top of the hill---Magic Castle made the reservation for me and got us a table with a fantastic view of LA!

Reviews.Title: “service service service”
Reviews.Author: dimitriskifisia
Reviews.Content: he acomodation of the hotel is what you excpect from a 3 star american hotel.but the hotels location and the stuff is what makes it a 5 star hotel.i ma writting this to thanks the guys and the managment because they deserve it they were mora than helpfull,the only minus was a little smell at the carpets betwwen rooms and the poor breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MyFourdarlings
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot for a family to base a tour of LA & Hollywood. The staff were so helpful and the free snacks & breakfast were lovely. All of our questions were answered and helpful tips for restaurants & tours. We had a huge 2 bedroom suite facing the inner courtyard-so we didn't have an issue with street noise, but as previously mentioned the window a/c units are extremely loud. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Small Hotel in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: UpstartTraveler
Reviews.Content: Magic Castle is a cool boutique hotel. I loved the retro So. Cal. ambiance, central courtyard and small pool. Big pluses: Free snacks, flavored ice water and a nice continental breakfast, which we ate poolside. The only drawback is the traffic noise, which sounded amplified. We slept with the windows closed, but it made no difference. They should install better windows. We were in a suite with the bedroom in the rear by the road. Staff is very friendly and helpful. They give good advice about local dining.

Reviews.Title: “The best customer service in america!!”
Reviews.Author: xcitedbouttraveln
Reviews.Content: Intial drive up to this hotel, I wondered what I had done but once inside I couldnt have been more surprised and satisfied with my pick of hotels. We were given a free room upgrade to a suite which was a lovely treat to our last night in America. I was advised that the room was recently built which I must say you could tell was done on the cheap side and the bed wasnt the most comfortable but was still a great suite (even if it was on the outside of the building). The customer service I must say was the best thing about this hotel, every staff member always had a smile on their face and nothing was too much trouble. The complimentary snacks all day everyday was fantastic, drinks on arrival and even the little gift they gave my son was much appreciated. They even have a free shuttle to the top of the hill where they have a little market every thursday night. This place is well worth booking at (as long as you dont expect the rooms to be of 5 star quality) and would recommend and stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “loved it but u need ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: munchyDublin
Reviews.Content: loved the staff, the free bars drinks etc, one bedroom suite was huge very clean and renovated room was 218 but the air con was terrible loud and road noise was bad from this room so be carefull pool was lovely and its very easy to get around using this hotel as a base

Reviews.Title: “Magic touch to every detail!”
Reviews.Author: Squacklips
Reviews.Content: We recommend to this hotel to any family wanting to stay in Hollywood. We had 5 kids, 3 parents and grandma with us in two suites and it was perfect. Big pro: Awesome service!!!!! Other pros: 1) suites are huge with a full kitchen, dining area, separate bedroom. 2) clean pool with toys, 3) the kids loved the free snacks (staff even brought out popsicles to the kids in the pool), 4) never felt like we were being "nickeled and dimed" at every turn, 5) one long block to the Chinese Theatre and other core Hollywood stuff. The only minor con was that one suite was clearly renovated and the other was not. I wish I had known to ask for 2 renovated units or asked for a discount on the not renovated unit. I'm sure this will get rectified over time as they renovate all the units. (Note on staying in Hollywood: yes, it's a little cruddy, but it's still exciting for the kids and if you're in LA for the touristy stuff, then it's a great base to explore the rest of the city and still have stuff to do when you get back to the hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “"Exceptional, exceptional, exceptional"”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel35805
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel with my 15 year old son. The experience was one of the best I have ever had. The location was excellent, close to attractions and public transportation. The property was well kept, rooms very clean and comfortable and surroundings quite pleasant. The hotel's setting makes you forgot you are in a major city. The staff was exceptional. Everyone always had a smile and was willing to accommodate your questions and needs. Whether you are a family, couple or business person, you will find the hotel delightful. We are looking forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Pearl67
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located, and we used it as a base for our 5 night stay with 2 kids, 10 and 13. Staff are extremely helpful in advising you on which tours to take, etc. One block to train to Universal is perfect. It is extremely busy one block over with walk of fame, etc.. but an easy walk to the hotel from there. Customer Service was outstanding from having a birthday cake surprise waiting in our room for our 10 yr old to the snacks, DVD's on hand, breakfast in the am, the most friendly and welcoming staff ever. We travel quite a lot and this trip we stayed in San Fran, then travelled all the way down the coast, staying at different places, this was by far the best service we had experienced. The room we had was huge, was in the annex which had steps to reach but not a problem for us - we did hear noise from next door a couple of times but other than that it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we would ever stay in, in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Julia S
Reviews.Content: We were made to feel very welcome as soon as we walked through the door and the suite with two bedrooms was a great size for me, my husband and two teenagers. It was clean and adequately equipped with bath robes and gorgeous smelling toiletries.The free snacks available from reception at any time (as mentioned many times before) were a very welcome bonus and the extensive list of free to hire DVDs was handy. Wi fi is free and easy to log onto and we had a room at the back so it was quiet and the beds are extremely comfortable. Its in such a good location - only one block from Hollywood Boulevard with Graumans and the Kodak Theatre, an easy walk. The staff are incredibly helpful and couldn't do enough for us - they booked us onto a really fantastic tour with Archer's Tours - can't recommend Seann enough - his knowledge of Hollywood and the surrounding area was second to none. The complimentary continental breakfast was lovely and fresh and we ate that in our suite so the small amount of space at breakfast wasn't a problem. The recommended restaurants were spot on every time - Yamoshiro has the most fantastic view of LA at night and had the added bonus of the free hotel shuttle taxiing us there and back. The secure parking is a bargain at $10 a day and the fact that there are no lifts wasn't really a problem - there aren't that many steps and if it was a problem I'm sure the staff would have helped. Our only small gripe is the noisy AC but everything else eclipses this. We would definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Great service - really welcoming - great location makes up for slightly tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: Palhaz
Reviews.Content: Great family hotel with small but adequate & safe pool - really good service culture amongst all staff -nice breakfast - good recommendations for evening meals - onsite secure parking - easy walking distance to Hollywood Boulevard & Hollywood Bowl

Reviews.Title: “Blown away by this place !!!”
Reviews.Author: KTVasser
Reviews.Content: Although I'm from Northern California and don't really "know" SoCal - I was enlisted as tour guide for my Michigan cousins who's dream trip was to see Hollywood, LA, etc. This was about day four, I had been driving all day, we were at Santa Monica beach and couldn't find a hotel under $400.00 using all my assortment of iPad apps - and the closest opening was this place. I called them, they were SUPER nice on the phone, and had a brand new room that had just been opened after being remodeled. Wow did we luck out. We had three adults in our group, so we needed at least two beds. The room they gave us was a huge one bedroom apartment - full kitchen, dining room, living room, gorgeous double shower head bathroom, and bedroom with two luxurious queen beds. Big flat screen tv in bedroom and living room. When we checked in, very tired, we were greeted with a chilled glass of lemonade in a champaign flute, and nice, nice, nice people all the way around. When he asked us what we wanted from the mini-bar - that is was complimentary - my eyes widened in disbelief and fear that it was a trick - FREE? - yes - so we ordered several sodas, water, candy bars, and I don't remember what else - all free. The morning breakfast outside by the pool had real fresh brewed coffee - like the real stuff, great selection of delicious breakfast items - theyt looked homemade - real silverware, glasses, mugs, and a hostess walking around offering refills etc. If the place were a dump, I would have raved about it because of the service which was outstanding, throw in the reasonable price, and the incredible one bedroom apartment we had, and count me thrilled. Once of the nicest places I've ever stayed in, don't let the outside fool you.

Reviews.Title: “Second time and not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: broadwaterannie
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to Los Angeles and we did not consider any other option after our first experience at the Magic Castle 5 years ago. The service that so impressed us the first time around has not changed and the staff are the highlight of this Hotel. We had a two bedroom apartment and considering the location the price is reasonable. The kitchenette gives a welcome opportunity to cook for yourself and the only complaint we would have is that there are not enough utensils, crockery, pans etc for the four people the room accommodates. Otherwise an ideal hotel in a location close to the sights of LA with car parking, a laundry and with staff that are truly 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, spacious hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBelle
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. It is not a trendy, spa hotel, to be sure, but even if I were a fan of that sort of hotel, this place would have changed my mind. It consists of mostly one and two bedroom apartments, with some studios sprinkled in (that seem to be the only non rave review rooms) My friend and I had a one bedroom with two beds and it was so spacious. Sizable living room, bathroom, dining room and kitchen and even a hallway with a well lit vanity table. They provide robes and nicely scented toiletries. As people have mentioned there is a free mini bar, which is no joke. We rolled in at 2am after a night on the town and asked for Reeses, snickers, M and M's, Fritos and Doritos and were handed a bag of all our requests promptly. They have a pretty large sized DVD rental list that contained plenty of recent releases and it was a great thing to break up our days and nights. The continental breakfast was yummy with fresh fruits (and not just apples and bananas) various good pastries, cereals, toast, juices, coffee and tea. The staff was very helpful and their shuttle was prompt and a great asset when trying to go to The Magic Castle and Yamashiro. I was surprised upon entering my room to find balloons, a amazing cake and card for my Birthday. While most tout this as a great family hotel, it also works well for singles coming to Hollywood for the nightlife. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is not a hotel snob.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but not sure it deserves such high praise...”
Reviews.Author: vedev
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it's because this hotel is the #1 rated hotel in all of LA but it didn't quite live up to our expectations. On the plus side the staff are absolutely brilliant and really made us feel welcome and at home - so thank you guys! Location is great for travelling around LA and seeing the sights - also for Yamashiro which is much better than it's web reviews and of course The Magic Castle if that's your thing. Parking is free and secure though a bit of a chore if you have a big vehicle. Wifi and nibbles/drinks in your room are free which is a lovely touch. Why only 3 stars then? To be honest the place is pretty tired and in need of a refit, whilst the pool is tiny. You know all this when you stay there so it's not so much of an issue. The major issue for us was noise - we had a road facing room (MAKE SURE YOU ASK NOT TO HAVE ONE OF THESE) and the traffic keeps going all night so you can't have the window open. Even if you have the windows closed it remains seriously noisy. The air con units are old and VERY noisy so the only way to get to sleep at all is with earplugs. Sorry guys I know there's not much you can do about this but to be fair to all I had to make this clear. If we hadn't had a road facing room I'm sure I would have rated this as a 4* so don't get me wrong, it's a very nice place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Everything the good reviews said here are true!!”
Reviews.Author: Gene-Teo
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 3 - 6 jul. Other than no elevators to our room, we have no complaints! - safe car parking, with it's own garage - walking distance (less than 5 mins) to Kodak theatre, Chinese theatre etc - stayed in the smallest room, but good enough for 2 people - great housekeeping daily - got a fantastic introduction about the area when we checked in - wifi...free!! - more than sufficient continental breakfast - free shuttle to yamashiro at hilltop, which has fantastic views, not to mention the nice surprise that Nic arranged for us - access to Magic Castle, which was fabulous - extremely friendly and helpful staff And this comes from someone who stayed at Hyatt at San Francisco, and Venetian at Vegas! The experience at Magic Castle hotel beats all!, -

Reviews.Title: “Would go back to LA just to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MarcelWave
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The staff were magnificent always friendly full of information on the area and the best way to get to places, nothing seemed too much trouble including a personal delivery of strawberries for breakfast. Room accomodated 2 adults and 2 teen boys comfortably and was always clean., the maids did a great job. The boys loved the free "mini bar" and the staff would sometimes double up so you have some for later.The pool and surrounding area were always very clean and tidy with a plentiful supply of clean towels for the pool. As if that was not enought the location was great, a walk to everything Hollywood, easy access to the highway to visit further afield,close to the subway with one stop to Universal shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Almost Perfect (except).”
Reviews.Author: Markus145
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic in most ways. I stayed here with my girlfriend and her 13 year old daughter, so we needed a place where we were not all on top of each other. Our one bedroom suite was more than adequate space-wise and the environment, the staff and the location were all excellent. The pool was also a nice feature: open 24 hours and heated. Overall experience was great! Okay so why not all fives? First off expectations were very high after seeing it rated #1 in Los Angeles (and I can see why it is) the markdown was a smell when we entered the room, my gf described it as not something you do not want to smell after a long trip. Her daughter had a more descriptive definition. We did not report this to the desk as we wanted to get to bed so we could start our Hollywood day early, she sprayed some perfume, we ran the AC , opened the windowsburned some incense and just ignored it instead of going through hassle of changing rooms. We also think we were the last to check in and maybe got the last on the list room. Now remember if not for the smell I would have given this wonderful place fives across the board. I am also sure that if we had of brought it to the attention of the staff they would have addressed it. I still highly recommend this hotel, and will go back if we plan a return trip to Hollywood,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolm37
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable hotel close walk to shops, metro and sites of Hollywood Excellent staff . free softdrinks, fruit, candy and chips etc Home away from home. The staff make you feel so comfortable and are very helpful and go beyond any normal services, best hotel I have stayed in around the world

Reviews.Title: “The Magic Castle Hotel is the perfect choice for Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: mas1966
Reviews.Content: We've had a wonderful time staying at the Magic Castle Hotel. From the tremendous staff to the location to the amenities, you couldn't ask for a better stay. It's like stepping back to an older era but with all of the modern conveniences. The hotel is next to the famed Magic Castle, which is apparently a must (we foolishly decided not to go, but regret it now). The hotel is also extremely well located - near Hollywood Blvd, Sunset Blvd, etc., and is only a couple of blocks from a Metro stop. Please don't pass this hotel up when you come to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever! Incredible hotel in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Rasmus H
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at the Magic Castle Hotel but I completely understand why they are #1 on TripAdvisor in Los Angeles. What an amazing hotel. When I arrived, I received the best service I've ever experienced at a hotel from the gentleman at the reception (I believe his name was Zeeshawn) and felt very welcomed immediately. VIP treatment! I even got a welcome drink which I've never experienced before, even at the fancy spots in Las Vegas. The room - or apartment rather - was huge and very clean and pleasant. You get a large living room type area, a kitchen with full amenities, even a dining room area, a large bathroom and a tucked away bedroom. You could live in this room for weeks. The hotel offers free (yes, free!) snacks and beverages, delivered to your room if you wish, and I got a free newspaper in the morning as well. There's also complimentary breakfast included, which was a wide selection of quality products, and many in-room amenities such as multiple TVs, microwave, DVD player and so on. Nothing was missing. With a nice pool in the middle, the hotel layout is very nice, and it is adjacent to the Magic Castle Club which you can get access to as a hotel guest (I didn't try it but I hear it's a very cool experience). From the hotel, you're a 2-minute walk from the busiest part of Hollywood Blvd, with the Chinese Theatre, Hollywood & Highland, Kodak Theatre etc. The location is perfect if you want to see the sights in Hollywood. There is not much of a view from the room, but you'll be hard-pressed to find that anywhere in Hollywood. One small thing - the Wi-Fi was a bit unrealiable and seemed to work better in the living room than in the bedroom for some reason. Could have been a temporary thing. I have nothing but praise for this amazing hotel and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service! Felt like first class - Great for families...”
Reviews.Author: nikywolfe
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with our stay at the Magic Castle. Zeeshawn showed us an outstanding welcome when we checked in and even surprised us with treats for celebrating a occasion on our trip. The room was very spacious, like your own apartment. The breakfast provided was just enough to fill us up and get going for the day. Lazy periods out by the pool and we were treated with Popsicles. The kids loved the snacks. Parking was only $10 a night which was a steal compared to some of the other hotels in the area, you had in/out privileges, and the hollywood strip was so close than many times we just walked for our activities. The kids loved it and wished we could have stayed longer. The only thing missing is a hot tub and updated bath. I highly recommend this hotel for those who like spacious rooms and like to bring their own food and use the kitchen amenities. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Sooo close to Hollywood Bvld and yet like a quiet Tropical Oasis”
Reviews.Author: jessicastheme
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 207 on the top floor over looking the beautiful pool. We booked the Magic Castle Hotel from Australia because of great trip advisor reviews, the great price and its great location - literally a minutes walk to the action on Hollywood Bvld. (Due to the Aussie dollar being so good we wanted to pay upfront from Australia - our emails were answered immediately no matter what time of the day or night I emailed and the paperwork required was sent asap. When we arrived we could check in straight away. Our apartment was very clean, very spacious and had been renovated - I purposely requested on on the top floor overlooking the pool (as we read these were the best and we were not disappointed). Think Melrose, think retro, think wonderful friendly helpful staff who provide you with a home away from home and you have the Magic Castle summed up. We could not have wished for a better place to stay. We saw the sights all day and Jason told us where a large fresh and very cheap supermarket was (about a 5 min walk). So we cooked everynight in our wonderful kitchen and then sent the kids down with a list for the 24 hour FREE mini bar and free DVD's (where do you ever get that) and sat and ate popcorn, chips, sodas and chocolate whilst watching free movies on our flat screen tv each night (that was a holiday in itself to us).
