We had one minor issue with a window not closing properly and the maintenance man appeared immediately and fixed it!. The pool was heated, clean with loads of pool toys -the kids had so much fun. A generous breakfast was presented around the pool each morning with delightful pastries and the Darren the owner/Manager was always on hand for a friendly chat. In fact on our last day he let the kids run wild with the mini bar and their backpacks were filled with goodies (thank you for those delightful Hershie Bars that you can't buy in Australia). They even organised to check-us in online on our return flight and print off our boarding passes. I could go on and on about all the positives as I can't find one negative about this wonderful place. It truly is a hidden little gem. We will definately stay here again and are recommending it to EVERYONE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Families love it, not so great for singles”
Reviews.Author: Gratgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magic Castle in April for 3 nights. I guess this review is realy a warning for singles because I certainly heard other guests, particularly those with children say how great it was. As I was leaving I heard one kid say it was the best hotel he had ever stayed in. Not so for me. I was in a room at the top of the building well recessed from any natural light, which was quite frankly depressing, especially as I was quite unwell on my second day and had to spend most of the day in bed. As I was climbing the many steps to my room I could sometimes peek into the larger accommodations and they did seem to be very comfortable, and spacious and bright, so it made my room seem more depressing. Breakfasts were ok, location was good. The service well, they tried to be very helpful, but for me it backfired. I wanted to post a parcel back to Australia and I asked at the desk if they were able to arrange it. On the Saturday the person on duty said yes, no problem, so I packed my bag accordingly and made a trip to the post office to get a box to send home. When I took it to reception on the Sunday morning at around 9.30 am the problems started. I wasted around 2 hours while they tried to complete the forms, and eventually decided that they could not arrange to post my parcel. Basically I wasted my entire last morning at the front desk, and then had to return to my room to unpack my box and repack my bags. Of course by then the key was de-activated and so I had to go all the way back to the desk to get it activated and climb back up to my room (I mentioned earlier that it was at the top of the building). I could not fit all of my clothes into my bags and had to leave some items behind (I had been shopping on the previous day on the strength of the earlier advice, so I was not happy.) The hotel knocked $50 off my bill but it did not compensate for the loss of my last morning in Los Angeles. So if you are travelling with kids who like to splash around noisily in the pool, go for it, but just be sure it is the right place for you if you are a solo traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile :)”
Reviews.Author: ymesian
Reviews.Content: The staff and service personel at Magic Castle were definitely the nicest people we encountered on our trip from Sydney to the US. Nothing was too much trouble, they went above and beyond the call of duty to assist where possible. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Th location was spot on, only 1 block away from Hollywood Blvd. Complimentary snacks, drinks and brekkie was a bonus. On our 1st morning there we were sitting by the pool enjoying our cereal and low and behold Orlando Bloom rocked up to reception to pick up a guest... well you could of blow us over with a feather!! Who needs to go celeb spotting when the come to you! Long story short would definitley stay at Magic Castle again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandBorderReiver
Reviews.Content: Arrived hot and thirsty from the Mojave Desert- cool cucumber water on tap in the foyer and attentive staff without being pushy- obviously centred on client happiness. The suite was excellent- large and cool. The location is perfect for Hollywood Blvd and only one Metro stop from Universal. Plenty of restaurants nearby, but their own restaurant at the top of the hill is unbeatable for views, location and value- courtesy car up to the restaurant and return gratis! An entirely fulfilling experience. Only caveat- not suitable for people with limited mobility- it is an old building with many staircases and difficult transfers.

Reviews.Title: “It's like living at Melrose Place in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: KevinElls
Reviews.Content: I had 10 rooms for my staff during an event in LA. Everyone loved it. It was like having your own apartment in Hollywood. Free breakfast, free Internet, cheap parking, great staff and the rooms, OMG. It's an apartment, bedroom, living room, kitchen, dining room and patio. Heaven. 5 minute walk to the heart of Hollywood blvd. I'll be back to stay here and I live only an hour away. Perfect base camp for Hollywood adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Lucy, You got some splaining to do.”
Reviews.Author: jamesonthego
Reviews.Content: Reminiscent of the hotels of the 50's with the service of yester year. Where else do you get white glove popcicle service poolside? rooms are a bit dated, but you know that going in. Complementary wifi at Magic Castle hotel , complmentary snacks, Great staff. Made you feel at home from the moment you stepped through the front door, They can even get you into the Magic Castle, Private Club, as a guest of the Hotel if you are really nice and say the Magic word.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit!”
Reviews.Author: RedBloodedGal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the Magic Castle Hotel to visit family as well as celebrate a wedding anniversary. We were greeted with wonderfuly friendly and informative hosts. Once shown to our room, which we were actually escorted to..we were met with a bottle of wine, balloons and red rose petals scattered on our bed along with a hand signed card from the staff. What a perfect way to begin our visit. We found everything about this hotel charming. Yes the rooms may be old and slightly dated but they more than make up for that with lots of room in the suites, a very comfortable cozy bed with great bedding, great complimentary bath products. An on site laundry facility with complimentary detergent provided made it much nicer to pack things back up for our return trip home. Any questions we had about the area were always promptly answered by the friendliest staff I have ever encountered and they even provided us maps with directions to where we were trying to go to guide us. We can't wait to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: annavk83
Reviews.Content: We - a family of two parents and two 'children' in their early twenties - arrived jetlagged, hot and tired around 10 p.m. and were warmly welcomed by two smiling staffmembers with an icecold (nonalcoholic!) drink. The entire atmosphere was almost like visiting old friends, only you hadn't seen them for years. We stayed for 2 nights and came back for 1 night at the end of our trip 2 weeks later. And again, it was like coming home. When we had trouble making it to the airport in due time, the manager was very helpful (I'm sure, the staff would have been so too, but now she happened to be around) and simply took a print of our passports and checked us in on-line, while we sat in the taxi on our way to the airport. Free fruit, minibar and filtered icewater during the day, a clean and nice pool-area, complimentary breakfast. An absolutely super hotel - the rooms were a bit smelly, but I'm not sure that that isn't simply the way it smells in a city (me being from the countryside in a very small country without any metropols. Furthermore, I don't think my family even noticed it!). Apart from the slight smell they were well cleaned, free teabags and coffee were provided, coffemachine, microwave and a complete stove. Nice thick towels and bathrobes, free internet - but most of all: every single person working on the hotel was nice, friendly and extremely helpful. I have been staying on both youth hostels in Greece and Israel and luxury hotels in several metropols around the world - but this was my best hotel experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff service”
Reviews.Author: RuthEleanor
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading TA - to us, even though we have travelled extensively, Los Angeles seemed overwhelming and we did not have a clue where to book, We arrived after a very long road trip from Yosemite. We have found the staff to be friendly and helpful, happy to provide endless tips and maps and info. The hotel provides guests with endless snacks and choclate, soft drinks which made our kids very happy. The hotel is not new by a long shot, however, the maintenance staff were prompt and efficient when we complained about the sofa bed our kids slept on. Parts of the rooms seem a little worn, carpet stains in some places, doors a little worse for wear. There is some wear and tear. We had planned on booking a vacation rental apartment but all were booked out by the time we checked around. So these suites were nearly the equivalent of an aprtment. Kitchen with fridge, microwave, cooker and all the utensils. Washer dryer on site with free detergent for a minimal cost. Minimal cost parking. Close to Hollywood boulevard, a noisy and sleazy street, though essential part of LA experience. Cant see in general how central hotel is, LA is so huge that I am not sure there is such a term as central. But we had only three days in LA and this was close to universal studios. Kids were very happy here with all the little extras. Pool convenient after a hot day, not huge but plenty of room. Continental breakfast is one of the better offered on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Bob8078
Reviews.Content: OK, so the rooms are a bit tired but they're clean, huge and have everything you need. Our ground floor rooms were a bit dark and overlooked by the poolside area but we asked for two rooms close together so that probably limited the choice. I guess the upper floor rooms are better. The pool is small but big enough for a cooling,relaxing dip after touring Hollywood. The location is perfect for most of the landmarks - a visit to the Magic Castle is a must. The staff are superb - friendly and warm and went out of their way to help us with a car hire problem.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews are Right”
Reviews.Author: Princessstringbean
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old granddaughter and I have found the Magic Castle to be our perfect "home away from home" for our vacation in Hollywood. As others have said, the staff is outstanding. Every question has been answered pleasantly and thoroughly. Every request has been met promptly and with good humor. The liberal snack policy, breakfast buffet and the kitchen in the unit all help create the family-friendly atmosphere we have enjoyed. For tourists like us the location is outstanding-- one block to Graumann's Chinese Theater and Madame Tussaud's and one (clean and safe) subway stop from Universal Studios. If you're looking for a luxurious, spa experience this is not the place for you but if you want a comfortable, welcoming home-base while exploring the Los Angeles area and a super comfortable bed at night you simply can't do better. I wish every city had a Magic Castle Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEST place to stay in Hollywood!!”
Reviews.Author: toner888
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews state - an affordable, enjoyable and very comfortable place to stay in Hollywood. The staff could give ANY other hotel lessons in customer service! The highlight of our trip to California. Free breakfast, free snacks (just about anything you would like 24 hours a day with a smile), free internet, secure underground parking and lots of great people... Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: joannelin137
Reviews.Content: Last stop in a 5-week trip across the USA and what a great way to finish! We had pretty good luck with hotels during our trip but the Magic Castle was something else! The staff were so friendly and helpful! We were greeted with sparkling lemonade in champagne glasses on check in and made to feel so welcome. The staff were always around to help - in person and over the phone. They were very knowledgeable on local things to do/see/eat and were happy to find out if they didn't know. We rented a car and the staff made it a quick and painless process. Booked under existing room details, dropped off to us in the morning and left the keys with front desk when we finished - no fuss. At the end of our stay, they booked us a shuttle to the airport too. The snack bar and free DVD rental were a happy (but under-utilised) bonus! Morning paper and evening turndown (with weather forecast and chocolates) were small touches that made all the difference. Complimentary breakfast was wonderful - a large selection of baked goods, cereals, yoghurt, hot and cold drinks. The room was great - a 1-bedroom suite with a full kitchen and sofa bed. A really spacious living area, HUGE closet in the bedroom, two TVs (one with DVD player), iPod docks and the most comfortable in the world!!! Great location - just one block from Hollywood Blvd with great restaurants, shopping and attractions. Also close to bus/subway lines. If I visit LA again, I would not think of booking anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Fantastic Customer Service Of My Life!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rfoti
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not fancy, but very comfortable. The service from everyone to the front desk in the office, to the cleaning staff was unbelieveable!!! I have never in my life been treated so wonderful for the 4 days that we were there. They went out of their way to make us happy, and we were. The breakfast was great, unlimited snacks, drinks, and movies were a wonderful treat for the kids!!! We didn't want to leave!!!! This is the place to stay, no problems, and such a wonderful staff!!!! Believe me, you won't find this kind of service too many places, they were sensational!!!!! They even mailed some bills for us, and we left a purse there for 2 weeks, when we searched for it and discovered we may have left it there, we called, and they kept it for us!!! Honest, Friendly, Wonderful Staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: Gillilandgals
Reviews.Content: Our family booked the Magic Castle hotel based on the reviews and to have the opportunity to go to the Magic Castle. When we pulled up our kids were a little bit concerned but after walking into the lobby and discovering the free snack list they declared this is the best place ever! I thought for sure the staff had been trained by Nordstroms...they were amazing and all were consistent. It is easy walking distance to the Chinese Theatre and stars walk of fame. It is so great to have parking so close to all the action. My children loved the non stop snacks and poolside popsicles. The DVD list was long and the girls enjoyed watching a movie. It is an amazing value when you consider the customer service, the complimentary unlimited snacks, the free DVD's.... It is a complex that has been renovated from apartment so they are large. With that being said they are not luxiourious but definitely clean and well appointed. Thanks again for helping make another fabulous family vacation so memorable. Gilliland gals

Reviews.Title: “Always #1 in our hearts!”
Reviews.Author: vmittl
Reviews.Content: Everything positive written previously about this gem of a hotel is absolutely true----it is absolutely "everything you need and more than you expect"! Recently #1 on Trip Advisor, this hotel deserves its kudos 100%......we stayed here for three nights in July with a family of four in a one bedroom suite---spacious, great amenities, comfortable, amazing breakfast (those scones are to die for!) and front desk service that goes above and beyond.....thank you Magic Castle----if ever in LA again, we will book with you!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: BlueSteel17
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™re from Australia and had a one bedroom suite in June 2011. We stayed for 4 days and can confirm that all the comments on this site are accurate. The apartments are very clean and yes they are a fraction dated, however this is more than made up for in the service that you receive. The staff are right up there as the friendliest and most helpful staff we have ever encountered, and we have stayed in a lot of hotels covering all star ratings. Whether it was arranging a convertible to hire, tips on restaurants, shopping or whatever, nothing was too much trouble and all was done with a smile. We were celebrating an anniversary (and then our engagement) and we had wine, cake and a card waiting for us in the room â€“ a great touch. Brekky is included, the complimentary snacks and drinks are a bonus, and the location is also great if you want to be nearby the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Graumans Theatre etc. as itâ€™s only a 5 minute walk away. Our sincere thanks to all the staff who made our stay fantastic, but particularly Jason, Zeshann and Nick â€“ you guys were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service We Have Ever Experienced!”
Reviews.Author: tootbeer
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews and we could not have been happier! We were traveling with three children and my mother -in-law and this place was perfect. We had a two bedroom suite that was very spacious and comfortable. The pool was exceptional - right in front of the rooms and they had everything you need there (pool toys, floats, towels, etc..). They even served popsicles! The complimentary breakfast was wonderful..we especially liked the chocolate chip/cherry scones! And even my picky little one found lots to eat. As many have mentioned, the hotel has a free mini bar, which my children definitely took advantage of (sour patch kids, m & m s, chips, soda, fruit, almost whatever you wanted!). And the location of the hotel was so close to everything, yet you also felt very removed and private! But the thing that stands out above everything else was the customer service! All of the staff were so welcoming and helpful. They were quick with directions, advice, getting more towels,etc.. Whatever you needed they went above and beyond!!!! We would advise everyone to stay here...it is a treat and a highlight of our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money at a good location”
Reviews.Author: Neilfromadelaide
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful service at a location close to the main sights in Hollywood. Older style of hotel, but arrangement of rooms around the pool provided a clean & open environment. Room was quite large for two of us so had plenty of room to spread out. Kid friendly and plenty of complementary snacks for around the pool of for the drive home.

Reviews.Title: “It was so sad to leave---we will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Shaun_Azzopardi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 18th of June to the 22nd of June 2011 The staff were so friendly--- we felt as though we were at home and that is a long way (we are from Melbourne, Australia) The room was very spacious and was more like a "house" feeling rather than a hotel/apartment It was very comfortable, the pool was nice also The hotel also comes with unlimited snacks/drinks---I know this sounds too good to be true but I aint joking on this. All you have to do is pick what you would like from the list and the staff will arrange Hotel is approx 5-10 minute walk to kodak theatre/chinese theatre/hollywood walk of fame Pls set aside a day for universal studios and a half day for movie sites/star homes tour as these are highlights of our trip to hollywood. We were travelling with our toddler and there was no ramp (only stairs to get up to the reception of the hotel) which made it hard sometimes to get up and down esp when tghe little one was sleeping. Besides that i couldnt fault the hotel There is also a laundromat onsite Shaun

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: marshmellogal
Reviews.Content: as a family of four Australians two of which are under 16, we decided to do Los Angeles on our trip around California. This Hotel was the absolute best hotel for service, they have a sort of free snack bar where you can ask for any type of drink, or snack so long as it is on the list (which is basically everything). when we arrived we arrived slightly early and they let us check in early which was a bonus because we had some time to kill before our tour of LA. WE literally turned the corner walked down the street and we were right in the middle of the premiere for Kung Fu Panda outside mans chinese theatre and the Kodakl theatre, stars everywhere we felt like the paparazzi!! having walked around and been all through LA cant exactly say much for its image or for how safe you feel (but thats not in Bell Air and where the rich and famous live) however it was great to come home to a reasonably updated room and feel safe enough by the way did i mention how accomodating the staff were! we never actually made it to the show or dinner because there some sort of age restriction, but we hear its fabulous. only dislike i had with this hotel was the breakfast setup, it has very limited space for the breakfast and is very restricted with tables but we mostly felt like eating in our rooms anyways. abosutely great hotel would recomend it to families staying in LA, excelent location and fabulous staff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Scallie
Reviews.Content: I can't speak highly enough of this place. The location was perfect, just a five minute walk from Hollywood/Highland and in a pleasant part of town. It was an ideal place to stay with young children as the suite is spacious, clean and comfortable and the pool is wonderfully accessible. What really made it though, was the wonderful customer service. The staff are so friendly and helpful, I've never experienced anything like it before - they really helped make our holiday wonderful. Wouldn't hesitate to go back next time we visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the US!”
Reviews.Author: Liam84
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived and were greeted with a free arrival drink we knew we made the right decision to stay here! Our whole stay was amazing with free mini bar that the staff were only to happy to give you as much nibbles and drinks as you liked, they were definitley not cheap! We stayed in a family room which had two bedrooms so each couple had the privacy of their own room. Then hotel offered a turn down service as well. The free breakfast was great with cereals, toast and lots of beautiful muffins and baked goodies. The location was a 1min walk to Graumans Chinese Theatre so very close to Hollywood Bvld. The best part of the stay was entry to the Magic Castle Hotel the private magic club. This night was amazing and definitley worth the effort. The hotel provided us with ties and jackets so we could meet the dress code! All in all a wonderful hotel and one that I would reccomend to anyone travelling to Los Angeles. Thanks guys for an awesome time

Reviews.Title: “My kids loved this place, and so did I!”
Reviews.Author: towniemel
Reviews.Content: I had chosen Magic Castle based on Trip Advisor reviews, and was not disappointed. First, the price ($179/nt) and proximity to Hollywood were excellent, especially considering our suite was very big, with a large living area with comfortable seating, a large flat screen TV (free dvds to check out), very comfortable king sized bed with a full kitchen and eating area. The pool is fabulous. Very beautiful. If you look at the pictures, you won't be disappointed. My kids and I were swimming one afternoon and one of the staff came out and offered us popsicles!! This kind of service is what you get all the time. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. I would say my one complaint about the staff would be that they weren't as knowledgable as I would have liked about local family-friendly restaurants and attractions outside of the norm. We loved the free snacks and drinks available at the desk ( a wide variety of candy, chips, sodas, etc.) and the free continental breakfast was tasty, with yummy scones and croissants, cereals, fresh fruit (mangos!!), juices, very tasty coffee, granola and yogurt, etc. We also loved being to walk one block to Grauman's, the Walk of Fame, Disney's El Capitan Theater, etc. The parking is good in that it is underground, so covered, with a key-access gate, so secure. However, it is small and difficult to maneuver with a larger vehicle. The laundry facilities are clean and reasonably priced. The building is old, which I think adds character, but if you prefer a really swanky luxurious place you might find it a bit "worn". I would definitely stay here again, and highly recommend it, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: GigiB0st0n
Reviews.Content: What a place! I don't have enough superlatives to describe the Magic Castle Hotel! it's one city block to Grauman's Chinese Theater, the Kodak Theater, and the stars on the sidewalk. We had two side-by-side one bedroom suites - my grandson and I in one, and my son and daughter in law and two of my grandchildren with them. The suites are huge and plenty of room for all of us. The staff must take classes in customer service - because our every whim was granted. This was the perfect place to stay for our one week trip to Los Angeles - right in the heart of Hollywood! And don't forget your swimsuit, because they have a pool!

Reviews.Title: “May be dated but more importantly clean, great value and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: AgentM99
Reviews.Content: After coming from great accommodation in NYC we were a bit apprehensive about what we might find at the Magic Castle Hotel but we were pleasantly surprised. While the carpet wasn't the best, there was a tiny hint of scent on arrival in the room and the building is a little old, there was nothing icky about it (and with 3 girls travelling ickiness would have been noticed and objected to immediately!), the beds were great, the linen was very clean, the bedroom and apartment were spacious, the (full not fun size) snacks were appreciated and the staff really were exceptional! It also had free wifi which I tend to think should be a standard inclusion in all hotels. The lemonade on arrival was such a nice touch and the breakfast in the morning was also handy. There was toast, croissants, muffins, juices, yoghurts, cereals - more than enough. Some of the items on the second day were leftovers from the first though. For the price and inclusions I would recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Definitely will go back again!”
Reviews.Author: lilstepy1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! The service was even better, we got in late but they were waiting for us with refreshments. They took us to our room which had a nice usable kitchen. They had 24 hour service and complimentary snacks. As well as a heated pool open 24/7. There was also a complimentary breakfast, which was never empty or missing anything. They were also very cool about letting us check out late. Overall it was a great hotel and we had an amazing time! The service was like nothing I've ever experienced at a hotel before. I will go there again and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “number 1 on trip advisor I dont think so”
Reviews.Author: garerth59
Reviews.Content: When we arrived on a Friday we were told that somebody had extended their stay and the room we had booked would not be available. To their credit they gave us another room for free but we had to wait until well after 3.00 pm which was not good as we had been travelling to get there and were tired, in addition we had to move again the next day which wasn't satisfactory, Id booked the room months in advance. I agree with other comments the rooms are very tired and need an update the hotel location is excellent staff helpful and there is free stuff available at reception. All in all room for improvement required suprising no 1 for me disappointed at the reason for not having the room available definite improvement required.

Reviews.Title: “excellent.”
Reviews.Author: laodaprivate
Reviews.Content: Great location and great service. We really appreciated the staff's generous help with our luggage. The hotel was not the best bargain for our stay in LA but we left feeling it totally worth the price. Be aware that the place does not offer a luxurious appearance from outside; I'd probably take my date or biz friends to elsewhere more glamorous - but the room (suite) was sufficiently equipped, VERY spacious, and with a lot of little cute details; for family travel it is absolutely great. I'd be back again.

Reviews.Title: “The Nordstrom of Hotels”
Reviews.Author: juliagold1
Reviews.Content: I can't begin to express how much I love this hotel!!!!! My husband and I have stayed here on a few occasion and it NEVER dissapoints. The staff goes above and beyond to make us feel at home. We are still giddy every time we check in and they hand us the free mini bar list. We look so forward to the morning time when we know that coffee and yummy baked good will be awaiting us in the lobby. I would reccommend this charming hotel to anyone who wants a fun romantic gettaway. Thank you Magic Castle Hotel!!! We can't wait to visit you again.

Reviews.Title: “Number one?”
Reviews.Author: Ghostviking
Reviews.Content: The staff is excellent, so are the free minibar. But the rooms are worn out and all of the hotell needs an upgrade. Why is this hotell at a number one ranking in LA? It does not deserve it just because of the nice people who work there!

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT AND I'LL RETURN SOON”
Reviews.Author: ASHLEYNYCOLE
Reviews.Content: On june 4,2011 i had a champagne party at the magic castle and the staff was wonderful. they where extremely generous to myself and my guest visiting me. The customer service was outstanding and the hotel was very quiet and clean. I will return and make sure to recommend all my friends and family to stay at this hotel. Thank you to all the staff that made me visit perfect!! keep the good work up.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what's offered”
Reviews.Author: ddlc05
Reviews.Content: My family and I were excited about staying here..we saw good reviews overall. The front desk was very friendly and helpful upon arrival. The place is older..dated in appearance with a few attempts at modernizing the decor...example being the lobby which you have to go through to get to your room. I asked how old the place was..staff said it was an apartment complex built in the sixties but rennovated to be apartments in the Seventies. Upon entering our "suite" it was a fairly sizable accomodation but did look like a seventies apartment with attempts at trying to modernize it. The couch was worn and musty and the carpet appeared dingy and stained. After settling in later and upon closer inspection, we questioned how clean the bathroom actually was. There was hair on the sink... on the showerwall...and when we wanted to bathe our child, the tub seemed to be plugged. Oh..let's not forget some splatterings on the wall above the sink. It looked like someone had bloody gums and splattered it while brushing their teeth and the paint job was peeling in the shower. Icalled the front desk..told him our situation..there wasnt any maintenace until tomorrow He would put on some gloves and take a look...why? When I mentioned the hair..he asked if it was mine..you gotta be kidding me! He wasnt rude..but I think he either didn't know what to say at the momemt or management has told staff to play dumb in these situations. Pros: beds were fairly comfortable. Staff acted professionally.

Reviews.Title: “TripAdvisor reviews say it all - great service!”
Reviews.Author: celtic33
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 just returned from a great 2 nights at the Magic Castle hotel. As others have said, the rooms are a bit dated (ours also had a peeling ceiling in the bathroom and the laminate on the linen closet was sort of melted) but everything is very clean, which is what matters to us. The kids loved going to the lobby with their snack orders and Nick at the front desk gave them some arts and crafts and served popsicles poolside! Our baby's crib had a Johnson and Johnson gift set and rubber duckie, in it, which was a nice touch. (By the way, we stayed in 3 hotels in 6 nights, and this one is the only one that got our request for a crib right!) We enjoyed Sunday Brunch at the Magic Castle, which was a fun experience. Our only negatives: the underground garage is safe but very tight, especially if you have an SUV or minivan. Also, the doors to the suites are pretty thin and flimsy - not heavy metal doors like in most hotels. I just didn't feel the doors or locks were as secure as most places. Overall, it was a great experience, and we will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: debplum
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our three children stayed at the Magic Castle at the tail end of our trip. We travelled with another family and their children and we all loved staying here. Good location, our apartment had everything we needed and the kids loved the free snacks and dvds. The staff were fantastic, we felt so comfortable here it was like a home away from home. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: littlerosepetal
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for us, very close to the chinese theatre etc. The staff we very helpful. Snacks available was very convenient, picked up a bag of them before heading out each time. Breakfast was a standard continental. Rooms were old, freshly decorated, but large and clean. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Service is Top Class”
Reviews.Author: Joseph035
Reviews.Content: Our family thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Magic Castle Hotel and our daughters were very impressed with all the extra treats. Yes the rooms are rather old but were clean and had all the essentials. The staff were extremely hospitable and we felt it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “wowwwwwwwww”
Reviews.Author: Rissa41585
Reviews.Content: finally, a hotel that had a cot set up and a friendly welcome, the staff are beyond great, our room had not only the cot set up but a baby pack (by johnson & johnsons) with a letter personally signed by the staff upon arrival. We were greeted with drinks, snacks, nice smelling large appartment sized room and a map with info on the area and how to get around and where to eat!!! The maid will clean up your room even wash dishes. Free continental breakfast, gorgeous tea on select nights that has the taste of warm apple pie, free snacks and dvds. Quiet and aussie atmosphere, they even have vegemite! I love this hotel, its a 3 star rating but the service and special treats make it a 5 star atmosphere, they make you feel like a star in hollywood!! The kitchen is great if you have a baby to care for.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget accomadation”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveler01
Reviews.Content: Helpfull staff, good location, simple rooms but ample considering your only their to sleep. abit noisy but hey your in La so its all part of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, tad noisy, massive rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Australianberry
Reviews.Content: we arrived mid afternoon greeted with lemonade in champas glasses. This hotel was our last stop i had heard great things on here. Our room was not ready which we were a tad surprised at is was about 4pm. We werent too bothered sat around pool after driving for most part of day and the staff raced to help take bags to room for us. My 8 year old daughter was a tad disappointed the hotel was not part of the castle and we did get a tad confused when we arrived parking at the castle not the hotel. Parking was $10 a day bargain. ROOMS- we had a two room unit, older but refurbished. Massive fridge, full kitchen, large tv. one king and one queen bed couch and chair coffee table desk lamps. Clean tidy. Bathroom had sep bath and shower not anywhere to put your toilet bag but there is a bench outside door with a mirror. The best smelling soap youll ever smell. The beds are so comfy I have two negatives- 1- the noise coming from the road was very loud. Busy most part of the night and i was super thankful i had ear plugs. I dont think you would get this from all the other rooms, ours just was directly onto front. 2- our room was not inside the unit complex but on the outside which did concern me that anyone can just walk up to the door and windows. Most of the windows are second story but the one near the front door did not have a lock we realised when going to bed however the second wed mentioned it the next day staff had fixed it within 30 mins. I would have still felt safer inside the complex as everyone has to walk through the office to get inside. FREE SNACKS - surprised they still offer this after our three kids kept them busy. Not once did the staff blink an eye at the amount of snickers and cokes my teen sons requested. They even sent my husband out with some to the car for our plane ride home on checkout. STAFF were simply amazing. Couldnt help enough from directions and maps to special requests. little notes in the rooms BREAKFAST- loads of cereals, toast juice, hot choc coffee tea etc, some pastries and fruit bowl. My only suggestions would be to change it up every couple of days perhaps put different pastries for the customers staying a few days. LOCATION- excellent not right on main strip but a stones throw away. We are very happy with this hotel and thank the Magic Castle for making our last few days fabulous in the USA before we returned to Australia

Reviews.Title: “The best service you will get from a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderers98
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Magic Castle Hotel can not do enough for you from the moment you check in until the moment you leave. We arrived much earlier than the advertised check in time and were greeted warmly (with a drink) and advised that we could have one of the two rooms we had booked immediately and that the other would be ready in an hour. The check in process was one of the most thorough I have received ranging from information on the complimentary breakfast, the pool, the complimentary mini bar available at reception, the free DVDs for use, free laundry detergent, the list goes on. For our family day at Disneyland one of the members of staff even researched the best means through which to travel to and from Disneyland. When this turned out to be via hire care, he then went about booking it for us and arranging to have it dropped off and picked up at the hotel by the hire car company. While the rooms are probably only 3.5 stars at best, they are very clean, comfortable and ours had a kitchenette and dining area which was great given that we were travelling with our two young children. The free wireless internet was very reliable and the room itself was also very quiet and peaceful from a sleeping perspective. The final 'magic' part of the visit was on check out when we were advised that we could keep one of our two rooms until 6pm at no extra charge given that we had a late night flight out of LA. Extremely generous and extremely unexpected. This hotel thoroughly deserves the ratings it is receiving on TripAdvisor and is one that I wouldn't hesitate in recommending to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: AussieOwl
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel - so don't expect new finishes. However, it is spotlessly clean and charming. We had a one bedroom suite, which seemed huge! All the employees we came in contact with were fabulous. Customer service is definately valued at this hotel. This is now our go-to hotel in the Los Angeles area!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardtaylor10
Reviews.Content: A most wonderful hotel in a top location, just 10 minutes by foot from the Hollywood Walk of fame and the Kodak Theatre. The Hollywood/Highlands train station is also nearby. Very friendly and helpful staff, large rooms with kitchen, free continental breakfast, free internet and quiet rooms added to its charms. Have stayed here twice and would certainly come back if we were visiting Los Angeles again

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: ksctot
Reviews.Content: Our accommodations were comfortable, the room rate was affordable, and there is free parking and continental breakfast. We spent 1 day/night here and I would recommend it to anyone who is not into 'frills'. The entire staff, day and night shift, were polite and gave reliable driving, walking and points of interests information.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: DougBarbara
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days and was very impressed especially with the level of service at the Magic Castle. Nick and the rest of te staff were great! We've never spent much time in the Hollywood/Beverly Hils area and enjoyed our experience with both the hotel and surrounding area. The rooms are spacious and clean and it is within walking distance to the Hollywood atmosphere. If you're coming to this area and don't want to spend a fortune, consider this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel great staff”
Reviews.Author: kiwitripper64
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Magic Castle. Staff were fantastic. We stayed at the overflow hotel on top of hill. This wasn't a huge problem as there was always someone on staff to drive us up at a minutes notice. But the rooms do need a makeover. Not dirty, just very old. On the plus side, Thur nights have a food market in the carpark of the restaurant next to the hotel. Locals, good food and incredible views. Magic castle is 5 min walk to Hollywood Blvd and an extra 5 to the subway to take you quickly and without hassle to Universal studio. We arrived on 6am international flight, got to hotel, dropped bags off and went to Universal studios for the day. The sunshine and excitement kept us all awake with no jetlag. And, as mentioned before, the hotel has great staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cramersfrombrisbane
Reviews.Content: We had booked to stay at the Hollywood Hills Hotel (sister property up the hill). We arrived in LA after some very heavy rain. You have to check in at the Magic Castle for the HHH. We were told that they had a flooding issue at HHH so had place us in a room at Magc Castle. Originally we were not very happy with this- you want what you booked. But the checkin guy was really sympathetic and helpful. How glad we were that we stayed at Magic Castle. The room was a great older style apartment but fully renovated. It looked over the centre courtyard- very Melrose Place style. Great things about this place:- - full kitchen with plenty of crockery etc. - TV in bedroom and living room - Guest Laundry - So close to Hollywood Blvd (fantastic given it rained for 4 days straight) - Breakfast in the looby of the morning- nothing fancy but toast, cereal, pastries, juice and coffee. What more do you need? - Free snacks (chocolate bars, lollies, chips etc). Amazing for a hotel to offer this- the kids (and adults) loved it! - Warm cider for Christmas in the lobby. What a fantastic place to stay- location, service and quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing staff who go out of their way to accomodate guests”
Reviews.Author: 2thbeach
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel as we were driving through Hollywood and were not disappointed. The hotel is quaint but the staff is awesome!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and amenities. This place just keeps on giving.”
Reviews.Author: Barnaby1000
Reviews.Content: It would not be fair to accept such outstanding hospitality without posting my first ever hotel review. Magic Castle Hotel is a slightly unconventional establishment, extending from a very curious private magic club next door - housed in a fantasy-like early century victorian mansion. The hotel itself lies adjacent and is typically californian in an unpretentious relaxed way. The accommodation does not follow the formula of the big chains. The rooms are spacious and flow nicely without being up-tight. It's no criticism that the rooms are not as slick and shiny as some of the luxury chains and you might notice an endearing squeak in the floor or that the windows actually open. This all enhances the relaxed feel of the place. Service is outstanding. Nick, you will go a long way in life - don't lose your enthusiasm and willingness to help. I need people like you at my work! Caren, you took complete ownership of our needs and we appreciate this. Darren, is the manager. He made sure to introduce himself, to listen to what the guests thought about the hotel and went out of his way to help us. Thank you so much in particular for your help on our final day when we were waiting for our late night flight. You know what you did for us, and we are forever grateful. The convenient location worked very well as a springboard to the attractions of LA and Hollywood. Finally, Magic Castle can't be beaten from a value point of view. We were showered with snacks, breakfast, drinks, popsicles and so forth. This level of generosity seemed to have no end. This is the hotel that just keeps on giving. We wish you every success. Ian McLean, and Sally, Sam, Charlotte and Millie

Reviews.Title: “A Weekend to Remember”
Reviews.Author: kbzx2
Reviews.Content: For my husbandâ€™s birthday, I took him away for the weekend. We stayed at the most refreshing hotel ever, the â€œMagic Castle Hotelâ€�. Upon arrival, we were greeted with the warmth of a family gathering. Heartfelt smiles, gracious hospitality and the feeling of sheer comfort welcomed us in, and continued throughout our stay. There was a Birthday cake and balloons in our room along with a card signed by each member of the staff. What a wonderful surprise! Accommodations - SUPERB - Our room was excellent. Clean, bright and comfy. - Great breakfast, newspaper and all. - 24 hour pool, laundry facilities and underground parking. The Staff - WOW - Extremely attentive and always courteous. - Theyâ€™re attention to detail is uncanny. We left relaxed and delighted. Note to Caren, You are excellent at what you do and the way you do it. The Hotel is lucky to have you on staff. I hope they realize what an asset you are to them. Thank you all for â€œA Weekend to Rememberâ€� Sincerely, Paul & Karyn Burgner

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: cruisingal54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend into Monday. We had a problem with our room that was hastily rectified with no problems whatsoever. The staff is the best. Cannot do enough for you. Whatever problem you may have upon arrival at this hotel the staff will take care of it one way or another. They have laundry facilities which were a huge plus for us since we were travelling with carry-on luggage. The laundry detergent is provided free of charge. Also- location-location-location!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: RTCJF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Magic Castle in November 2010 with our 5 & 7yr old daughters. It was by far the best hotel we have ever stayed in. After a long drive from Vegas we were greeted with a beautiful glass of lemonade. My daughter just loved it! We were on the bottom floor, which was great as we didn't have to lug all of our suitcases up stairs. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment. While the room was a little dated it was clean and spacious. We had a very comfy king size bed and my girls slept on the flip out sofa. It was self contained so you could cook if you wanted to. My only complaint would be that the shower leaked every time we used it so there was always a pool of water on the bathroom floor. But not a big deal really. The staff were incredible and were ALWAYS happy to help. They printed us off maps, brochures and always had time to answer any questions we had. The breakfast was great and the endless minibar snacks were fantastic. I couldn't tell you how many packets of oreos my kids went through. We didn't have a chance to use the pool as it was really cold when we were there but it looked gorgeous and we are hoping to use it when we come back. The location is fantastic. Its minutes to Hollywood Boulevard, shops, pharmacy, chinese theatre and train. I would and already have recommended this hotel to friends who are travelling to LA. Out of all the hotels we stayed in while in America The Magic Castle was by far the best. Our only disappointment was that we didn't stay long enough. We are already planning a trip back and will definitely be staying longer. Thank you Magic Castle staff for an incredible stay at your hotel. It was the highlight of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Heaven”
Reviews.Author: HuntingPerfection
Reviews.Content: Now on day three at this quite remarkable hotel , a real gem and quite possibly the most rewarding stay we have ever enjoyed in our travels . The location is quite amazing and minutes from the Hollywood attractions and the rooms and pool are spotless and so unique and perfect for our kids . The staff are quite simply superb , polite , knowledgeable , gracious and go out of their way to make you feel special. Sorted out some basketball tickets and organised some beautiful delivery food and now in our room watching a free DVD and using the free Internet , and snacking on complimentary bits and pieces. Independence is the key here . No text book training here, common decency and a mission to meet and exceed all the guests requests and awesome breakfasts to complete my Hollywood Heaven !!

Reviews.Title: “A truly Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: Facemaker01
Reviews.Content: As I write this review, I am seated with my feet up on a comfy couch in a spacious renovated 1 bedroom apartment that is part of the Magic Castle Hotel. Upon our early arrival we were greeted with a complementary drink and given the choice of a ready room or wait until ours was ready. All the staff are friendly, helpful and pleasant. This hotel was an apartment complex in a previous life and most of the apartment balconies look out over the pool area, which is where everyone congregates for breakfast. The bed is super comfy, and with such perks as free mini-bar goodies, evening chocolates, hot apple cider & danish butter cookies and a great breakfast menu; I couldn't think of a more ideal place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: ValeriePerth
Reviews.Content: A friend suggested this hotel to us. We had a really good time. The rooms are really cosy, such a great place to stay on holiday. I am always very picky with the bathrooms, but this one was very clean and luxury. Thank you for a wonderful holiday!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING PLACE TO STAY, FANTASTIC!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: geelongfamily
Reviews.Content: One word, FANTASTIC!!!! Great location being only a block away from Hollywood Boulevard and the Chinese Theatre!!! Fantastic Service, everyone couldn't do enough for you so friendly. Complimentary everything from Candy and Chips to WiFi and Laundry detergent, breakfast and papers. Comfortable beds and clean apartment, 24hr access to the pool and services. They even mailed our letters and paid the postage!! Amazing place definately a MUST stay. FANTASTIC!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “5 stars aren't enough!”
Reviews.Author: freezingmybuttoff
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 2 kids - 10 & 8) stayed here in a one bedroom suite for two nights. Like many have said this is an apartment complex turned into a hotel. The "room" was huge and great for getting some space apart from the kids. The pool in the centre is heated and protected from the wind, so even in early March we were able to swim comfortably. They had a couple of pool noodles and balls for the kids which they really liked. They also offered free DVDs and snacks. As many snacks as you wanted. The location is great, a short 2 minute walk from the front door to Hollywood Blvd. The continental breakfast is very good and I don't know where they get those scones but WOW!! What blew us away though was the service. They could not do enough to help us. They always asked if we knew how to get where we were going, if we had enough snacks and drinks (for the kids :-) ), could they help us with our bags, it was amazing! True, it's not the Four Seasons (I've stayed at many of those on business) but to be perfectly honest I preferred the non-pretentious atmosphere and absolutely unparalleled service found at the Magic Castle. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “customer service like no other!”
Reviews.Author: hany0u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel based on reviews from Trip Advisor and couldnâ€™t have been happier with our decision. The room itself was clean & simple - however the highlight of staying at this hotel was the customer service the front desk had. This hotel could have easily been "average" without it! They knew us by name and did anything they could to make our stay enjoyable. The location was good, less then 5min walk to the Hollywood strip - but we hired a car anyway so this wouldnâ€™t have bothered us even if the location wasnâ€™t great. We loved the free snacks at the front desk - highly convenient at a late hour! The guests next door to us were pretty loud at 3am, but the front desk sorted it out before we even thought about making a complaint. We also booked a valentines dinner at the Magic Castle where the food was about average - but the shows were amazing! Definitely a must do since you can only get a reservation through the hotel or a member!

Reviews.Title: “Converted old apartments in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelswell4fun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here to get an invite to the Magic Castle next door. That aspect was worth it as the Magic Castle is not to be missed when staying in Hollywood. This hotel is certainly not the Four Seasons, but it will serve your needs if you can stay at this level of hotel. Some might not be able to, especially if you are used to high end hotels. This place tries very hard. It is a good value and parking was only $10/night. But the tub in our room had porcelain patches coming off, the carpet was getting worn, and the sheets too old to be in service. The shower was good with plenty of pressure. Hollywood Blvd is only two short, safe blocks away. Sunset is down a little farther so the location is really good. I would not be able to stay at a lower level personally, but I readily admit that we prefer higher end places as a rule. If you can't or if you really want to go to the Magic Castle and don't know anybody/member to get you in, then you will be okay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,friendly-helpful service, great amenities”
Reviews.Author: pinoy74
Reviews.Content: I have been to many hotels in both continents and also in Europe, this was by far the best hotel I have stayed in. This is probably the last family vacation we will be having with everyone together as our kids are getting older so we wanted it to be memorable, this hotel has placed the icing on the cake (both litarally and figuratively) - everything about the hotel was more thatn we expected and the amenities that was listed on the site was true to its word. We enjoyed the pool, free snacks, movie night each night (in the comfort of our room) and on our daughters birthday - a cake and baloons was waiting for our arrival in the room fromm a day out at the beach (what a surprise - not just for our daughter). This is definitely a place I would recommend to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service - not really hotel though”
Reviews.Author: LondonPenguin1
Reviews.Content: This isn't a traditional hotel - it's more of a condo set up. Rooms are basic but comfy and clean. Ours was in need of repair in terms of decor - the shower floor was cracked and a bit mouldy.... The walls are also quite thin so take some ear plugs in case you have noisy neighbours above you. Although the rooms may not be 5*, the service is. All staff were beyond friendly, helpful and polite - management should be proud of their people. Location is great - the Chinese Theatre/Hollywood walk of fame are no more than a 5 minute walk around the corner - fantastic for sightseeing purposes. Parking was $10 a day but this seems to be standard for America - we've yet to find a hotel that doesn't charge for parking in California...At least the car was parked in a secure car park. This charge was somewhat offset by the amount of free food/snacks that reception offer - very generous and unheard of anywhere else we've stayed. There was also free and speedy wifi to take advantage of which was much appreciated. All in all, we would recommend the Magic Castle.

Reviews.Title: “It's like a Club: Safe, Clean, Professinal, Friendly, and They Know your Name”
Reviews.Author: westcoastexpat
Reviews.Content: I went for business and was joined by family for the remainder of the week - they faciliated my business needs by printing plane seats, docs, and faxing info, etc.... Once my family arrived the front desk made it their business to know our interests and help us maximaize each day. There is no more friendy staff anywhere - we felt like old freinds by the end of our five day stay. It was my husband's birthday while there and they filled our room with balloons!

Reviews.Title: “Its Magnificient ....”
Reviews.Author: latasha9
Reviews.Content: The staff is wonderful, they really understand what a guest needs. Everything is excellent: comfortable beds, marvelous service. Will stay here again the next time we visit LA. Check out some cheap new york hostel deals.

Reviews.Title: “Confirm the positive reviews and I would like to add ...”
Reviews.Author: Ale78Torino
Reviews.Content: Confirm the good reviews about this hotel. The staff is very friendly and the manager has given me $ 5 for a taxi that did not take the credit card without wanting to return to my departure. I'll be back to Magic Castle. Thanks! A tip: to get to and from the airport take the Supershuttle service works well, are accurate and cheap. The hotel can book the service for you.

Reviews.Title: “It has it all here.”
Reviews.Author: honeykins2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the Magic Castle after reading all the great reviews on here.The people were so nice from the minute we walked in until we checked out.We were going to stay one night in the beginning just to make sure we liked it there.We ended up extending our stay to three night.The rooms are very clean.It is not really ultra modern.just simple.We didn't use the pool on our stay.The weather wasn't really warm enough.They give you a free continental breakfast every morning.with these wonderful bakery goods.They always have a cool drink available for everyone in the lobby everday and coffee at night.They also offer you free dvd's to watch and free snacks and beverages also,at anytime..Who does that? Nobody.You can leave your car in their private,underground,gated garage and walk to Hollywood Blvd which is about a block away.You are really near alot of interesting places if you stay here.Especially if it's your first time going to check out hollywood.There is something going on all the time.Great people watching and a great place for some really cool gifts.It's a block away from the Kodak Theater also which is on Hollywood Blvd.Also across from the Kodak Theater and down a few buildings is where they tape the Jimmy Kimmel Show.You can call for tickets in the morning.If you walk by there is someone around and they will give you a card with the info.Make sure you wear comfy shoes,this will help a whole lot.Lots of walking from one end to the other to see every star.It is also close to the expressway and there are various restaurants and places to have drinks at.Even if you want to drive ,which we did alot of,there are alot of places within a half hour or so of driving .We experianced so many places and had such a great time.Beautiful photos that we can look at for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “WoW, Friendly Hotel, Very Accomodating, they bend over backwards”
Reviews.Author: dorothylamore
Reviews.Content: We had a FANTASTIC stay at the Magic Castle Hotel. We arrived at the Hotel around 9:30 after a 14 hr flight from Australia. The Staff told us to help ourselves to breakfast. Our 2 bedrm aprtment wasn't available until 3pm due to the carpets being clean but they offered us a room (free of charge) to shower and rest. Staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome. They are helpful with directions, providing maps etc and it is within walking distance to Hollywood Blvd and Metro. They provided free mini-bar to go (no alchohol) and had a huge list of free DVDs. Would stay there again if going to LA

Reviews.Title: “I agree: one of the best hotels in town, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Miliena
Reviews.Content: The staff is wonderful, they really understand what a guest needs. Everything is excellent: comfortable beds, marvelous service. Will stay here again the next time we visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “the best customer service ever”
Reviews.Author: roosters2035
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 6 hours before check in. tried from a 14 hour flight from Australia we were hoping to drop off our bags and go for a coffee.But was not the case the lovely lady at the front desk Lisa got Ricky to take our bags as Darren invited us to enjoy there free breakfast.As we sat down to a great breaky Darren( the Manager ) come over and told us that our room would be ready early as they were shampooing the carpet but he had organise an other room for us to used.That was the quality of service we got all the time we stayed there.The beds were great.THANKS to all the staff at the Magic Castle you guys made our holiday even better

Reviews.Title: “The customer service at this hotel will exceed your expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ptraber
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel last weekend and were SO impressed with the service we got at this hotel from everyone - the front desk staff, the housekeeping staff, the reservation person - they all went ABOVE and BEYOND in service! My husband and I were traveling with 3 other couples and had come up to go to the Magic Castle to celebrate my husband's birthday. We rented one 2 bedroom suite and 2 single rooms. When we arrived and checked into the suite, they had set balloons on the table along with two chilled bottles of wine and 4 wine glasses PLUS a personalized birthday card and a chocolate cupcake and even candles! The two bedroom suite was HUGE! It was like an apartment - we had 8 people in our room for drinks and appetizers - the living room area had plenty of seating for all of us and several ottomans to put the food on! The housekeeping staff brought us extra wine glasses and dishes. The bedrooms in the 2 bedroom suite were good sized and the beds very comfortable. The next morning they had a continental breakfast with yogurt and granola and fresh baked croissants and scones and muffins from a nearby bakery and wonderful STRONG coffee! We had a wonderful stay here and would DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: peyyala
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I was skeptical despite having seeing the great feedback on the hotel . This was my first visit to US and I was confused with the choices that were being offered. I wanted to stay in hollywood at a reasonable cost. The reservation desk was most helpful in taking my booking and also offered options of pickup. I was given the option of shuttle which was really very convenient since i was travelling alone from Bangalore. My friends were travelling from New Delhi. The checkin was really smooth. The hotel allowed a early checkin for my friends on our request. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was clean and looked new. I had some doubts since some folks had given a review on ageing bathrooms. It had a cooking range with all the necessary utensils, fridge. Towards the end of our stay we used their facilities to cook. Breakfast was complimentary, it was adequate. Wireless was free. unlimited snacks and beverages at the minibar counter in the reservation desk. But i guess the best asset or quality of the hotel is the staff. They are extremely courteous and tried to accomodate our requests. example- when I asked for directions to some stores, the receptionist (jason) printed out the directions from Google Maps. Really I thought it is a great thought process of the Magic Castle Management., by itself the property is very unassuming and boring. But its really the service at this cost that really makes this hotel really good.

Reviews.Title: “A real find -- homey feel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Jim_PSU
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is a real gem. Less than two blocks from the Kodak and Grauman theaters in Hollywood, but it feels like you are staying in a local apartment complex with a very friendly landlord. The rooms are a bit worn and scuffed, but that's OK given that they are spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Our kids loved the free snacks and DVDs, and the coffee provided with the continental breakfast was as good as the best coffehouses. The location can't be beat -- walk to Hollywood Boulevard, and a short drive to Burbank, Griffith Park, Beverly Hills, or downtown L.A. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and good hotel in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: itravel100
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 3 children and grandparents for two nights in a two bedroom suite. The hotel staff (reception and cleaning) were all very helpful and accommodating. The heated pool was a hit with the kids and even though it was January, many were using the pool. The hotel looked like the 'Melrose Place' apartment. The breakfast was a good selection of cereals and pastries. The hotel is ideally located if staying in Hollywood. However we found Hollywood itself to be cheap, nasty and tacky. Next time we would stay in Beverly Hills, same price but much nicer location with young children. We were also disappointed that the magic show at the hotel was only for 21+ during the week. Also the free Wifi was very unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Magic Castle, except the odour!”
Reviews.Author: allwests
Reviews.Content: My husband and two teenager children stayed in a one bedroom apartment. We arrived in our room after carrying our bags up a lot of stairs, to be hit by an overwhelming odour. At first we thought maybe the carpets had just been cleaned and the room had been closed up, but it was rather strong. We called reception and were offered an alternative room but at 10pm, having lugged all our bags to the room, we were too tired to move to the 2nd room which was at the opposite side of the hotel. We thought the smell would go - it didn't and in hindsight we should have moved. I bought a scented candle and we lit that while in the room. A little disappointing as it was clear management knew of the smell. Aside from the smell in our room, we liked the spaciousness and having two TV's and a kitchen/dining area made family travel so much more comfortable. Just avoid room 315!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful & Staff is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ALLIGATOR9
Reviews.Content: A block away from Hollywood Walk of Fame & I was lucky to get a room here. Packed my carry on & strolled over from Roosevelt to Magic Castle. Very nice room, great staff & hot apple cider at the reception. Plus the staff at reception is so nice it makes you feel so much comfortable. Free Dvds to watch in the room, free snacks & sodas to keep you going. You are in Hollywood. This is a hotel I would love to stay again & again. Wish they had more hotels at other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Vibe...”
Reviews.Author: Mainland63
Reviews.Content: I spent two night at the Magic Castle for business and just the right feeling and vibe. Loved the set-up and atmosphere and felt as though i was staying at someones apartment in this quiet serene complex. Wireless worked fine and was able to spend mornings on my balcony having coffee in peace and quiet. Agree with all the reviews and what seperates this property from the rest is SERVICE, DETAILS and the sincere impresion that they care. A great alternative to main stream hotels and quiet retreat that I will sonn return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: scarletbgn3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magic Castle while in Los Angeles for business. As my son and husband came with me, we picked the Magic Castle based on the room and the location. We were incredibly happy with our choice. The hotel is a repurposed apartment building, meaning that our one bedroom suite was actually a one bedroom apartment complete with full kitchen and dining area. While the appliances and furnishings are dated and well worn, everything was very clean and in workable condition. Each room has wall mount air conditioning, rather than typical hotel room central air but as we were there in January, this wasn't an issue for us. The service at the Magic Castle Hotel was the best part of the trip. Every staff member we encountered went above and beyond to enhance our stay. My infant son was greeted with bath supplies and a rubber duck, while my husband and I were met with a drink at check in. Our bags were brought up quicfkly to our room (very important as there are lots of stairs and no elevator that we could find), and we were provided with a portable crib in our room. We made use of the free shuttle service to the fabulous Japanese restaurant up the hill from the hotel, and while enroute the hotel staff made us a reservation and ordered us an appetizer, compliments of the hotel. The free breakfast in the morning was more than adequate and the coffee was great. The location was great for my husband and son to explore Hollywood during the day. On top of it all, the price was incredibly reasonable, particularly in regards to the amount of room space.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Best Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: night-life-angel
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle Hotel is a one of a kind hotel...In fact I've never had a better hotel experience! The staff is beyond helpful; they are exceptional, right on hand to offer you a welcome beverage and anything else you might need upon your arrival and during your entire stay. In addition to very clean and spacious accommodations, this hotel offers some extra amenities including a free mini bar and a complimentary breakfast that includes scrumptious croissants and scones. A block from some of Hollywood's coolest restaurants and down the hill from extraordinary Yamashiro restaurant, the location is ideal. The hotel is also located on the same property as the world famous Magic Castle, and guests staying at the Magic Castle Hotel have access to this private club, which features the world's top magicians. I highly recommend both--a stay at the Magic Castle Hotel and an awe-inspiring evening at the Magic Castle!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing frtf”
Reviews.Author: ProfChampaign
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor. This was the one disappointing hotel amongst all the others that we booked in our itinerary. First the strengths: The people are nice. This is what probably drives the hotel(?)'s popularity. The service aspect is great in terms of promptness, civility, and helpfulness. The kids loved the free snacks. The parking is useful. These are the reasons for two stars. The weaknesses: Unfortunately service alone cannot drive a hotel stay. What is also equally important is how good the room and the amenities are. In our room, the main bed was ok, but the sofa bed sagged a lot, and my son could not sleep. The bathroom door could not be locked. The microwave was not cleaned, there were coffee stains. The amenities are all very old, and need a desperate upgradation. The area where the washing machines are kept was filthy (Management - have you even looked behind the machines, ever?). The hotel(?) is an old apartment complex with paper thin walls. I could not sleep the whole night because of the sound. The hotel cannot control the road noise, but it does have the option of investing in insulation. The breakfast is a nice touch, but we could not find butter. The "free" internet did not work. (There have been previous postings on this issue - why not resolve it?) The point is simple - freebies and service is great, enjoy it if you want to, but this is not a top grade hotel, and is very uncomfortable for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: NotTravelodgingAgain
Reviews.Content: As big fans of Trip Advisor we dutifully did our research and booked four nights at the Magic Castle as part of a trip around California. On arrival we were told that the guests who were in our room had decided to stay longer (we had booked several months earlier) and that we had, therefore, been bumped over to a sister hotel - a move descibed as an upgrade. The room was shabby, smelt of mould and had an air conditioning/heating (?) unit grinding out bizarre noises in the corner. We could not get onto the free internet as we were too far from the main hotel. We went back to reception and checked out. The staff were generally helpful and the free mini bar is a great idea but this hotel shouldn't be number 1 in LA!

Reviews.Title: “A counterbalance....”
Reviews.Author: CThom7
Reviews.Content: Just want to say I am flabbergasted as to why this place gets great reviews. We have had great luck with trip advisor in the past and booked this place on the basis of these amazing reviews. Underwhelming experience. Thought it was a bit of a dump, to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay amazing service”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: This is not a high end hotel but they do not charge high end rates either- so for the price you get an excellent stay. It is an older apartment complex that is now a hotel. With that I want to warn folks: The kitchens are older and the showers are small. The rooms need painting and the carpet is older. However they made up for this in service. We were traveling with a group of 5 adults and 5 kids. We needed 3 rooms and wanted to be by the Magic Castle and Hollywood. The location was perfect and the service was amazing. We had a 1 bedroom suite and a 2 bedroom. Both had kitchens and one had a balcony. Breakfast was included and so were snacks and sodas. You can walk right to Hollywood- great food and walk of fame. Nice pool and patio area is well kept. I will also caution that there are many stairs- we were on the 2nd floor and we had to walk up 4 flights from the parking garage. We are in good shape so it is not a big deal for us- but if stairs are not your thing I would request a room on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable staff and comfortable rooms !”
Reviews.Author: curryjb
Reviews.Content: What a unique and fantastic hotel experience....Nick, Jason, Caren, Zichan (sp)...Yes, we knew all of the staff by name and they knew us !! If we needed it, they got it ! Terrific location just one block from all the action of Hollywood Blvd, but far enough away for a quiet stay. Apartment like feel. We stayed in a one BR suite and both boys (18 and 16) were very comfortable in the living room. Best continental breakfast I have ever had, and the boys enjoyed snacks each night (or the hot apple cider !) with a DVD provided by the hotel....They even brought us milk to go with our cookies one night ! This is what customer service is supposed to be about. Rooms were very clean and spacious and we enjoyed the heated pool every night even when temps dipped into the low 50's. My family loves to workout, and the hotel provided complimentary trips to a fitness facility right around the corner. Great recommendations for dining and all the help we needed getting around. I would recommend to anyone needing some space and enjoying getting to know the staff of the hotel. We got some Texas hospitality in California ! We will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Feels like Home”
Reviews.Author: happymokwf
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel, service is excellent and informative, location is just walking distance to Hollywood attractions. Only setback is without some hotel facilities but they make it up with free snacks, sodas and dvds. This hotel makes us feel like we are staying at home, definitely will return and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY, BEST SERVICE IN USA”
Reviews.Author: ashton2005
Reviews.Content: This is our second time visiting the States from Perth, Australia. This time while in LA we chose to stay at the Magic Castle Hotel. I have to say having spent almost 4 weeks this year our last few days were at the Magic Castle and we will certainly be staying when we visit again in 2010. The staff could not have been more helpfuil or polite. We were travelling with our 14 month and 5 year old Grandsons, the staff were fantistic with the children. On our arrival the staff had the baby cot all set up and a supply of johnsons baby products for our use. The free continental breakfast was nice as was the warm apple tea at night. The kids loved the free snacks and drinks available from reception any time of the day or night. Once again thank you to all the management and staff at the Magic Castle for our stay. We can't wait to come back. The Owens-Smith family

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1024_9
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here before and came back for the great location, accommodating staff, and excellent value. Rooms are spacious suites, include a complete kitchen, and surround a swimming pool. Continental breakfast is included, as well as hot cider and cookies through the day. They also have a free "minibar" which basically means you can ask for snacks and beverages all day long. Free movies too. Very nice place for families looking for comfort and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “most amazing staff and lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: samamy
Reviews.Content: the staff here were the most accommodating people I have ever met. Our group (my boyfriend and I and three of his friends) caused quite a scene in their lobby and fought over where we were sleeping. They attempted to give us various room options and patiently waited for us to sort things out, offering us apple cider, soft drinks and snacks all the while. They have free dvds to borrow during your stay for use in the room. The bed is quite high off the ground but comfortable. The shower is large enough for two to fit and good pressure. Definitely reccommend this. continental breakfast was included as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, friendly staff, a charming boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JamieWaese
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a room in the sister hotel, Hollywood Hills Hotel, a fine place by all accounts, although the bathroom in room 303 really needs a new paint job.
