All with a cheery smile, too. The breakfast mini-scones were to-die-for! I can still taste their buttery sweetness. Classical music was was playing as we entered our suite. Big fluffy bathrobes were provided, as well as a lovely selection of toiletries. The bedding was very comfortable w/ a down duvet. The kitchen area is huge and well-equipped. All was very clean and comfy, but it could use a little spiffing to be perfect - not a problem for us, though. The owner is definitely on the right track - he's got the best staff I've ever encountered. Thanks to Gretchen, Megan, Mary Jane, Shawn and all the rest - you all are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicSheffield
Reviews.Content: During our stay we received excellent service from all the staff at The Magic Castle. Our room was modern and clean and although we did not use the pool, it was lovely to sit and eat breakfast there each morning. Gretchen who worked there was extremly helpful when we were deciding on which trips to go on. We would recommend not booking tours with LA city tours as we were picked up for the wrong tour, then the following day we were not picked up for our original tour as planned, We then received verbal abuse from the manager of the tour company!. Overall we had a excellent holiday and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base to discover LA - lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: pippippooray
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be a great base for a weeks holiday in LA, a very good, family hotel in a fabulously convenient location and not too expensive (at least not when we were there). Very close to all the action in Hollywood. Carparking was not too expensive at 9 dollars a day - a lot of the other hotels in our price range that I looked at were much more per day. Breakfast buffet was nice (basically cereals, pastries, cakes) and available til 10am, after that staff would offer coffee, soft drinks etc which was very nice. The hotel staff were really friendly and helpful. The room was a good size (we just had a double room not one of the apartments). Access to the rooms is off various little stairways round a courtyard with a swimming pool, so going up and down various small flights of stairs was unavoidable. The walls were quite thin - you could hear a lot of what was going on outside and in next-door rooms, but it was generally pretty quiet when we were there and we werent bothered by it. The bed was really comfortable, the aircon unit pretty efficient, the bathroom clean and good sized, with a huge shower, plenty of nice fluffy towels. A complimentary local newspaper was left on our doorstep every morning which was nice. We were generally out sightseeing all day so it was absolutely fine as a base to come back to at night, crash out and set off refreshed in the morning. We were given excellent suggestions for local places to eat, there are loads of nearly restaurants, bars, diners, cafes. there's a pay as you go internet kiosk in the courtyard. The hotel doesnt appear to sell alcohol. The Magic Castle Club is apparently well worth a visit, but you'll need to take smart clothes ("jacket and tie for men, cocktail dress or trouser suit for women" is what they state the dress code to be) so we didnt actually go there. We would definitely stay at this hotel again - it isnt a luxury hotel, but it is clean, comfortable, family friendly, and well located, with the friendliest and most helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: family4MI
Reviews.Content: Discovered this hotel through a Travelzoo special. It was on the upper end of this family of four's budget, but worth every penny! Parking at $9 was very reasonable and appreciated. This hotel provides a pleasant stay without nickel and diming you after you arrive. They offer movies to borrow for free and even give you a bucket of goodies to enjoy with it. They offered us fresh lemonade on arrival and snacks for the long ride ahead when we left. Very pleasant and helpful staff!! We had an upper floor king bedroom suite with balcony overlooking the end of the pool. Lots of room for a family to relax! The continental breakfast includes pastries, yogurt, cereal, some fruit, juice and coffee. My only suggestion is that they make the breakfast seating area non-smoking. There's nothing worse than sitting there enjoying your breakfast and have the person next to you light up and then linger over coffee continually smoking. The location is outstanding. It's a short walk to Hollywood Walk of Fame, Kodak Theater and the bus stop to get to the Griffith Observatory. The hotel staff will happily help you get timed tickets to go up to the observatory. For my next visit to Hollywood, we will not have to research hotels as we found the one to return to! Thanks Magic Castle for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Mary Jane Rocks at the Magic Castle!”
Reviews.Author: anniet66
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay last week at the Magic Castle. We got a great rate that was advertised on Travelzoo.com. The rooms are okay. They are huge but need a bit of freshening up. Breakfast was sufficient for being free and the pool was nice. Parking for $9 was the cheapest we saw on our trip. The best part about this hotel is the front desk attendant Mary Jane. She provided us insight on where to go and what to do, helped us book reservations at the hottest restaurants and used her connections to get us it. It became a joke that every day we had to go to Mary Jane to figure out what we were going to do and where we were going to eat! She is the best part about Magic Castle and deserves a raise!!! (and no, I am NOT related to her!)

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysbeenyou
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for a â€œonce in a lifetimeâ€� holiday. I traveled with my Mother and 2 friends all the way from Bath, UK. While we didnâ€™t enjoy LA as much as we thought we would, we have to applaude this excellent hotel. For us, it made our holiday. We stayed in a lovely suite with a balcony overlooking the pool. The apartment itself had everything we needed(And the comfiest bed I have ever slept in). It was fantastic being able to take a late night swim or being able to sit by the poolside In the day being served ice lollies. The hotel was also so close to Hollywood Boulevard, the walk of fame and a lot of big attractions. It is also close to the metro station so its easy to get to places such as â€œUniversal Studiosâ€�. Now, I had read how great the staff were but I never expected how amazing and kind they ALL were. Every single employee helped us somehow or another, they were very keen to help us with directions when we wanted to go somewhere and always asked if we needed anything. Our â€œfavoriteâ€� was Sean, who came up to help us when we had problems and then made us a â€œgoodie bucketâ€� for when we were watching the films. If the manager reads this, please make sure Sean knows we were very grateful to him. In conclusion, Iâ€™d like to say that the Magic Castle Hotel has been my favourite hotel Iâ€™ve ever stayed in and would thoroughly recommend it if youâ€™re staying in the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeepsPiper
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. Our suite was huge, like a home away from home, and very comfortable. The location is excellent. And how cool is the pool. But the stand out feature of this hotel is the friendly and personalised service - the staff go above and beyond and with pleasure - a truly rare phenomenon. They all go the extra mile. This was the 10th hotel in which we stayed in the previous 5 weeks and won our favour for all the little things that make such a big difference. It's also great value, especially with the generous complimentary continental breakfast. We would defiinitely stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: emmymac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first two days of our honeymoon in November 2006. The location for access to Hollywood sites was fantastic - very close to the Chinese Mann theatre and Hollywood walk of fame. As it was so close to Hollywood Bld it also meant easy access to the Metro Our room was really nicely decorated and was clean - plenty of room for all of our bags! The beds were big and comfortable. The pool area also seemd nice, we did eat breakfast out there but unfortunately it was too cold for a dip! The thing that set this place apart from a lot of the other hotels on our Honeymoon was the staff. Every single person that we dealt with was pleasant and courteous and so helpful. From recommending places to visit and eat, to arranging transport, we really couldnt' have asked for anything more. Although this hotel may not be very swanky, if you want to stay somewhere that really treats it guests well - then this is the place! Also they recommend a restaurant "Yamashiro". We would also recommend it, the hotel staff take you up to it and also collect you. The view across LA at night is breathtaking and the food is pretty good to! Would definitely recommend the crispy chicken!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: BarDil
Reviews.Content: Decided to write a review of magic castle to express my anger at the continued applauding of this hotel.......Hello, No. 2 hotel in los angeles, it is absolutely crazy that this noisy, basic, grotty hotel is given this status. It is interesting if you look back at the reviews that all the bad ones express the same problems and believe me they are true. The only thing this hotel (more like a motel) has going for it is that it is near hollywood boulevard. Bedroom/apt was a short walk from main motel.It was beside other residential apts. Not very good first impression, very un hotel like. Room had light door with paper thin walls. No dvd player even though all rooms were supposed to have one. Left a do not disturb sign on door when we went for dinner, but came back to see a maid had entered and left two chocolates on our pillows but stole a bottle of piper champagne out of our luggage. I am being totally truthful & sincere when I say this. Hotel will probably write a response to this denying it but I am not a fool. I know when I am fleeced. It is also very interesting if you look at other bad reviews of this motel, that I was not the only one who was stolen from. There was noise all night long from cars zooming right outside our bedroom window and cars pulling in to car park just outside our front door with partying yobs etc. Any reply from Magic Castle in my view is a desperate cry from a desperate motel. Very, very, very dissappointed with this accomodation. It was not exactly cheap either at $300 a night. Do not stay here! Would you like me to say it again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: karendg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle for three nights in April, 2007 along with our friends. We both had one-bedroom suites on the first floor adjacent to the pool and there were 10 of us in all. Everything about this stay was wonderful. The hotel staff are unbelievably kind, helpful and efficient. The full kitchen and the cont breakfast made snacks/meals easy. The hotel's location is central and it's smaller, so it's easy to get in and out of - unlike huge resort properties. The pool was heated and the tables outside it made the courtyard the perfect morning and evening retreat before and after busy tourist filled days.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale and Service, a bit tattered”
Reviews.Author: Cheledonna
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in april visiting family etc. What the hotel may lack in "modern" it makes up for in fabulous staff, free sodas and chips, wonderful continental breakfast with home made baked goods, and spacious rooms. Speaking of the rooms - they are very dated - the furniture in living room was coming apart, the drawers in the dresser of our bedroom had no tracks and the sink in bathroom was mildewed. It's in need of an uplift but met our needs and the weather around poolside was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Good with Illusion of Something Better”
Reviews.Author: jellyb
Reviews.Content: There are two ways one could write a review of the Magic Castle Hotel, from a perspective of comparison with other properties in the area and from a perspective of comparison with all hotels in general. This is the only property I've stayed at in the Hollywood area so I can't compare it to other nearby properties but feel that would be the fairest way to evaluate this property. I research my vacations to death and hadn't run across many properties that had such a uniform, overwhelming positive response so I felt this was a no-brainer. Three words best decribe this place: Location, Staff, and Location. Did I say location? As far as I can tell, if you want to be within walking distance of the center of the Hollywood Universe, this is a superb choice (although there is really not much to see besides the Walk of Fame, Chinese Theater, and the new Mall at Hollywood & Highland - otherwise this area is pretty cheesy/touristy definitely something you can see in a half day.) Nevertheless it is a good base from which to explore other surrounding areas. I'd say the reviews in general overhype this place a tad too much. The staff is on the ball and provide little 'extras' here and there like the champagne glass of lime pop when you check in, popsicles at the pool, the chocolates and weather report card in the evening. I guess these little things really impress people as many other properties don't make the small effort to do similar things. As a result, these little things they do help to give the illusion (yes pun intended) that this property is something very special. The reality is the rooms (at least ours and from reading some of the other reviews) are spacious and clean, but bit run-down and apparently have probably had only minor cosmetic rennovations in recent years such as a coat of paint and maybe some new carpet. Most (not all) of the furnishings are sparse, cheap, dated, and in some cases tired looking. There are many small aspects (although minor) of the room which were in disrepair such as peeling paint on the bathroom ceiling, linoleum coming up around the tub, slidding shudder off it's hinges (which maintenance didn't fix properly), etc. The bathroom is small, basic, and very dated with very old fixtures. It appears the only thing they've done recently to the bathroom is slap some cheap, ugly Corian on the countertop. Water pressure is good and hot water doesn't run out. A big plus. Bedroom bed was comfortable, although a little on the firm side, too firm for my wife. The mattress on the pull-out was a joke. No way anyone over 50 pounds could get a good night's rest on it. Definitely need a new pullout mattress. The rooms have a very (I'm guessing) 1950's feel so don't book here expecting to get something newly renovated with latest furnishing and appliances. I didn't really expect this anyway but you get the feeling the owner is trying to maximize profits instead of reinvesting back into the rooms and the staff is trying to do these little extra things to make up for it. (You can rennovate while still retaining that old-school charm.) Many may characterize the rooms as having a nostalgic feel and the overall hotel having a boutique feel, which it does, and we liked that feel. The pool is small, but adequate. There is no Jacuzzi (a big minus). The layout of the hotel against the side of a hill with a U shape is great as it makes the inner courtyard/pool area shielded from the loud traffic of the busy street out front. Housekeeping service is excellent. I'd recommend staying here but don't go here with high expectations like you'll being staying at a small, boutique version of the Beverly Hills Hotel. I'm guessing that this place receives very high marks partially because comparatively it offers an excellent value for it's location and especially for those that prefer an alternative to the high-rise hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for exploring Hollywood and L.A.”
Reviews.Author: Wicki
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 from Germany and just returned from a great stay at the Magic Castle Hotel in Hollywood. As so many before us we definately can recommend this hotel to just anybody. The appartments, the hotel itself, the pool, the breakfast in the morning... everything was fine and made our 2-night-stay very pleasant. The Walk of Fame is just a minute-walk away, we did explore downtown L.A. using the 1-day-metro-card, station is also just minutes away from the hotel. All the staff was very pleasant and always helpful. We definately will return to this place when we come to visit L. A. + Hollywood again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BrucknerPacific
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my family for 9 days from late March to early April. I stayed in a one room suite and my inlaws had a 1 BR right next door. We were looking for a hotel on the red line because I would be commuting to my firm's office in Downtown LA, and my wife would be traveling around Southern Cal with my inlaws, our 3 daughters, and either my brother or her brother and his new wife. First of all, the location of the hotel is amazing. Hollywood is well located to see everything there is to see in LA. They went to Pasadena, Universal, the Aquarium in Long Beach, Santa Barbara, Laguna Beach. We never had bad traffic. Also, it was a blast staying in Hollywood - our first morning, we went to the Chinese Theater and to the Kodak Theater (although the meaning of Oscar's was lost on my daughters - American Idol was much more relevant). The rooms are huge. The staff is super helpful. The breakfast pastries delicious. The free soda, water and snacks a treat. Really, what more do you want in a hotel. We also went to the Magic Castle. DO NOT PASS THIS UP. What a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: robinmanitoba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Magic Castle Hotel in Hollywood for 7 nights from March 24 to March 31,2007. It was a wonderful experience...we had a one bedroom suite with every convenience imaginable!!! The location was great...within walking distance to so many sights etc. The front desk staff was superb!!! They even provided my husband with a tie and dinner jacket so we could have dinner at the Magic Castle next door to the hotel. There was always a fresh and delicious breakfast in the morning served from 7:00 to 10:00 am. ..plenty to choose from!! Movies were available at no charge and we were given snacks too!!! The suites are nice but could use a little touch up of paint in some areas but it certainly was very comfortable and I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family. We would definitely stay there again... We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to LA as a result of the great hospitality at the Magic Castle Hotel. N&M Wpg.Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Spot!”
Reviews.Author: cruzcontrol13
Reviews.Content: This is the very best hotel in LA (Hollywood). It truly is a "home away from home". The rooms are comfy, clean, modern, with all the amenities anyone might need. It is my third visit at the Magic Castle Hotel and the only place I stay while in Hollywood. The manager, Mike, along with the staff is always welcoming, helpful, attentive, and accommodating...just a delight! It is central to everything, just behind the famous Chinese theater and easy access to all of Hollywood's famous landmarks. The best thing about this hotel is the amazing service and the feeling of being in a cozy environment while on business or vacation. Thumbs up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at the Magic Castle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DharmaGirl
Reviews.Content: I loved this place so much the first time I stayed back in October, that I booked it again for the night of February 3rd. I'd requested the same 1-bdrm I'd had the last time, but they put me in a room that was actually bigger and nicer than the first one! (The bathroom in this one was especially roomy.) Reception was great about getting me checked in quickly since I was exhausted and needed a nap! Again, the sound of soft music was playing as I first entered the room. I should say apartment instead of room since the suite is enormous, with a hallway leading from the large living room to the bathroom, and then another to the bedroom. Just incredibly big for a hotel room! I was going to a comedy club on Hollywood Blvd, and instead of calling a cab in the nightmare Saturday night traffic I was advised by the hotel staff to walk where I was going instead, so I did. That was just perfect. I walked up the bustling boulevard over all the stars on the sidewalk and watched the tourists gawk at the familiar Hollywood landmarks and street performers. It was about a 10 minute brisk walk and well worth it. I got back to the hotel earlier than I'd expected that night, so I went down to the desk for snacks (complimentary) like candy bars and microwave popcorn. I was even able to check out a DVD for the night, free. (There's a DVD player in the full entertainment center in the large living room.) Since it was still fairly early and the hotel shuttle driver was on the site I asked if they could take me up the hill to their sister property, the Hollywood Hills Hotel. (It's on the grounds of the restaurant Yamashiro.) The view of all of Los Angeles and Hollywood from up there was just phenomenal. Evidently, the rooms aren't as nice as in the Magic Castle Hotel, but the views more than make up for it. (No views from the Magic Castle Hotel down the hill.) Afterward, I made my microwave popcorn and a cup of tea in my large full kitchen, and sat out on my big balcony overlooking the pool and just enjoyed the quiet night and the great weather. Overall, another great stay. Management and all the front desk employees went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable and get me everything I needed. I'll definitely be staying here again the next time I go to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: juliemallett
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel from the 26th february 07 til the 6th of march 07, the staff there were brilliant from the moment we turned up, nothing was too much trouble for the reception guys, it didnt matter what time of day or night you required something, they were always on hand and willing to help, the room was very spacious and was cleaned to a high standard every day, and the standard of the breakfast was high, something for everyone, in the evenings the maid came round with chocolates and a card telling us what the weather was going to be like for the following day, ive stayed in a few hotels in america, but nothing compares to this hotel, its the best!!!! a special thankyou to the manageress, ( sorry i forgot your name) for printing maps, and giving us directions to all the attractions. highly trained dedicated staff we will be back next year with out a doubt to this hotel thank you magic castle for making our stay in hollywood such a pleasure julie, nigel mallett, louise small and joshua small

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service!!!- - -what an incredible place!”
Reviews.Author: U4eeya
Reviews.Content: Their website had a slogan that reads "More than you expect." That is truly an understatement. This place is convniently located, which is what attracted us to begin with. More importantly, the accomodations were so spacious- - -like having your own apartment (comlete kitchen!) and clean, well appointed with all the comforts of home. Best of all was the service- - -the helpfulness and desire to please on the part of the staff is unsurpassed!! We'll always choose this sweet little spot over a traditional hotel when we come to LA!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Richchick
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day stay in Hollywood with my 2 teenagers ages 13 & 16. We have enjoyed staying in many 5 star hotels around the world and have experienced very good service. I have to say that the Magic Castle Hotel can stand with the best when it comes to friendly staff, great service, and cleanliness. Arrival: The hotel is centrally located in Hollywood and was easy to find. The lobby is not large but is very accommodating, welcoming and tastefully decorated. The staff greeted us warmly and seemed genuinely friendly. On one side of the lobby there was a large arrangement of cookies, an assortment of teas, spiced cider, and packets for hot chocolate. There was also cool water containing sliced cucumbers. A delicious continental breakfast is served every morning from 7- 10AM. The food is arranged in the lobby and can be enjoyed out by the pool or you can take it to your room. Checking in was quick and the staff carried our luggage to our room which was on the second level. There are no elevators but there are rooms on the ground level if stairs are a challenge. There are also a few steps to the front entrance of the hotel. The rooms surround a large, lovely courtyard. Many of the rooms on the second and third levels have balconys overlooking the courtyard. Ours did not but I will know to ask ahead for one next time we visit. In the center of the courtyard is a 'splash pool'. If you want Olympic laps this is not the pool for you. It is just the right size for a refreshing dip and floating around. My kids loved it. Our room: We had the junior suite and found it to be fairly large and very clean. The carpeting looked new. In addition to the TV there was a DVD player and CD player. My kids brought their laptops and there was wirless internet for them. The hotel has a nice complimentay DVD library. When my kids went to select DVDs they were surprised with a complimentary bucket of microwave popcorn packets and an assortment of candy. The beds have down comforters and the mattresses were firm and comfortable. Turndown service is provided every evening along with chocolate mints. Location: The hotel is located at the foot of a hill within 2 blocks of busy Hollywood Blvd. Once you turn off of Hollywood Blvd the crowds and noise seem to thin out appreciably. The subway is about 3 blocks from the hotel on Hollywood Blvd and we used it to get to Universal Studios. The city was in preparation for the Oscars while we were there. All of these preparations take place in the 2 block area close to the hotel. The Hollywood/ Highland subway stop is closed on the day of the Oscars. Metro and auto traffic is detoured as well beginning several days before the Oscar presentations. Pedestrian traffic is also detoured on Hollywood Blvd beginning several days prior to Oscar day but all the major sights are still accessible such as the Kodak theater, walk of fame, and Chinese theater. I was told that this inconvenience only happens during the week of Oscar preparations every year. We found it fun and exciting to watch the city get ready for the Oscars day by day despite the inconvenience of the detours. Staff: I have never been treated better at any hotel that I have ever stayed at. The staff just go out of their way to make your stay pleasant and enjoyable. They are friendly, courteous and they let you know that they are there for you. When my kids were up into the night with jet lag I spent lots of time going to the lobby for DVD's and snacks and Marzia on the night shift was so patient and helpful. All the staff should be commended. They give you 5 star service and 5 star treatment. There are lots of bigger, grander, more luxurious hotels in L.A. but the staff at the Magic Castle make it stand along side any of them. In my opinion, there is none better. We enjoyed our stay at the Magic Castle Hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: rag714
Reviews.Content: We adored the Magic Castle. It was a real delight to find such clean, comfortable, friendly and quiet accommodations just a block away from the madness of Hollywood Boulevard. From the moment we arrived (and were upgraded to a suite) until we checked out we could find nothing to fault. Our only minor quibble is that our suite was on the back with a view of a wall. However, since we were receiving a spacious suite for the price of a standard room it would have been ungracious to complain. The hotelÐ²'s leek decor, the spacious rooms (at least the suites; we didn't see the standard rooms) the delightful courtyard, and the excellent continental breakfasts (pastries from Susina's Bakery are terrific!) have been mentioned in other reviews and we concur with all of the positive comments. Worthy of special mention is the outstanding staff. Everyone was very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable of the area. Thanks to Nick and Sean (spelling?) for all your good advice and the drinks and snacks! By the way, one of the best reasons for staying here is to gain access to the Magic Castle Club. The only way you can get in to see the magic shows is to be a member of the Academy of Magical Arts or to stay at the hotel. The Victorian building in which the Club is located is a real hoot, dinner was good, and the magic shows were absolutely terrific.

Reviews.Title: “It's the perfect Hollywood experience.”
Reviews.Author: no1pettyfan
Reviews.Content: I am a return visitor to this hotel and it will be my first choice anytime I stay in the area. I have never been to a hotel where they treat you like you are someone so special. I went there with a big group of friends and we were there to see a rock & roll show. We had multiple rooms. Gretchen and her staff took care of our every need. We are still talking about our trip and how special our time at the Magic Castle was. The hotel has a great retro look and you can feel the history there. The rooms are clean and large enough for friends and family to hang out in. It's the perfect place for a large gathering. The hotel is located one block from Hollywood Blvd so it's a short walk to go see the sights. You really get the feel of Hollywood staying here. The pool area is lovely. Whether you are sharing pizza under the stars with your friends at 2am or a wonderful continental breakfast in the morning sunshine it's a warm inviting place. Thank you Gretchen for making us feel so welcome. We will see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “a super find”
Reviews.Author: passageWaterford
Reviews.Content: Like some of the other reviewers we arrived after a 12 hour flight from new zealand. When we arrived I have to say I was dissappointed as the place definately needs a lick of paint and some ceilings had obvious evidence of a bath overflow in the apartment above. That said I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel. We had our 2 kids with us ages 10 & 12 and they wanted to do everything there was to be done in L.A. We did the lot and the front desk staff Mary-Jane and Shawn were fantastic!!! They arranged car hire to be delivered to the hotel and picked up again when we were finished. Saved us money really as Mary-Jane said the subway to Universal Studios was the way to go as the subway station is around the corner from hotel, so we waited until the following day to hire the car. They seemed genuinely interested in what we were doing and always were there with recommendations. And what a location!!!50 meters from hollywood walk of fame, graumann's theatre and all the madness that is hollywood boulevard!!! Big selection of DVD'S for the kids to hire with a box of goodies all free of charge. And you must eat in Yamashiro, the Japanese restaurant at the top of the hill. So thats it. Great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MagnoliaSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The main feature of this hotel is the SERVICE! From the moment we arrived, we were treated like we were in the only guests in the place. The friendliness and professionalism of the staff just blew us away. The room was large and clean, with an incredible view of the Hollywood Hills. The day we checked out, I was lamenting the fact that we were too late for the complimentary continental breakfast. In a jiffy, there was a staff, suggesting we sit by the pool (a gorgeous January day in LA), and she brought us coffee, pastries, scones and warm croissants to enjoy before we left. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel Tucked into The Hollywood Hills”
Reviews.Author: SEJacobs
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel and let me just say, again this staff outdid themselves to make us feel welcome. They have the nicest people working there from the front desk to the housekeeping staff. All led by an incredible manager, Ms. Gretchen Crookes. She is amazing!!!! I can honestly say I have never EVER been to a hotel where I experienced this sort of hospitality. I had the feeling that there is nothing I couldn't ask Gretchen or her staff and they wouldn't try their darnedest to get it for you. The rooms and suites are gorgeously designed. It's an old building true, but beautifully renovated. The furniture has the retro look for that era and I simply adore it. I love the fact that they are the only hotel I've ever stayed at with a 24 hour pool. Throw in the delicious morning pastries and that yummy Wolfgang Puck's coffee and you're in for the hotel experience of a lifetime. Great location too. It's in walking distance or a short drive to every happening spot in Hollywood. You just have such a good feeling when you leave there. I'm sure it's difficult to please everyone totally all the time but if they don't, it's not for lack of trying. They want your stay to be pleasant. I plan to make this place my home away from home whenever I visit L.A. Give it a try if you're ever in town, I'm sure you will be delightfully surprised. Thank you so much to Gretchen and the entire staff for making our stay a most incredible experience once again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great weekend!! Thank you staff of The Magic Castle!”
Reviews.Author: WildflowerNJ
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say what a great experience staying at the Magic Castle is. Gretchen is just the best at what she does as is the whole staff. A few of my friends stayed the weekend and we were treated like rock stars. No detail was overlooked. The croissants were so good I went back a few times for them...yummm!! If you are ever in LA and wish to know how the other half lives, book this hotel. A big thank you to all of your staff, Gretchen, and to you..you guys know how to make a weary traveler so welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service! Excellent value & location.”
Reviews.Author: mellengal
Reviews.Content: Excellent Value & location for the price! We had a group of 33 people (mother-son adventure) from San Diego that were attending Sunday Brunch at the Magic Castle next door and 19 of us stayed the Saturday night at this hotel. The staff was extremely helpful & went out of their way to give us great service. None of my group had any trouble checking in & staff offered complimentary drinks (sodas & water) and DVDs upon arrival. They even brought water to our room later that evening! The rooms were spacious & clean. The kitchen in our room was dated but was very neat..It was very easy (& safe) to walk over to Hollywood Blvd to see the sights. I appreciated the underground garage parking & was pleased that I was allowed to keep my car there after even after check-out while I went over to the Hollywood & Highland complex. It was great not having to pay the H& H parking!!!! The only drawback was the uncomfortable sleeper sofas-we actually pulled off the mattress & placed it direclty on the floor to avoid the "bar". Overall, I would give the staff, cleaniness & location high ratings

Reviews.Title: “Love the Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: toodlee
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 just returned from a 5 night stay at the Magic Castle and it was fantastic. The front desk staff are all excellent. Shawn and Gretchen I remember by name but the entire staff is phenomenal and puts many 4 and 5 star properties to shame. Covered parking at $9 a night is a bargain and the staff will bring your luggage to the room. Our one bedroom suite was spotless and well maintained. A large refrigerator, microwave, utensils and stove (all of which were clean and in working order) just added to a relaxing stay. Ate at Yamahiro's twice, great drinks, unbelievable view and shuttle service from the hotel. No safety issues whatsoever. Occasional glitches in internet service, but the staff was on top of the situation. Can't say enough- value, location, parking and great staff. We will make this our LA hotel for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service of a 3 week trip to USA”
Reviews.Author: kiwizuzu
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing hotel I have ever been to!!!! To all those people who only look at appearences - yes the paint may be peeling, yes the cupboards might need updating etc etc but the FANTASTIC service far outways any peeling paint. My mother and I arrived from New Zealand after a 12 hour flight where we didn't sleep and spent 3 hours in customs then spent over an hour trying to pick up our rental car (that's a whole other review) so my mood wasn't really good! Once we stepped into the lobby and we were greeted by Shawn my mood completely changed. He was fantastic as were all the staff. Everytime we left and came back to the hotel we were greeted with a smile and were asked how our day had been and what we had been up to. We were given maps to different things we wanted to see, were given recommendations for restaurants which were all good, I asked to buy stamps for all the Christmas cards that I was sending home and was told that my mail would be' taken care of ' and it was and when we left we were given a huge snack pack for our drive to Las Vegas which had drinks, chocolates, cookies and potato chips. Shawn and Gretchen are major assets to this hotel and I hope they are still there when I visit LA again later this year. If you have any doubts about staying at this hotel, don't, this is the ONLY place to stay in Los Angeles and the ONLY place I will ever stay when ever I am visiting Los Angeles in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, thanks reviewers!”
Reviews.Author: GracieChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here, I went ahead and booked 2 nights in a 2bdrm suite. We were traveling up and down the CA coast visiting family and we wanted to end on a tourist-y note. Can't beat the location or the service. The area felt safe enough that I let my two teen-age sons walk to and from Hollywood Blvd un-escorted, even during the evening. Big kudos to Gretchen. I called to confirm our arrival and she asked me what she could to do meet our needs. Just being asked was nice. She had books, tour guides all ready for us when we arrived. The rooms do have a slightly run-down feel but I think it adds character. The bedding was very comfortable, the accommodations more than roomy enough for 3 teens, me and my 70 year-old mother. Everyone was pleased which is no small accomplishment. I agree with what past reviews said about the pool, the b-fast etc. If I ever visit Hollywood again I would definitely stay again. Better yet, move the whole place, staff included, to Encinitas. I know I'll be visiting there more than Hollywood. ps if you stay be sure so stop by the pool to chat with Danny. He's a long-time resident and a good guy with great stories.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet, caring staff and a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: cmmb2005
Reviews.Content: I am a single mother with three children. We stayed at The Magic Castle hotel on 1/4/07 and 1/5/07. I had a Jr. Suite with a kitchen. There were a few minor issues which are easy to overlook. In the bathroom, the paint was peeling a bit on the ceiling, and the shower looked a bit worn. This hotel does not boast to be a 4-star, but it is clean, courteous and great for families and those not expecting a hotel of a Four Seasons caliber. This is a nicely run, boutique hotel with an outstanding staff! During that time, I found the staff to be genuine in their offerings of help with luggage, suggestions for dinner and giving directions. My daughter became ill during our trip, and the front desk was quick to help with names and phone numbers of the local pharmacies in the area. They later asked about her and how she was feeling. They also wanted to know how we liked their suggestions for dinner. This staff is the friendliest, most courteous staff I've ever seen. If a guest has problems with this hotel, it is most likely the guest who is being difficult, not the staff. The breakfast was well above the rest, and was put out promptly and well stocked. That breakfast surpasses all the other hotels I've stayed at. The beds and pillows were soft and inviting, and the rooms were large. This was a perfect stay for my family and the kids and I will certainly be back. The location is great...walking distance from everything we had planned to see. The neighborhood was fine. I felt safe there, even walking at night. Next time we come, we'll definitely take advantage of the Sunday Brunch at the Castle. Sorry we missed it. Thanks Magic Castle! Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: Leyland123
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel following all the "wonderful" reviews that we had seen placed on trip advisor. After a 12hr flight from New Zealand we looked forward to booking in. Staff on the front desk where very helpful when checking in and gave us the key to our room. Upon arriving at the front door we wanted to leave, the carpets were filthy, plaster was pealing off the walls and when we opened the door we could have cried. The room was terrible. The furniture looked extremely dated and the shower area was disgusting. All we wanted to do was get some sleep but in all honesty we couldnâ€™t have slept given the conditions. Went down to the front desk and asked if we could change rooms, the new room was even worse. With this in mind we checked out and booked into the Marriot across the road. This was a real let down given all the great reviews that have been wrote previously. In all honesty this was the worst hotel that we have ever stayed in (albeit very short)

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay”
Reviews.Author: kathymander
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay over the New Year's Holiday at the Magic Castle Hotel in Hollywood. The staff were great and even provide a ride up to the Yamashiro Restaurant at the top of the hill above the Hotel. The view and food are incredible. Memoirs of a Geisha was partly filmed here. The hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating. Walked into the lobby to the wonderful smell of hot cider and cinnamon(cookies too). Afternoon tea is available every day. Bottled water is provided as you need it. Our room was spacious for our family of 4: 2 adults and 2 teenagers. We could fall asleep in our bedroom and not hear their late night movie.Had a full kitchen. Every morning we took our breakfast back to our room to sit on the patio enjoying the morning sun. Breakfast was great, cereal, pastries, fruit, yogurt, granola, juices, coffee. There is a pleasant heated outdoor pool for sunning or swimming. Staff helped us with directions/maps and reservations. We did the family brunch at the Magic Castle Club on Sunday at their recommendation. We had great food and were treated to a Magic show that was funny and truly amazing. Our son thought it was as good as Universal Studios. This hotel is located very close(walking distance) to Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the stars walk on Hollywood Boulevard. We took the metro to Universal Studios-it is 1 stop away. We were centrally located to make easy drives of 20 or 30 min to Pasadena, Santa Monica and the Getty Center. We will definitely stay here when we come back to LA. This hotel helped make our vacation an almost perfect trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: lorlexrik1
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews online we booked and had a fantastic experience here. The room was large and clean and amenities like an apt. which made it perfect traveling with our 2 kids. The front desk staff could NOT have been any more helpful and courteous. They shuttled us up the mountain to Yamashiro restaurant, provided driving directions and suggestions of where to go. The only negatives were the pullout sofa's mattress was prettty worn out to the springs and they did not have any replacements and the rooms were not very soundproof as the other bathrooms were quite loud as was the traffic. But- nothing is perfect but this place was close- great location, room and service.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Wonderful Experience...the Staff is the best”
Reviews.Author: tyramisu
Reviews.Content: Several of us from Northern California and Las Vegas met up at the Magic Castle on Nov. 28th. From the moment we entered the lobby (which had warm cider & cookies for us) to the time we left it was the best hotel experience we've ever had. The staff went out of their way to see that we had everything we needed. They called for cabs, they gave us snacks to have on the flight home, they even made each of us a sign as a memento of our trip with the name of the band we had come to town to see...The rooms were fully stocked with all the necessities and the beds were very comforatble. If we are ever lucky enough to be in LA again, we definitel will plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a magic birthday at the Magic Castle Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ExitRatRace
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to go to the Magic Castle Club for my birthday but heard that it was a private club for members only. However, my boyfriend discovered that guests of this hotel were given admission to the club during their stay. The reviews looked good so we took a chance. We were not disappointed. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Upon arrival we were offered cookies and hot cider. The club is just right next door to the hotel, but if you ask, they are happy to shuttle you up the small hill just so the ladies don't have to try and hoof it up there in high heels! I certainly appreciated that. :-) When we came back from the Magic Castle (which we LOVED!) there was a pretty box all wrapped up in a ribbon that contained an adorable mini birthday cake and a card signed by the staff! What a nice touch--and yummy cake too. We were surprised to hear that the pool is heated to 80 degrees year round so we took advantage of that fact and had a romantic and refreshing moonlight swim. (They don't close the pool at night, they just ask that you observe "quiet hours" and not disturb others). The hotel was close enough to walk to all the other places that we wanted to see so it was the perfect place to stay. I would definitely stay there again if I am in the area. Thanks Magic Castle Hotel Staff for a magic birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 21.11.06 for three nights. Had a one bedroom suite overlooking the pool. The suite was great. Spacious, clean and tidy. It does look a little tired in places, paintwork, cupboards etc, but it is really nothing to worry about. The other features more than make up for it. The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate for us, juices, coffee, toast, pastries, yoghurts, cereals etc which can be eaten by the pool, weather permitting, or taken to your room. The staff were very attentive and friendly. The location was brilliant. A few minutes walk to the walk of fame, Graumans Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre etc. We were able to have dinner in the Magic Castle Club. My husband thoroughly enjoyed this. It was a really great place, Magicians were all very good, some better than others though. I would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it, Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: cz2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Thanksgiving trip to LA and I had to comment on our stay at the Magic Castle. Our extended family (grandparents, aunt, uncle,niece,nephew, and daughter) stayed at the hotel for a week while visiting family in LA. This was our second stay at the hotel and while we didn't think our first stay could be topped...it was. The wonderful staff, attention to detail, comfortable surroundings are not a fluke, a one time occurance. This hotel truly cares about their guests and their experience at the Magic Castle and it is evident in everything they do. From the moment of check in, the great breakfast (poolside or in your room), the heated pool (the kids loved it), the comfortable rooms (we love the duvet!) to the movie "packages" for the kids (free dvd's and movie snacks). We have, as a group, stayed at hotels around the world and we all agreed that this is the best! Not the most deluxe, yes, the paint is chipping in places. It is not an exclusive 4 star ,but by far the most inviting, comfortable place. We hope to return next year, the only reason we might not is because my in laws are in their 80's and the stairs (no elevator) :( are really hard for my mother in law ( though she vows to return!) Thank you to everyone at the Magic Castle for helping to make our family trip a wonderful time. P.S. ceiling fans in the bedrooms would be really nice! (especially the first floor rooms)

Reviews.Title: “A fab hotel, very friendly staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Squiz
Reviews.Content: We were nearing the end of a 16 day long trip travelling Route 66 so we'd driven from Chicago. What awaited us in LA was a 2 night stay in this lovely hotel. This hotel was amazing for us and the staff were the most friendly we'd experienced on the trip. We got there expecting a nice room but we were blown away as we ended up having our very own apartment. The first day we were there the rain hammered down so we lent a couple of dvds from the hotel, ordered a pizza and chilled out on our sofa. Everything about our room (apartment) was amazing, from the sumptuous bed to the amazing heating in the bathroom. We wished we'd spent 4 nights there instead of the awful 2 nights we had in Las Vegas. LA is a strange place, I wasn't impressed with it (San Diego is much nicer) but the stay at the Magic Castle made LA wonderful for us!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: OsideLB
Reviews.Content: We loved the Magic Castle! It is a really cute little boutique hotel with the most amazing staff I have ever encountered! Yes, I've stayed at the Four Seasons and in various hotels around LA and no staff comes close. We stayed on our anniversary and while I barely mentioned it as a special occasion they treated us like rock stars. Among other things, we had to change our dinner reservation last minute because the restaurant was too far out of the way before our concert. They got us into the sushi restaurant up the hill, shuttled us up there, and even had a lovely complementary appetizer waiting to start us off. The rooms were great (we had a suite) and the hotel was convenient to walk to the Lucky Strike for a cocktail later. The only thing I would change is the pool. It needs a little updating and is pretty small...real estate is tough to come by in LA. I really can't say enough about the helpful, friendly, fun, & really on-top-of-it staff of professionals. They're the best.

Reviews.Title: “wow! loved it”
Reviews.Author: scoobyscout
Reviews.Content: we decided to pay a visit to los angeles and not knowing a single thing about it we decided that staying close to holywood walk of fame was important to us... after some researching we found the most perfect hotel possible. four minute walk and we were at the chinese theatre.!!! breakfast included. even better. staff friendly and knowledable. yes that was full marks as well. so after relaxing in our rather large private room (which included chocolate on the pilllows) we enjoyed a hearty healthy breakfast by the pool before chatting with the excellent staff on what to do and how to get there. armed with our free map we were soon on the local subways... i highly recommend this fantastic friendly hotel to anyone who is unsure about anything los angeles!!!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely place”
Reviews.Author: jayne.d
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Magic Castle hotel in a 2 bed suite overlooking the pool for 4 nights. All the staff were super friendly, helpful and informative. The pool was great at 11pm at night after a hard day of sightseeing and the rooms spacious and clean. Great beds and toiletries. Just all round great!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTravellers
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for two nights after a long flight from Sydney. The staff were extremely helpful in booking us a Hollywood tour at short notice and accomodated our every need throughout our stay. The room (a one bedroom unit) we stayed in was bright and clean, just next to the pool. The breakfast was plentiful and it was nice to be able to take your choices back to your room. The location of the hotel is great, we got the train easily to Universal studios (a great day). Be aware that Hollywood Bvld is pretty sleazy at night, and there are many homeless people living in the park across the road from the hotel. The staff suggested Micalo's for dinner one night, a short walk from the hotel. This is a wonderful restaurant with singing waitors. We booked this hotel due to the favourable reviews in Tripadvisor and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Friendliest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: hr06
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed the magic castle. The staff were so friendly. The accommodations are clean, a bit old. The location is prime for doing the typical tourist scene. When you enter the hotel there is a bowl of apples and cucumber water to quench your thirst. The continental breakfast was great, fresh croissants and scones every morning. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Forest1963
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect combination of friendly staff and a great location. After a long flight we were welcomed like long lost friends with a drink in the foyer - fantastic! The room was very spacious and comfortable although not luxurious. The breakfast in the morning was relaxed and plentiful. Again, everything being presented in a very friendly way. With the Chinese Theatre and Walk of Fame literally 10 minutes walk away and Universal Studios barely 15 minutes drive, this hotel is very well situated if you only have a short time in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: toby1kenobi
Reviews.Content: We expected more, to be honest, but we ended up in one of the smallest rooms, which was pretty small! Given the price the hotel's not in quite as good condition as you might imagine, however the location is good, the staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfast is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: vreemel
Reviews.Content: I heard about this hotel from a friend that lives in LA. She always wanted to check out the Magic Castle Club (located next door) but couldn't because it is a private club. The only way to gain access is to be a member OR be a guest at this hotel. I decided to be a guest and WOW was it a good choice! When we checked in, they gave us sparkling orange juice, explained everything about the area, gave us maps and quickly helped with our luggage. The rooms are HUGE, the beds are fluffy and the soaps they offer are simply luxurious! I stayed for 6 days so having a fridge in the room was especially helpful as well. I have never stayed at a hotel with a more helpful staff. Everyone was so great... even the maids. It was all the little details that made our stay so memorable... the chocolate turndown service, the small note cards left in your room each evening to alert you to the next days weather, the popsicles at the pool, the FREE mini bar. One word sums it all up; WOW! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel , and location”
Reviews.Author: M2E
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we stayed at during our honeymoon (Value for money too). Staff were very friendly, the hotel room turned out to be a huge appartment, kitchen, lounge, dining table, dvd player, 2 tvs, hi fi, soft music playing, kitchen with drinks and food. Would recommend to anyone. 1 block walk to the walk of fame, chinese theatre, kodak theatre & Hollywood Bowl. Everything you need within walking distance. Just brilliant. Admission to the neighbouring Magic Castle included, Complimentory breakfast and newspaper each morning. Free dvd rentals and tomorrows weather forecast posted in your room each night. Staff go out of their way to help. We stayed in over 5 hotels through out California / Nevada on our trip - most higher star rated and none came close to the quality and experience. Finally upon arrival home after the trip a postcard had been sent hoping you had enjoyed your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service was great, but room just ok”
Reviews.Author: rahir
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night while visiting friends and family. The staff couldn't have been nicer- from the glass of limonada when we arrived to great directions on our way out to dinner and complimentary scones, fruit, and juice for breakfast. We really felt like we were at a small 5 star hotel! The room, though, wasn't up to par. It was really small- barely enough room for the bed, end table, desk, and tv/stand, and the furniture reminded me of the stuff we had in college. The mattress was flabby, sinking in the middle. The tv also had a big purple spot on the lower right screen. The bathroom pretty much matched the bedroom: there was some paint/baseboard issues, and there were no turkish bathrobes as the website advertised. Turndown service was a nice touch, though, and the pillows were really plushy. For us, the location, $8 parking, and service stood out above everything else, and if you're looking for some charm in Hollywood, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Magic staff”
Reviews.Author: AussieNSW
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here on 11th Oct. The staff were funny , helpful and actually were enjoying doing there jobs. They made us feel at check in like we were friends who had come to visit not paying customers. After a long drive from San Francisco we arrived tired and stressed. We arrived a few hours before check in and the check in staff stored our luggage and happily put it in our room when it was ready. They provided us with great directions and suggestions on what might interest our family of 6. The room was clean and suited our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DKFAN
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough for this hotel. My friends and I were treated like Kings and Queens. I've never stayed at a hotel where the goal of the staff is to make every one of your desires and whims come true. My girlfriends and I, shared a two bedroom suite. We had 6 of us ladies sharing this suite and we had room to spare. Two good size bedrooms with very comfortable queen size beds and a living room with a sofa bed. We also had two full bathrooms and a wonderful apartment size kitchen with the works. We had traveled from all over the states to see a concert and the Hollywood Bowl, and they knew about this and welcomed us with a special card and some nice little treats and candies. They also provided us with a 6-pack of Coca Cola. After the concert, we were all very hungry, the young man working the front desk ordered pizza for us to be delivered on the patio by the pool. It was a perfect way to end the day. If I am ever in Hollywood again, this will be my choice from now on for a hotel. Gretchen and staff are incredible! 5 Star treatment with a 3 Star price. Doesn't get much better than that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GirlandBoy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is less than a five minute walk to the Walk of Fame and Mann's, even for me in my flip flops. Hotel location also means you are close to some of the main bus routes (along Hollywood Blvd) for those using public transport to get about like we were. Rooms are clean and the suite we had would have been big enough for us to live in! Breakfast being included is such a bonus and we really enjoyed eating it by the pool each morning. As mentioned on a number of other posts the staff are absolutely fantastic and could not have done more for us. They give us great directions every day and great advice on what buses to take where. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Else Mattered”
Reviews.Author: 1stclasstraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was charming and MOST of the staff was friendly. We loved the spacious room, but couldn't take off our shoes, as the carpet was filthy. None of the positives really mattered once an employee stole my medication out of my room! One of the medications is not carried by many pharmacies, and is very expensive. I spent the entire last day of my trip searching for a pharmacy. Obviously, they do not do background checks or use good judgement when hiring. They did not discount my stay or compensate me in any way. The cost to replace the medicine was $460. I have no idea if the employee was even fired. Beware, and do not leave valuables or medication in your room! I will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: catvic
Reviews.Content: what a lovely hotel. staff could nt do enough for us. easy going clean and friendly. how we d love to go back. so close to everything you want to see. kids made very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: TimPithers
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle Hotel is right in the middle of Hollywood - you can't beat the location! It's about 2 minutes walk from the Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese Theatre etc. This was fantastic for our 5 night stay as it put us in a perfect location from which to explore everything we had set out to. The hotel's staff is probably it's greatest asset, as all of the members are very friendly, welcoming and incresibly helpful. Our suite was spacious and comfortable but quite dark and hot. I guess that was due to it being a ground floor room. The air conditioners worked fine, if a little noisy. Maybe a 1st floor room would be better. The DVD player and CD player are nice additions as is the DVD collection available at the front desk. I think the hotel would benefit from a lick of paint, especially around the pool area, but this didn't spoil the enjoyment of our stay. We really enjoyed the breakfast buffet (delicious croissants) as it was a nice relaxing start to the day. We took up the offer available to hotel guests to visit the Magic Castle Club next door which proved to be an enjoyable evening of dining and magic. The interior of the building is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend it enough!”
Reviews.Author: MissRyan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a double room at the Magic Castle, for our week long trip to LA in June 06. When we arrived we found we had a *huge* suite. The staff were absolutely lovely, friendly and funny and very attentive. It had a great pool, a laundry room, and tasty breakfast was available every morning. The suite was great, complete with a good sized kitchen and balcony. The only slight let down was the bathroom, which could have done with a lick of paint, and the carpets could have done with a bit of a clean, but generally it was excellent, and extremely good value for money. The customer service at the hotel was really good, they left Hersheys kisses next to the bed every day, and in the evenings left us a card with the next days weather forecast on so that we'd be prepaped. The staff always had time to listen to you, and were full of suggestions and recommendations. The hotel is in a great location, just next to the walk of fame, right in the centre of Hollywood. I really can't recommend it enough. One night we went for dinner at the Magic Castle club, which is next door, and while it is a beautiful building, and the magic shows were spectacular, the food was overpriced and not very nice. I'd recommend going for the shows, but definitely not for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, great value”
Reviews.Author: Sharon55
Reviews.Content: Our "junior suite" turned out to be a spacious one-bedroom apartment with full kitchen, lots of closet space, and many extras and suprises. Two chocolate cakes and some gifts awaited us in our kitchen when we checked in , courtesy of the hotel (we were celebrating our 2 children's birthdays). Staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful. This place is an amazing value, especially considering its location in Hollywood, just walking distance from major attractions. This is a great place for families. We will definitely go back next time we are in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Some paint would be nice”
Reviews.Author: westyboy
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is friendly, clean and centrally located, but what they reallly need to do is get some good painters and plasterers in there to touch up some of the crumbling walls. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “a brilliant all suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Cs.
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter aged 17, son aged 14 and myself stayed here for the first 3 days of September 2006. On arrival we were greeted with a glass of iced lemonade. The suites are generous and open onto a pool. The room rate is reasonable and includes a buffet continental breakfast. There was fruit and iced water available all the time. What impressed me most was the helpful and caring Front Desk staff. Noneof them could have been more helpful or charming and they all went out of there way to offer help, advice and takeway menus! We had a super end of vacation stay here and I would definately stay here again. The location on the road parallel to the Road of Stars is ideal and a Metro is just 5 minutes stroll away and one stop from Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: Proboscus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. It is a small old fashioned boutique hotel with the best of everything - not in terms of glitz and glamour - in terms of the things that really matter. The suites are roomy, modern, clean, and comfortable and have every amenity you need. The beds were great too! There was enough room to stay for weeks; in fact it was like a small apartment. The pool and layout of the hotel is perfect and makes you feel like you are in a community. The location is great if you want to walk around Hollywood and do the tourist stuff. Walk up to the Hollywood Bowl and see the museum there. It's interesting. The unique and plentiful breakfast was delicious and great way to start the day - sitting at the pool and eating fresh baked goodies. There is parking under the hotel for a reasonable price and it is easy. But the absolute best thing about this hotel hands down is the staff. From the minute I spoke to Gretchen on the phone to book the room until the second we said we left and Mike and his staff said goodbye - all of them were amazing! They deserve a customer service award. Even my two teenage boys could not get over how helpful the staff was about everything. And always pleasant with a smile and a friendly attitude. As my boys put it " Mike is the Man". They were very impressed. Oh yes, and don't miss the view from the restaurant on top of the hill above the Castle - also one of their properties. The food was great there too! I would go back to LA just to stay at the Castle again. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: destination1
Reviews.Content: I truly agree with the entry on July 19th. The two bedroom suite was also not very clean. It may have been the old dirty carpet that made it seem dirty. There were cracked tiles in the shower. A very old ironing board that you pull down from a small closet in the kitchen. Ice cube trays and not an ice maker. Oh that's right, it was an old refridgerator. A closet with cleaning supplies that looked like a junk closet. A small swimming pool, that even the kids (ages 12 and 13), did not like. Wireless internet service that did not work. I would never stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone. As much as we paid for our 4 night stay, it was not worth it. The only good thing about the bedrooms were the comfortable beds with the white comforters. We had the desk clerk call for a cab when it was time for us to leave. We waited for 30 minutes and no cab showed up. I believe the cab company that was called only own two cabs, a mini van and a car. I had to go down to the street to flag a cab down myself.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel customer service ever!”
Reviews.Author: mpcmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle twice in the last year and have never experienced such incredible service before. The staff is willing to fulfill all your needs: everything from a knife for the kitchen to detergent for the laundry to directions to anything in LA. We stayed in one of the one bedroom suites, which was very spacious--about 800+ square feet. It had a large living area, dining area, and smallish, but functional kitchen. The bathroom was nice and the king sized bed was very comfortable. There was also lots of storage. The pool area is very nice and the staff will regularly bring you popsicles. The continental breakfast is absolutely delicious and is supplied by a local bakery. It is within walking distance of the Hollywood Walk of Fame and Magic Castle shows are free to guests, although, unfortunately we were not able to take advantage of this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ariadante
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Magic Castle with our 7 year old son over the weekend and made a visit to Universal Studios ( 10 minutes away ). The Suite we stayed in was ok and the hotels rooms seemed just ok but they make up for the lack of upgrades in excellent customer service and location. They are pretty central to most areas in Hollywood and close to many attractions. The Japanes restaurant which is affiliated with the hotel on top of the hill has an amazing view and beautiful interior and the food and service is somewhat slow but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great visit”
Reviews.Author: Radar_Geek
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Magic Castle Hotel in July. I had read reviews about how good the staff is, and these reviews are no exaggeration. We were greeted with soft drinks in wine glasses and given popsicles at the swimming pool. The front desk gave us great advice on tours and restaurants and made reservations for us. They were very knowledgeable about the area. The quickly helped us with anything we needed. We had one meal at the Magic Castle Club. It was a very unique experience that was quite enjoyable. The hotel is well located. We were able to walk to Hollywood Boulevard for tours and sight seeing. The fee for parking a car was more reasonable than other hotels in the area. We never had problems finding a parking place, and the parking lot was very secure. The rooms are not new, but they are well maintained. We had a great deal of room, and the kitchen was very convenient. The hotel was very charming and had a lot of character.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families. Loads of Space”
Reviews.Author: traceyp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the one bedroom suite ( room 105) for 3 nights last week. Our family of 4 included mom, dad, daughter 13 and son 10. The location of the hotel was great for walking to the majority of the Hollywood sights (Chinese Theatre, Kodak, Starline Tours, El Capitan theatre, Disney Soda Fountain, and the Hollywood and Highland Shopping Center). The room had more than enough space and was clean and provided all the necessary amenities. The staff was extremely helpful and we enjoyed the breakfast every morning sitting at the tables by the pool. Other users mentioned the bathrooms as an area of concern, so I was a bit worried. However in our room, there were only two specific issues: there was no working extractor fan which probably caused some of the peeling paint on the ceiling over the shower and the towel rack that they chose was far too flimsy for the weight of the towels and was begining to come loose from the wall. But that is it!! The remainder of the room was very nicely decorated to modern standards for a boutique hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical stay”
Reviews.Author: wrw1105
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel during a vacation to the LA area. The hotel is small but in a great location, just two blocks from Hollywood Blvd. One of the best parts was its association with the Magic Castle. Minors can't get into the Castle to see the performances except on weekend brunches and unless you are with a member. The only exception is for those staying at the hotel. Since my son is a magic buff, that was a big attraction of staying there. However, we were pleasantly surprised with just about everything. Most impressive was the staff which was so incredibly friendly and helpful. They were never overbearing but always willing to help out. The rooms were decent, but not overly impressive. They had everything we needed. I was a little taken aback by the carpets, which looked a little worn, but half-way through our stay, they were being replaced. The beds were very comfy while the bathrooms were a little tired, but still very functional and clean. Every morning there was a continental breakfast served in the small lobby. I ususally took my food out to the pool-side tables and sat there. The pool was a great feature; it wasn't too big but was great for cooling off. My only complaint was one night, at about 2 a.m., some drunks jumped in and were a little noisy. But that was an isolated occurence. If you're there on vacation, you can easily walk to Hollywood Blvd and all the attractions there. As well, the hotel next door -- which I wouldn't suggest you stay at -- is where Janis Joplin was found dead. Overall, I'd go back to this hotel in a minute, based largely on the staff. Great job

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye27
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 recently stayed in a refurbished 1 BR suite for 8 nights. Our family includes 2 young teenagers. The hotel is a wonderful central location for LA and surrounding areas including Walk of Fame and Chinese Theater, beaches, Disney, Universal, Dodger game, etc.. The refurbished suite provided excellent space for the 4 of us to spread out and either watch TV in the BR and living room or read the morning newspaper at the the kitchen table. The continental breakfast included fresh croissants, scones, fruit, cereal, juice and coffee. The beds, pillows and bathroom towels were very comfortable especially after a hot, sandy day at the beach. The small pool was refreshing. Upon arrival, our room included treats for the kids and a bottle of Pinot. The staff also provided a roll away bed. The underground secure parking was a welcome convenience for only $8/night. We felt very safe and secure at this location. The staff on all shifts were very nice and accomodating with driving directions and a very welcome good morning or afternoon! A special thank you to Gretchen, Nick and Darren for their hospitality. During our stay, I viewed several hotels considered on Trip Advisor and would honestly say that my choice was the correct one. I would highly recommend this hotel for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good...”
Reviews.Author: woolpitch
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Magic Castle twice now and really enjoyed both stays. The location is perfect - a 5-minute walk to the Hollywood & Highland area, but far enough away from Hollywood Blvd to be quiet. Also very easy to get on the route to other tourist areas, eg Santa Monica. The hotel has obviously had some refurbishment in the last couple of years, but - as others have posted here - the decor still needs to be updated in some areas. The bathroom in particular looked very old. But in terms of getting the exotic 'old-style Hollywood Motel' feel, it's right on the money. Despite the old bathroom, I would certainly stay here again and would recommend the hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE HOTEL AND ITS AWESOME STAFF”
Reviews.Author: BRboy
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about the Magic Castle Hotel and its incredible staff. The experience was great from the moment we arrived and all the way through check out. At check in, we were provided with sparkling italian sodas (an unexpected treat on such a warm day). The rooms were tastefully appointed. And they even had complimentary breakfast and free wireless service. The best part of our stay is when we went into our room. There was a chocolate cake and a card signed by the staff. I'm not sure how they even knew it was my birthday. I highly recommend staying at the Magic Castle. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Magic of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: RTown
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed one night at the Magic Castle. Our overall impression is the Magic Castle was worth the stay. It is extremely close to all the Hollywood action. The rooms were as described with nice linens and clean appearance. Our room had new carpet. Parking is a reasonable $8 a day, not uncommon in LA no matter where you park. The front desk was friendly and we received a cold bubbly beverage upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Buen hotel para primera vez en L.A.”

Al parking se accede con la misma tarjeta de la habitaciÃ³n y tambiÃ©n desde la zona de la piscina. Otra cosa que nos fue genial fue la habitaciÃ³n de la colada. Hay lavadoras y secadoras por 75 centavos el ciclo. Nos vino muy bien para ponernos al dÃ­a en ropa limpia despuÃ©s de 2 semanas de viaje y con todavÃ­a 2 mÃ¡s por delante. AsÃ­ que la valoraciÃ³n de las instalaciones, un 9. Y por Ãºltimo el personal del hotel. Os tengo que decir que todos los comentarios que hay en la web son ciertos. El personal se desvive por los clientes. Tiene un detalles que te quedas alucinando. A veces hasta por demasiado. Os pongo un par de ejemplos: Cuando hice la reserva comentÃ© que Ã­bamos en nuestra luna de miel pues bien, al entrar en el apartamento estaba el equipo de mÃºsica sonando con unos temas muuyyy romÃ¡nticos. Yo me fui directamente a la habitaciÃ³n porque nos habÃ­an dicho que habÃ­an dejado un detallito, y allÃ­ habÃ­a una botella de vino de viÃ±as californianas con sus respectivas copas. DespuÃ©s, cada anochecer, pasaba una mujer repartiendo bombones y nos informaba de la previsiÃ³n meteorolÃ³gica del dÃ­a siguiente. AdemÃ¡s, mÃ¡s de un dÃ­a que hicimos la siesta, vinieron por la tarde a volvernos a hacer la cama que, por supuesto, ya habÃ­an hecho puntualmente por la maÃ±ana. Â¡Me sabÃ­a hasta mal tantos detalles! AsÃ­ que de atenciÃ³n por parte del personal un 11!!!

Reviews.Title: “A magical place....”
Reviews.Author: MrsPacker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are avid travellers and we loved this place. It is an older hotel (it used to be an apartment building) so no, it isn't perfect but we found it to be clean, comfy, in a great location and offering one of the finest young staffs we have ever dealt with. Full kitchen, nice bedrooms. A lot of bang for your buck. Delish breakfast by the pool gave us the opportunity to meet interesting people. The pool was small but enjoyable. A great opportunity to visit the adjacent Magic Castle and see a great show (dress up!).
