Within walking of Grauman's and the hubub of Hollywood Blvd, so there are plenty of places to eat, people watch and buy groceries. Staff bent over backwards to be helpful. Caution: some of the rooms are near a busy road, so ask for a quiet room. We go to L.A. every year to visit relatives and we plan to return to the Magic Castle Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: MeanieMaureenie
Reviews.Content: We needed a quick get-away for a weekend... and spent out time here 4th of July weekend. We originally made our reservations from Orbitz.com, but when our room was not was what we expected, the manager quickly upgraded our room to a suite with no extra charge or fuss. We were greeted with sparkling lemonade and were continually accomodated with cold popscicles through-out the hot day along the pool. They even had people come and give us the forecast for the following day. Everyone at the Magic Castle Hotel was more than accomodating and gave us the most relaxing weekend I have had in a very long time! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ladydi1780
Reviews.Content: I booked the Magic Castle Hotel after reading all the great comments on Trip Advisor...and what a great decision it was! We stayed in an adorable 1-bdrm suite...very clean and comfy!! The staff is wonderful and very considerate.....we were in town for my husband's 30th b-day and upon arrival there was birthday cake and a bottle of wine!! The hotel even made reservations for us at the Magic Castle Club where my husband was surprised with the restaurant staff singing "Happy Birthday" while bringing him ice cream. The manager, Darren Ross, was very helpful in planning our stay and Mary Ann even shuttled us up the hill to the Magic Castle Club so we wouldn't have to walk in the heat! I can go on an on about all the great things we experienced at the Magic Castle Hotel. I definately recommend it and will return the next time we are in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay, Jr. suite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Magic Castle on July 12th and 13th. We stayed in room 213 which is the third floor with steep steps and no elevator. Large living room TV, with pull out sofa, if this pull out sofa is necessary for sleeping look elsewhere (thin mattress, thick metal bars in the middle of your back, ouch!!) Eat in kitchen clean, balcony looking over pool (very nice). Master bedroom with thick cottan bathrobes, very comfortable bed with TV. Bathroom was a problem peeling plaster walls cold water faucet in shower would not shut off completely. Linolum floors in need of repair. Staff was outstanding can not say enough about them, they are the reason for repeat business. Breakfast was okay, coffee, tea, juices, assorted fresh fruit, cereal, assorted mini muffins, toast, scones. This hotel has the potential of being a three or four star if they truly upgraded all rooms. My room was supposed to be a refurb., but did not show it (one could only imagine what it looked like before). Location was great, two blocks from Kodak theatre, El Capitan theatre. Overall this is an old hotel, in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Unique Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff is wonderful. The hotel is very unique and cozy. We stayed there with a wedding party and the layout of the hotel made it so easy to mix and mingle with family we haven't seen in years. The rooms are spacious and not stuffy like most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lissete
Reviews.Content: We reserved a 1 Bedroom suite which was very ample & comfortable. We are a family of 4, 2 adults & 2 teens. It was nice to just go to another room to get away from them. The breakfast is basic but nice, it was enough for us to get a start to our day. The room has TONS of storage, which was great for us since we were packed for 16 days. The bed in the bedroom was kind of hard for me. I have a SAM adjustable bed at home so what may be hard for me may not be for others. We did ask for a roll awa which never showed but the girls decided that they could both sleep on the pul out ok so we didn't persue it. They have a laundry room which I did use, only $.75 per machine & they supply the detergent. They also offer free WiFi which was really slow through out our stay, sometimes we could not connect at all. I guess this is hit or miss. This is an older apt. building so it does have it's quirks. These little things did not get in the way of us having a nice stay. The staff is super friendly & eager to please. The only thing we regretted was asking for a top floor suite! From the garage to our room we climbed about 40 steps! My husband practically had a heart attack bringing up our bags. A staff member did help with our bags and we almost killed him as well, we had HEAVY bags! I will consider the Magic Castle Hotel if we ever return to Hollywood but we will definitely not request the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “misinformed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We telephoned from the East Coast, but were not informed (a) that the Magic Castle Club has a dress code or (b) no children are allowed. So, our stay was very disappointing for our two teenageers. For one of them, the Magic Castle was to be the birthday surprise. The hotel should inform potential guests.

Reviews.Title: “Underwelmed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed at the physical appearance of the hotel. I had a very different interpretation from the website. My 1 bedroom suite was spacious but it was not elegant at all. More like an old dated apartment. The linens were really comfortable and the staff was very nice but the hotel itself was not.

Reviews.Title: “A Crappy Bathroom Can Spoil A Stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler42
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Magic Castle June 23 - 26, 2006 in room 113. This hotel is a real mixed bag. Great location in the heart of Hollywood. But a bathroom that is in desperate need of renovation. Helpful, friendly staff that is really attempting to keep an older facility going. But an incredibly uncomfortable and droopy sofa bed that was cruel and unusual punishment for our teenage sons. Unexpected extras like free DVD loans and juice in a champagne glass on check in, but they couldn't find a remote for our TV. But our big complaint was the bathroom and not the fact that the bathtub was so old that the porcelain was worn off. Our issue was the toilet. There was a large plunger strategically placed next to the toilet that I had to use at least four times during our stay. We complained and the maintenance team came the next day. When we returned that evening, the toilet wouldn't flush at all - they had broken the chain and left. Another call and the team returned and within the hour, we could flush. Sort of. The saga continued but I won't dwell on the details other than to say that one time we lost the battle resulting in an unpleasant overflow. The staff took $50 off our bill but that's not enough for us to take the plunge again at the Magic Castle.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but room was a little musty”
Reviews.Author: FHWNPW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in June. The staff were very friendly and helpful but the room was lttle a musty. We opted for a one bed suite and the room was a great size, this was a refurbished room however due to the choice of colour of the carpet the room didn't look newly refurbished . On our last night the people upstairs had the TV on all night which kept us awake so wasn't a very pleasant ending to our stay. All in all we had a great stay, especially as this is only a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what I expected”
Reviews.Author: kryptonicat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after browsing through this website and expedia and the like. Some of the pictures showed the motel with very contemporary rooms. However, when I arrived at the hotel I was less than impressed. It must be said that there are two sides to this hotel. On the one side, you have what are called "one/two bedroom suites". These are the the rooms you are going to see in the pictures when you are booking. However, the room I got was a "deluxe queen" I believe. These rooms it seems are not yet renovated, and not at all up to the standards of what you pay for. My girlfriend and I checked in to what looked like a rennovated apartment building next to the magic castle. Not met by sparkling cider and not shown to our room as the other guests were when checking in. The first room we went to had a broken lock to its connecting room which made it free for me or my neighbors to open up our doors and enter each others rooms. So, the hotel decided to place a small table in front of the door to make all well. Beyond that, the room was sitting well in the 90 degree range. So...we asked for another room. No problem there...and we were given another unimpressive, unrennovated room. The room was steaming again and until we left we had to run the air conditioning unit on high to stay at all comfortable. After complaining about our first room and expressing our concern that we didnt get what we paid for, nick at the front desk said he would try and get us in to a nicer room the following day. Next day....back down to the front desk to ask about a new room (and to ask why the wireless internet wasnt working, which we were directed to a 1-800 number for tech support). We were told by one of the ladies that since we didnt come to the front desk by 11am someone was already booked in the nicer room. So were they willing to give us some kind of discount or do anything for us? Nope. She said she tried to contact us, even though our phone never rang and we were only about 30 feet away for her to walk and knock on our door. So following that...we decided to check out early. We had already walked along the strip the previous day and didnt mind moving a little bit further away. During our complaining and early departure, not once did we talk to Mike, the front end manager who sat just behind the glass at the front desk, or did we talk to darren, the hotel manager who was onsite as well and who also knew of the situation. On the positive, this motel is extremely close to the Chinese theater and if you get a rennovated room, your stay will probably be quite nice. However, while I stood at the front desk to check out I called Comfort Inn and Suites and got an exceptionally nicer room for about $40+ cheaper, but it was just a little futher off the strip. Basically, only stay here if your going to pay the extra for the larger rooms, and that is if you really want to pay that much. If your just looking for a room close to the strip, there are more than enough close to hollywood blvd or sunset that are quite cheaper and much nicer. On a side note of the staff at the Magic Castle, Nick was professional and nice enough as was one of the other gentleman we were helped by on our first day there. However, the two ladies we ran in two at the front desk on the next day seemed to possess little knowledge and even less tact. But, most of all the management was not at all up to calibur. Providing no contact giving us no explanation and no apology. We got the sense that this was not the first time the motel has had to deal with people in our position.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: flyingfinn76
Reviews.Content: Pool was nice, breakfast was excellent and room was fine too. Nice and helpful staff, enough parking space, free DVD's. No problems!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nine Women....Yes 9 women went to Hollywood. Before we left I read many reviews on the Magic Castle Hotel and it always had positive responses. The hotel was located in a great location if you wanted to walk to Hollywood Blvd (stars on the sidewalk), the Kodak Theater and the Chinese Theater. The hotel staff was on the ball and every hotel should be trained by them. If they did not have something you needed they were going to do their best to accomodate you. I have never been treated so nice. The hotel is a little on the older side but the rooms were really spacious and very clean. The daily weather card was a nice touch too. The continental breakfast was tasty and brought in every morning from their local bakery. I really recommend the Magic Castle and if I were to go to HOLLYWOOD again, I would stay their in a skinny minute. GREAT job hotel staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle from June7-10th. We had a non-renovated room. It was older (with iron marks on carpet), but not bad at all, in fact it was quite roomy and very clean. We had a one bedroom suite so we had plenty of room to spread out. The hotel is very close to Hollywood Boulevard and all its' crazy attractions. Two not so great things...the pool feels like they put ice cubes in it at night. And the maids never serviced our room even though I kept putting out the "please appear" sign each morning. I had to go get myself new bath towels every day. Also, a little minor comment, someone might want to mention that they CHARGE for their parking ($8/day). Did I miss that on the website? Maybe that is the norm for LA. All in all we had a good time here (my son & husband enjoyed watching their own tv shows on the two tv's and I enjoyed them not arguing over who is hogging the remote) :) The staff is great & quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “More Motel than Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTxn
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and I stayed at the Magic Castle hotel on business last month. Not quite the "boutique hotel" I was expecting. Felt much more like a budget travel motel with the window unit air conditioners and iron burns on the carpet. Wireless internet did not work well at all. If you're trying to locate a cheap room near the Walk of Fame - ok. If you're needing a business class hotel because all others in the area are full - keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming”
Reviews.Author: ilovechristmom
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and it was extremely nice for the money. We were greeted by Gretchin who always was perfect to help us with any driving directions or suggestions throughout our stay. We were also given sparkling fruit juice upon check in which was very tasty. Our room was 106 and had new carpet and was spotless. It was also very large which was needed for our 4 teenagers. 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms were fantastic. It was my daughter's graduation trip and they actually had a gift for her ready in the room! Very nice! I would have given a perfect score but the air conditoner and electricity in the room had problems but they did make sure for the second night we had nice new fans blowing in our rooms, which they had to go and purchase and assemble. They also mailed a postcard waiting for us when we arrived home thanking us for our stay. More than expected is what this hotel does. I would definately recommend this hotel for it's location, size of suites, customer service and cleanliness. Great Great Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: raven11
Reviews.Content: Have been at the Magic Castle Hotel for 6 nights. Got a non-renovated room for the first night, a bit wore-down. Complaint. Got a renovated, perfect room the next day just like in the advertised pictures and bottle of redwine for the inconvinience. Was totally satisfied. Breakfast was far beyond average, milk, coffee, tee, muffins, cookies, toast, oranges, apples, croissants. Could even take it with me to my room. Complimentary newspaper every morning. Roomservice was excellent, everything clean. Staff at the reception was polite and very helpful. And the location is perfect for everything. If IÂ´m looking for somethimg to complain, the only thing was the not so excellent TV reception in my room ( 109 ). But who is in L.A. to watch T.V. anyway? So, over all, if your looking for a not-so-expensive-hotel with a first-class-service you are definitly right wit this hotel. And if you are lucky, you meet Tom Cruise on your last day in L.A. just right around the corner like i did...

Reviews.Title: “Mother's Day Treat”
Reviews.Author: MWVCAA
Reviews.Content: What a sweet little hotel! My daughter and I arrived from out of state for a Mother's Day weekend retreat. She had the fold-out couch and I got the bedroom. The mattress was excellent and the duvet and down pillows were superb. As all the reviews mentioned, the staff were all super friendly and bent over backwards to help you. Maps and tips on fun things to do were readily given. They even bought me a six-pack of Diet Dr. Pepper, as they had none stocked, and put it in the frig while we were out! The pool, heated, is open 24 hours, so we took advantage of that. We never took a taxi - the subway is two blocks away, as is shopping, dining, and people-watching. Try Mel's Diner - very good. And go to Universal Studios during the week. We went on Monday - no lines at all. But remember, it closes at 6 pm! The hotel seems quite safe and it was quiet. Rooms were being renovated with new carpet as we left. Our room could use some new carpet as well, but it was very clean and did not have an odor. The CD and DVD players were a plus! Thanks to Ashley, Mary Anne, and Nick - these were the only names I caught, but as I said, everyone was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice for LA”
Reviews.Author: JonKMontreal_Canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a TV crew at the Magic Castle, and although I suffered many jokes about wanting to stay at a hotel with such an odd name it turned out to be a great spot. LA is tough for hotels - so much of the city is not a city, at least by non-LA standards - it's hard to find a place where you can actually walk to a store or restaurant. The Magic Castle - which seems off of a set for a TV show or film - is well located, friendly (in the best sense of the word) and comfortable. If you get a "suite" it's really a one bedroom apartment - some of the small rooms, however, can be quite small. Rates vary according to season - but most of the year it's quite affordable. There is no elevator - which would have been a problem except that the staff lent a hand and even with a lot of metal boxes we were okay. Jon - Montreal, Quebec

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - its great”
Reviews.Author: bridge65
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 14 days in April 06. Had a one bedroom suite which had a very comfortable sofa bed in the loungeroom for our daughter. The location is excellent being very close to Hollywood Bvde. There is also a store there to buy your groceries/provisions etc. The staff are excellent - nothing too much trouble, and the housekeeping was very thorough. DON'T stay in a hotel, boxed into a confining air conditioned room - stay here and enjoy the balcony, fresh air, kitchen and comfortable furniture. The beds are excellent and the pillows a dream. There is a laundry with cheap washing/drying facilities - a necessity for a longer stay. Internet too. A light breakfast is also served. The train to get you to Universal Studios is very close. Walk up to the Japanese restaurant just behind the hotel for a terrific view. If you go to the Magic Show at the Castle, gentlemen need a tie and jacket. We went to some very nice restaurants only a $10-$15 US ride away. The taxi from LAX is about $45-$50 US. So we highly recommend this as very good value for money for those people who want a bit of room around them, above average service and good location in Hollywood area. Thank you to ALL the staff for making our stay so enjoyable and comfortable. The Andersons, NSW, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Staff - Avoid Suite 222 At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: MercerIslandMom
Reviews.Content: This review would have 2 stars if not for the staff. I researched Hollywood hotels for quite a while, and loved Magic Castle's spacious 2 bedroom site with the hip, new furniture displayed on the Magic Castle's website. Our family arrived and was ushered to Suite 222, the one room outside the hotel which was a (recently?) converted studio. It was dingy, had only 1 of the 2 promised bathrooms, offered closets so musty that I immediately re-closed the doors, and a shower the size of a coffin. But the real horrible twist was the paper-thin walls and the loud noise from the street. I immediately requested a room change but none was available and the newbie clerk said "just close the windows". With all windows closed, this heavy sleeper was awoken multiple times and finally crawled into bed with her children in an inner room where noise was still heard. I went to the clerk the next morning almost in tears: for $250 a night, I expected more, at least a decent night of sleep. She ended up refunding the night's charge, assigning us to a new room (switching us with new unfortunate guests), and treated us to a box of treats. Very pleasant. The new room was all that I had expected: light, roomy, and hip. No street noise since we were in a courtyard off the street. It was recently renovated but already wear was showing through, but still, after that nightmare Suite 222, it was heaven. Great staff. Ready, helpful, and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “The Magic Castle is Magic!!”
Reviews.Author: V-Bareford
Reviews.Content: We loved this little hotel! From the first experience with the front desk to the last good-bye as we drove out of the secured parking lot, this was just the most pleasant experience. The French lemonade that was served as we checked in was a delightful way to begin our stay, and it only got better after that. Any problems were addressed immediately and with a smile. Directions were very good and a map was printed off when needed. It is not the fanciest or the largest, but it is just a wonderful, fun and clean place to stay while in Hollywood. In fact, you would never know you were only two blocks from one of the busiest streets in LA, it was so quiet and peaceful. We will definitely be returning to the Magic Castle!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stumc1
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is a great little hotel, just a few minures walk from Hollywood Boulevard and Manns Chinese Theatre, yet in a quiet quite location. Its also close to the subway and Universal Studios, and has its own secure car parking garage. The staff were really friendly and the breakfast which you could eat by the pool was ok. The bedroom was large and the beds were VERY comfortable. All in all it was a great base for exploring Hollywood and the rest of L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: VarshaLondon
Reviews.Content: We stopped in LA returning from Hawaii and stayed at the Magic Castle for 2 nites. A very small hotel with good size rooms, we stayed in a single bedroom apartment. The staff were very very friendly. Quite hotel..needed refurbishment but given the excellent location was reasonable value for money !. Kodak theater and lots of shopping just walking distance. Parking available as was wireless Internet access at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “spacious and relaxing - little gem in LA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's not the Four Seasons, but it's not Four Seasons price. Incredible value for your money...the suite is literally a one bedroom apartment with full kitchen, dining room, living room with DVD player, and 2 tvs. Separate bedroom. Ashley and Marcelle from front desk are amazing and helpful and so are everyone else whom I came in contact with. The whole hotel is like Melrose Place and although the carpet is a little worn, the bed was so comfortable with down pillows and down duvet. It was the most relaxing stay, simple pleasure....I would definitely come back. The Magic Club brunch/show was okay....lots of kids so depends on what you are looking for...activities for the kids, great! a relaxing morning brunch....no....my 12 year old daughter loves it. I definitely can skip this as food is mediocre and show is mediocre. I love the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and Delightful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BJB1945
Reviews.Content: This place is simply the best. We were greeted with smiles and the famous, but not very often found, American 'Can Do' attitude to any request or enquiry. We had a one bedroom apartment that was stylishly and simply furnished. It was clean, the bed was 6' and had lovely cotton linen and down duvets and pillows. The bathroom, although not modern, was again clean and had everything you could need, including nice toiletries. There was a television in the living room and the bedroom, and also a DVD player and CD/Radio player. Each evening, whilst we were out, one of the staff came and tuned the radio into soothing classical music and left a hand written card on the pillow telling us the weather for the next day, together with two Hersheys Chocolate Kisses. Each morning, a free newspaper was delivered to our room. Breakfast is included in the rate, and although the pastries are delicious, there is a lot of sugar in them, and also most of the cereals are of the less healthy variety. This is the only negative I could find. There is an excellent laundry with washing machines and dryers and it costs $1 per machine load! This is not well advertised. There is also free internet access, although when I enquired, the manager offered to loan me his new laptop, so I was able to sit by the pool and check my e-mail! I have read reviews mentioning stairs to climb. Well, the hotel only has ground floor and first floor rooms, so is hardly in the league of needing a lift! We were on the first floor and the balcony overlooked the pool, as do most of the others. The stairs are really not an issue, unless you have a real mobility problem. The location is perfect for all the Hollywood sites, and we hired a car, with the help of the wonderful Reception Staff. They also printed off detailed driving directions to Universal Studios and the Getty Museum. In three months of travelling, we found no hotel staff to match those at the Magic Castle. They need to be publically recognised. I am sure they go home with a smile on their faces, as they do a great job with total commitment and must feel very satisfied at the end of the day with all the people they have made happy. I would stay here again without any doubt, but probably bring some healthy meusli with me!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay at the Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: bostonjazz80
Reviews.Content: We just returned from April spring break in Hollywood with our two teenagers, and we loved our four nights at the Magic Castle Hotel. First and foremost is the service at the hotel. It is rated as a "two star" place, but that doesn't do justice to the very customer-focused attitude of all the staff. They helped us whenever we needed it, and they treated us with a sincere friendliness that you don't learn in customer service class. It seems that the owners or managers have done a great job of hiring the right people. They all seemed genuinely concerned about our happiness at the hotel, and they went out of their way to help us whenever necessary. Again, this wasn't the "false smile, patronizing attitude pretense" that seems to pass for customer service; this was a bunch of nice people trying to make sure we had a good time at their place. One example: Our key card was not working for us to enter their garage, so one of the staff members came out of the hotel to help. (Yes, apparently they were monitoring the garage entrance and noticed our problem.) When I pointed out the problem, the gentleman used his card to open the garage for us, then said that he would run inside, re-program my key card, and meet me in the garage to give me my card. (Yes, he came down to meet me.) This is just one example of how they went out of their way to take care of us. We also enjoyed the other aspects of the hotel: the location is great (close proximity to all of the Hollywood attractions), our 1-bedroom suite was spacious and decorated with personality (not a generic hotel look), and the heated pool, although on the small side, gave us a peaceful retreat from sightseeing (my kids loved the pool). We had a great time at the hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Spacious accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Marilou009
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Magic Castle hotel with our two teenagers and had a 2 bedroom suite. The suite was apartment style newly remodelled, with large king bedrooms, bathroom, large lounge and full kitchen. Beds were very comfortable and bedding was good quality. The remodelling has definitely been done on a tight budget. New kitchen and beds but old carpet and living room furniture. Bathroom had new toilet and vanity but old bath with repainted rather than replaced tiling. Great to have a kitchen but only cooking utensil provided was a milk pan so couldnt really prepare a meal so still ate out every night. Reception staff were very helpful and friendly. Even though the weather was cool and wet for April our boys used the heated pool every evening. Breakfast was OK but you have to eat outside or in your room. It was very wet during our stay and we had to carry trays of food through the rain and up many steps to our room. If travelling with the family we would definitely stay here again for its good value, spacious and clean accommodation and its great location, but if we were without the kids we'd probably look for somewhere a little more upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Many amenities and great value”
Reviews.Author: arlenejoe
Reviews.Content: This is a fine location in Hollywood - 1 block from Grauman's Chinese Theater and the whole tourist scene on that same block. Good eating, lots of movie theaters, shopping, fun stuff happening all along the sidewalk, stars and handprints of celebrities. Yet, the hotel itself feels residential. In fact, the hotel was an apartment complex before, so the feel is very homey around the swimming pool. Service is the best - friendly, quick to fix the shower door, very responsive. They certainly aim to please. Yamashiro's, the famous upscale restaurant in the gorgeously historic building overlooking the city, is part of the business, so they booked our dinner reservation and drove us up to the restaurant. Best part is that the hotel stay allows us entry into the Members Only Magic Castle. We had Sunday brunch there with our kids and saw 3 shows. Very fun afternoon that lasts 3 hours. The price is a real bargain for what you get. Don't expect a physically sparkling site - it's an older building that's been remodeled nicely but not extravagently. The only downside is the noise. Pretty noisy, especially with the cheerleading team that was in town for a competition. We probably wouldn't stay there again because we wouldn't need to be in that location and see the magic shows or dine at Yamashiro's again, but for a one-time treat, I'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BLGAW
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 5 (parents, 2 teens and a grandmother) that stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel March 11-14. The hotel is located at the bottom of a hill, next door to the Magic Castle Club. My mother and I would walk up the hill to the Japanese restaurant (Yamashiro's) at the top to enjoy the view each morning. The location is very good for just walking to the Kodak Theater or Graumanns Chinese Theater. Since we had a car, it was also centrally located to everything else. Our one bedroom unit was always clean. The furnishings were kind of "art deco" simple. We also had a small kitchen with stove and refrigerator. The staff was awesome!! They could answer any question about Los Angeles and always did it with a smile and additional information that I would not have thought to ask. (I am wondering if they have to take some kind of knowledge test before they are hired?) They were always very accomodating and quick to bring extra towels or blankets when we asked. Since the weather was chillier than we had expected, we did not use the pool. But our daughters are hoping to come back during the summer. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place . . . Lots of Steps”
Reviews.Author: speerlaw
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle hotel was fantastic! As an amateur magician, I had heard that the hotel was not the best place to stay at, but I disagree with that now. The hotel is a renovated apartment complex that was built in the late 50's. It has been completely renovated and is very comfortable and clean. The staff was great and the service was 110%! The only drawback was that there a lot of stairs leading up to your room, so if you can't handle stairs, make sure you have a room on the lower level. GREAT STAY!

Reviews.Title: “3 Perfect Days”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went off of Trip Advisor reviews and from a world traveler, I can tell you that sometimes the reviews do not match the experience. In this case, they did. From Sean to Gretchen and Mary Jane, the front desk staff treats you like family. They set the perfect stage for your stay, no matter your request - be it for a baby's crib or just general help. We loved the room, in fact, I wonder how this can be classified as 2 stars? To me, it was a 4 star experience, both the room itself and the staff. The shower in our bathroom has a little wallpaper problem - but it is easy to overlook when so many things about the stay were perfect. When I return to LA on business, or with my family, we will stay at the MC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: PinkLadyOne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days during Christmas vacation, 2005. There were 6 of us; 2 seniors, 2 adults and 2 children, and we all thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. While the building is older, worn, and was never fancy to begin with; the rooms are big, comfortable, and in a perfect location. The service we received from the entire staff was very friendly and the best customer service any of us had ever experienced. I told the staff that I would post a positive review here and on cruise critic as a way of saying thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Not as "magical" as we hoped!”
Reviews.Author: nls1330
Reviews.Content: We spent two February nights at The Magic Castle based on Trip Advisor reviews. Because of the high rating we expected above average accomodations, but were disappointed. Our street facing room was noisy and we had to run the AC fan at night to block out the traffic. Our biggest concern, however, was the bathroom. The linoleum tile had two cigarette burns, the sink was sluggish and the aluminum doors on the tub enclosure were encrusted with years of gunk and mildew. The bathroom was in dire need of renovation and should not have been offered to guests. On the positive side the suite was large, staff was friendly and the location was good for touring the Hollywood area. All in all it was OK but not a No. 1 rating in our book!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: psc7811
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for 4 nights Feb 19-23 based on previous reviews in one of the renovated one bedroom suites. It would be redundant to detail all of the plusses (location, staff, room, breakfast) to this fine hotel since I agree with all of those mentioned by recent reviewers! I wouldn't hesitate one second to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Hollywood treasure”
Reviews.Author: mkata
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a brief but delightful stay at the Magic Castle Hotel, where the staff is exceptionally helpful and friendly, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the homey atmosphere is a welcome antidote to the surrounding Hollywood glitz. As hotel guests, we had access to the neighboring private Magic Castle club, where we were treated to a terrific dinner and an evening of top-notch entertainment. This was our first visit to the hotel and we can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good hotel for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: Kamaainamama
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2-year old son and I went to LA last weekend to visit my sister-in-law, and we stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel overnight, based on the recommendations I had read on this site. I was very pleased to find we agreed with the very positive comments. Our room was spacious, tidy, and well-equipped (e.g., kitchen has eat-in area with table/chairs for 4 and comes with dishes, glasses, dishwashing soap; plenty of towels; 2 plush bathrobes), and with the pull-out couch in the living room, we were able to let our son go to sleep early in the bedroom while my husband and I stayed up watching television and relaxing in the living room. The staff was warm, helpful, and accomodating. When we called to ask for recommendations on take-out/delivery in the area, they brought menus to our room. We later called to inquire about drink vending machines, and sodas were brought to our door. The following morning, we found the continental breakfast options to be ample, and of much better quality than you find at many chain hotels. The only glitch we encountered was a lapse in hot water, which we were told was a problem the hotel was having, and that was remedied within a few hours. I should also note that travelers keep in mind that this is a 2-star hotel--there won't be a *wow* factor upon entering the hotel, and there are certain signs of use (e.g., bleach stain on the sofa, chipped pain on the molding) that you wouldn't encounter at, say, a Ritz Carlton. But bearing that in mind, I felt the hotel was a very good value and the excellent customer service can't be beaten--we would certainly stay there again the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in LA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ever since my family found this hotel, we never look back and find another place to stay while in LA. We have been staying at this hotel (mostly 1 week ++ per stay) every holiday season since 2001. It feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality, Hospitality, Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: newmansgang
Reviews.Content: I booked six rooms for myself and colleagues for a stay in Hollywood to attend a teacher's conference. I did this after consulting Tripadvisor, and I'd have to say that our experience was even better than the reviews. Darren, the Hotel Manager did his best to make us happy from booking through check-out. In fact, I left my luggage at the hotel and did not realize that it remained behind at the hotel. We were already at the airport, and it was too late to return to the hotel. After a call, Darren saved the day by delivering the bag to the airport himself-on his day off! The rooms were spacious, clean, and the bed was firm and like sleeping in my own. All of the desk personnel were friendly, concerned and consistently helpful(including shawn, ashley, gretchen, jason and stan). These people are so good at what they do that they should open a hospitality management school. The breakfast was very, very good -scones, croissants, wolfgang puck coffee, cereals and fresh fruit. We have traveled quite a bit (around the world), and I must say that this establishment is one of the best values out there. So, if you're planning a stay in Hollywood, strongly consider the Magic Castle!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: alwysluv2travel
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Magic Castle from 13 Jan to 17 Jan in a 2 bedroom suite overlooking the pool. The set out reminds you of Melrose Place with apartments overlooking the pool area. The 2 bed suite is very spacious with the most comfortable king size beds ever (on our 6 week trip). Our two children (9 and 6) loved the heated pool. Having a guest laundry (at reasonable cost) was a bonus especially when travelling for long periods. Okay this may not be five star in appearance but the cleanliness and staff outweigh any appearance factors. All staff (I mean all) were exceptional. They are extremely friendly and wealthly in knowledge of the Hollywood area for tourist facilities and restaurants. They cannot do enough for you. The complimentary breakfast was excellent as well. My family is use to cereal for breakfast and finally found a Hotel that supplied this. (We found American food a little hard to get use to.) I will absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. Our only disappointment was not going to the Magic Castle (no suit/tie packed) but having 3 TV's to cover everyones night time viewing needs helped us through. Do yourself a favour and visit this hotel. I certainly will be on a revisit to Los Angeles someday. Thank you Magic Castle Hotel you did not let us down. More information you can email us. The Graham Family.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational service”
Reviews.Author: Hollybear
Reviews.Content: My family spent 3 nights in a Magic Castle self-contained suite in October 2005. From the moment we got there the staff were incredibly friendly, helpful, intelligent and funny, and this made our stay there an absolute delight. I chose this place for the price and because of the comments made on this website by other travellers who were so impressed with the service. The 2-bedroom suite more than met our needs (including 3 TV's, which set the kids in raptures!). The suites look out over the pool - most of the suites have balconies as well - and it was just a lovely cosy atmosphere. While we were loafing around the pool we were offered towels, free bottled water and even icy-poles! Breakfast is included in the price and consists of a good selection of cereals and juices, together with great coffee and fresh cakes and pastries. You can eat by the pool or take it back to your room while you read the complementary paper. As well as being terrific value for money, the location is excellent; one block from Hollywood Boulevard and one metro stop from Universal Studios. All the hotel staff were friendly and helpful, always. I have never stayed in a hotel where everybody was so good-humoured. On our last day we left our bags at reception before flying out later that day, and I was wondering what to do with a pair of Mickey Mouse ears that would probably get scrunched in transit. When we came back to collect our bags, Gretchen (front desk) had packed them in a separate box, with 2 polaroid photos of her and the office manager Mike modelling the ears. How cool is that!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindaabc
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. Good location. Staff is very helpful and know all about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at the Magic Castle for our Hollywood getaway weekend after reading the reviews for it on the internet. We loved it and will not stay anywhere else if we ever get back to Hollywood. Mike Filson really knows how to pick his staff, as every person who worked there was friendly, helpful, and willing to do whatever it took to make our stay pleasurable. They took the time to counsel us on where to go, how to get there, and even helped us get the transportation we needed. The rooms were spacious, and although the bathrooms were a little older, we never found that to be a problem. For those who like to cook, there is a kitchen in every room. The hotel is within walking distance of Hollywood Boulevard and all the attractions there. We took taxis wherever we went, and rented a car for one day. I highly recommend this hotel, if for nothing else, the excellent service always with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: BCoak
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for over a week in Oct/Nov 2005. We were in town for a child's surgery so we actually spent a LOT of time in our room recovering. Our one bedroom suite held my wife and me, two boys (one and three) and two grandparents, with a roll away bed. The bedroom was very spacious: big bedroom with a king size bed, great bedding, huge closets, big dresser, tv and room for our pack n play (traveling kids bed/playpen). The living room had a nice couch/bed, two chairs, footstools/coffee table, nice desk, armoire with tv, dvd player and lots of storage and plenty of room for the roll away bed. The kitchen was small but perfect with a fridge, microwave, oven and a nice dining table. The bathroom was big enough to give two toddlers baths(nuf said) and had nice towels. There was much more closet space in the entry and the hallway. We had a nice little porch that looked out onto Franklin Street and everything on Hollywood Blvd (Hollywood Walk of Fame, Manns Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre, El Capitan Theatre, Egyptian Theatre, Hollywood and Highland shopping). There were plenty of windows so the room was nice and light. The staff is the reason we are coming back for the next surgery. They were friendly and helpful. They recommended grocery stores and restaurants. Any problem we had, they took care of (the complimentary wireless internet went goofy for a while). When we got back from surgery, they remembered our boy's name and talked to him and asked him how he was doing (he was up and about just hours after surgery). Some on this site have nit-picked about the rooms. The nit-pickers may have been much happier at Howard Johnsons where all the rooms are exactly what you expect before you even step in. This place has character. The furniture is very IKEA. We had to do alot of child proofing. It's a little loud (it's in the middle of Hollywood, did you really think it was going to be dead silent?). We LOVED our room (#103 I think). Parking was great. It's relatively cheap and we parked right in front of the door almost every time, all hours of the day and night. The parking garage is tight but works just fine if you can drive your car. Turn down service is great. Breakfast is great. Laundry worked great. Pool looked great (didn't actually use it). Location is great. Staff is amazing. If you go to LA to eat at TGIFriday's, don't stay here. If you go to LA to see LA, people watch, travel with family or just have fun, I can't recommend this place enough. It aint perfect but it's our LA home.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a good room!”
Reviews.Author: scooby007
Reviews.Content: The mixed reviews on this hotel are confusing but completely understandable if you have actually stayed at the Magic Castle. I think part of this might depend on which room you stay in, having booked this hotel some time ago I was surprised to read today that some of the rooms have been refurbished and redecorated as ours wasn't. A new kitchen and bathroom probably would have increased my impressions considerably, unfortunately knowing this was one of our 'budget' choices we didn't think to request another room The breakfast is different and very good, unless you are like my husband who insists on meat at every meal! We had a one-bedroom suite and this was very large and well-equipped although I wouldn't have enjoyed cooking as the kitchen was just too old. It is also as everyone has said very noisy. I have to say this as well, although I have tried not to judge the hotel as its location is good for Universal and the Chinese Theater. However I would not recommend Hollywood for LA virgins its just not a nice area, and as this hotel seems to be recommended for families I can only presume that they would be driving everywhere during their stay. We were recommended to stay closer to the beaches and if we go to LA again this is what we will do.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place to stay ....”
Reviews.Author: Cartman88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle for 3 nights in Oct 2005 â€“ we only chose this hotel because of the continual positive reviews we had read and we were not disappointed. From the moment we checked in we were made to feel welcome â€“ helped us with our bags before we got in the door - offered us each a complimentary bottle of water â€“ gave us a good run through what the hotel and surrounding areas had to offer â€“ basically offered to help with anything we needed. We did have some problems with accessing the internet in our room and they came straight in and sorted it out. The accommodation was very spacious with a separate bedroom and living room and kitchen. The location is one street back from Hollywood Boulevard and only a couple of miles from Universal Studios. Have to say a big thanks to Shawn and the rest of the staff for a really enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our Place in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaferDavis_CA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel last week and it was terrific. Just like having an apartment in L.A. We felt very comfortable there - just like we were home. Who wants to go on vacation and not feel relaxed? - that's what the Magic Castle is - home away from home. Big comfy one-bedroom - plenty of room for us and the two kids. The beds are like heaven and we enjoyed breakfast poolside. Also loved taking the Metro to Universal - Needed the car very little. Great staff -always a smile and more help than you asked for. Its definitely "our place in L.A."

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, especially with kids! Unique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kikamoose
Reviews.Content: I loved the Magic Castle Hotel! This was our third time in LA, and on my previous two visits, we stayed at the five-star Park Hotel. This time we were traveling with children, and I was a little leary because I made my seven day reservation based soley on the reviews on this site. Turns out, I enjoyed the Magic Castle above the five star hotel. First and foremost, the staff is exceptional, from the front desk to the maintenance staff. Anytime we needed anything, we simply picked up the phone and it was delievered immediately to our door: extra pillows and towels, DVD's, even take-out menus when we inquired about suggestions for the best Asian take out. One morning we decided to drive to Malibu, and I stopped by the front desk to ask for directions. I was provided with several maps, driving directions, and even great recommendations for the best restaurants along the way. We were even told which beaches were the most scenic/ secluded. We all loved the daily breakfast, which is not your typical run-of-the-mill continental breakfast. The coffee, scones, and croissants were fabulous. My son loved the chocolate chip scones. The woman who assisted with breakfast remembered my son every morning, and would save his favorite scones for him. In fact, on the morning we checked out, she sent us off with a couple of scones for a snack on the plane. In addition, we would return every evening after a long day of amusement parks, tours, or shopping to the turn down service. Not only were our beds turned down and candy left by the bedside, but also the CD player was on and tuned to classical music and tomorrow's weather forecast was left on our bed table. Second, our room offered plenty of space. We stayed in a two-bedroom for 7 days. The was plenty of room for myself and my husband, my parents, and my two children, ages 7 and 9. Each of the two bedrooms housed a king-size bed with a down comforter, mirror closet doors, beautiful lamps, bed side tables, and a large dresser. The children slept on a comfortable queen-size pull out sofa in the living room. The entire apartment appeared to be newly renovated, with whimsical modern furniture (very IKEA). The bathroom was completely new, with a beautiful glass shower, plenty of mirrors, and track lights above the vanity. There was also tons of closet space, with large closets in both bedrooms and another large sliding door closet (see picture) and additional drawers/ shelves to store the kids stuff in the hallway. We enjoyed afternoons at the pool, with frequent popsicles and spa-like facial cloths. There is also an inexpensive laundry right on site. I used the free pass to the full size gym 4 or 5 times. The gym is a short walk away (about 3 blocks) and they have great music, plenty of machines and TV's, and free parking. The gym was never crowded, which surprised me for LA! Furthermore, the hotel is close to everything in Hollywood. It is a two block walk from Hollywood & Highland, where you can find the Kodak Theatre (where the Grammys are held), the Chinese Theatre, the Hollywood mall (Starbucks, Lucky Brand, Victoria's Secret, Build a Bear, and tons of other stores and restaurants), and Hollywood tours depart all day. The subway also stops at Hollywood and Highland, and you can take it 1 or 2 stops to Universal Studios. If you are considering renting a car, you honestly will not need it for everyday of your trip if you plan to do the Hollywood thing. You will only need it for longer drives, like up the coast or driving through West Hollywood/ Beverly Hills. Finally, we did experience a minor issue with our accomodations, and when we brought it to the attention of the manager, he was most apologetic and gracious, and addressed the situation beyond our expectations. All in all, this is a great place to stay, particularly with children or a group. When I return to LA, this is the only place I would consider staying. Thanks again. PS- I apologize if lighting is off in pictues, they were taken with camera phone.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent time at this hotel, it was actually my second stay there and now the only place I will stay when vising in LA which I travel to apprx 4 times a year on business. The service is excellent, the staff are extremely helpful and lovely. The rooms are apartment suites and therefore very spacious and great value for money. The hotel has recently undergone refurbishment so everything is in good condition. Location is a real plus, particularly as I am a single female traveller, shops and restaurants are in walking distance and the area feels very safe. A big bonus for me is the WIFI in all the rooms which is complimentary, this works impeccably which is a necessity for me and my work. I have and would advise anyone travelling to LA who needs to be located in or near the West Hollywood area to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff shame about the accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Truth19
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of October this year and only picked this hotel through the views of the people on this site. I have to agree that the staff were brilliant, howevere this did not mitigate the fact the first 1 bedroom suite we were allocated was appalling, suite 219, insect screen had fallen off, the kitchen work sufaces were cracked and it looked like the kichen had not been replaced since the 50's. The bathroom was not much better, again cracked tiles, the shower screen, I am guessing was meant to be clear glass, however this had turned to a disgusting limescales opaque colour. We complained and were moved to an alternative suite. This at first seemed very pleasent until closer inspection. The bath had not been sealed properly, which had led to the floor rotting away in the bathroom and the hallway. For no one to have said anything before we arrived was hard to believe, but when we pointed it out it was temporarly rectified. In conclusion, stay at this hotel if you don't have high expectations and would like great service.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought the Magic Castle was a good value. The staff was exceptional - each person we dealt with took extra time to suggest good restaurants or things to do, and also helped us with transportation, reservations, etc. It made the difference for the hotel in general, which could use a little updating: ie) the carpets should be cleaned. The bed was very comfortable, and our room was spacious and clean. The kitchenette is a definite asset. We (on the 1st floor) didn't notice many problems with noise. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Much to Fault It (But)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had chosen this hotel totally on the back of reading reviews on tripadvisor. When you are working to a budget, you want absolutely everything for the best price. I had asked for a view of the pool before our stay and the staff were lovely about this.. We had only booked a double which dont have balconies but they gave us the only room with a huge window overlooking the pool which looks lovely at night which is all I had really wanted having seen the pictures on the internet beforehand. We could just see the Club twinkling opposite above the other rooms. We were a bit unsure about how safe we were in LA so we decided to order takeaway to our room both nights. Despite asking lots of questions about how to go about this, the staff were always pleased to give advice and offer us menus to look at. I have to say that both meals were absolutely wonderful. I was a bit disappointed with the room I guess as it had no bedside lamps which meant that you had to get out of bed to turn the light off and also despite having items to make coffee, no coffee machine??? The thing which I found most difficult however was the noise. I am from the country in Lincolnshire and am used to quiet at night but there was a constant hum all of the time - we guessed from the pool. But on top of this, the fridge was also very loud and our neighbours decided it was a good idea to play their TV very loud until about 3 in the morning not considering other guests at all. This is of course our honest opinion and wouldn't want to put other people off from using what is a lovely hotel in a great location, with great staff and secure parking (small charge). Not it isn't 5 star but then it doesn't claim to be!!

Reviews.Title: “If this is the third best hotel in LA, stay home!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there totally on TripAdvisor reviews. Big mistake. The staff IS very friendly and helpful, so if that is what you are interested in, go ahead and stay there. Our room (not a suite) was about the size of my bathroom at home. It was badly in need of paint and maintenance. (especially the bathroom) Our bed was like a rock. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff and Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Swissmiss007
Reviews.Content: The staff and location make this hotel so extraordinary. The room we had (two bedroom suite) was clean, large and reasonably quiet. Yes you can hear the people upstairs and you can also hear pipes and ventilation. But I dont think you can find better in a city like LA. Gretchen (thanks for the lift!) Ashley and Jason looked after us SO well. You dont need to spend money buying an LA guide-book with such invaluable help and information at the front desk. Nothing seems to be too much trouble. With our high Swiss standards, we were more than happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: KCTraveler6
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended! Excellent hotel with a great location one block off Hollywood Blvd next to Kodak Theater. Staff was very good. Heated pool made it enjoyable for a fall swim. One bedroom room was huge.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: smiley53
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was excited to stay at such a neat place. I was initially disappointed, because I requested a poolside room but got 208 (climbing 4 flights of stairs from parking in the underground garage),to find that it looked out the back hill. The room was old. The overhead light wasn't working. Even plugging in my batteries, the outlet didn't work. The shower was was showing its age. But we called the front desk, and they fixed the light right away, and we found an outlet that worked. Then we settled in. Each day we grew to appreciate it more and more. The bed was so cozy and squishy with the pillows and duvet. The rooms were big, with 2 TVs. Our son had the hide-a-bed, and felt like he had an apartment to himself when we went to bed. The breakfast was so yummy. It poured while we were there, and I wondered how we would get our breakfast to our room; but no problem: they had cut plastic bags to cover our trays. They also had umbrellas for anyone that needed them. All the staff were exceptionally nice to deal with. I feel though, its sort of "the squeeky wheel gets the grease", stuff happens when you complain, but the first day the room still wasn't cleaned at 4:30PM, and no extra shampoo, and towels (for 3 people). But the next day (after complaining), the room was cleaned earlier, with enough towels, and shampoo. It truly was perfect for us. It was fun watching the DVD "The Italian Job" where part of it was filmed just a couple blocks away! And noticing Spiderman jump out of the way as the cars drove down the Metro stairs! It was a fun stay, and the staff were right on in all their recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “First-class Hotel like no other”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Magic Castle Hotel in Hollywood was truly a pleasure. We stayed there while celebrating my wife's birthday. Even before we got there for the weekend, they had begun catering to us. On their website I had secured a great rate of $129 a night for a standard room. I called and went through options for our evenings out, including one at the infamous castle, and after advising me at length Ashley and Mike made all of the arrangements exactly as I had hoped. Upon arrival Darren, the manager, had upgraded us to a suite at no charge, and while we were out Gretchen even snuck a birthday cake into the room to surprise my wife. Darren also arranged for a complimentary appetizer at Yamashiro for us, a nice touch on our first night that made us feel very at-home. Every member of the staff was all smiles, polite and very competent. And everything they had arranged for us went like clockwork the entire weekend. The day we were leaving, we missed our wake-up call which Sean had arranged and Ashley actually knocked on our door to make sure we were up! I would, and will, go back in a second. Never before have we been treated with such great care and customer service, to the point we felt like royalty. And the suite was huge, breathtaking, and well-furnished and kept. I can't say enough about this place. They're the best.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with the Magic Castle Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a hotel for my family's vacation, I went on some other websites. I had a friend tell me about tripadvisor and I am glad he did. I was a little hesitant about booking this hotel, but after reading the comments, I felt better. I even called the hotel and spoke with a wonderful lady who assured me that my family would be taken great care of. So I booked a 4 night stay in a two bedroom suite. Upon arrival, they assisted us with the bags, took them straight to our room. The guy who checked us in was quick and even offered us complimentary water bottles. It was great because it was warm outside. After check in, the agent showed us to the room. The room was clean, large and the furnishings were great. Even a dvd player and cd player. The beds were great. Wanted to take the mattress home with me. Every morning my family and I would eat the fantastic complimentary continental breakfast poolside. The scones, muffins, croissants were all wonderful. They even have the employees serve you more breakfast. Such service! It's a great way to start your day. The second day we didn't know where to start the adventure. Everyone at the front desk was so knowledgable of the area. Any time we had a question, they were there. Never dealt with such friendly staff. Everytime we walked through the lobby or past an employee on the property, they always greeted us and smiled. My kids loved the pool and especially loved the free popsicles. On a hot day, it's a nice treat. My wife loved the lavendar chilled face cloths that was brought to her poolside. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Definately, a 5 star hotel in my eyes. You can't get better service. I want to say thanks to Mike, Ashley, Gretchen and Shawn. All who were wonderful. And also, the wonderful breakfast lady who kept my coffee cup hot and full, THANKS!! I will definately recommend this hotel to everyone I can. Keep up the good work Magic Castle Hotel. I can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, location & staff”
Reviews.Author: cadgwith
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Tripadvisor users for your recommendations re this hotel - you were right. We stayed 7th to 11th September 2005, and it was great. I'd asked for a quiet room, on the top floor, with a bedroom away from the pool, but a balcony overlooking it, and that's exactly what I got (we were in room 215 - a suite). We had very little problem with noise - once a TV from next door could be heard through a connecting door, and some kids were in the pool late one evening - but, as our bedroom faced the back, and the connecting door led onto a hallway, not our bedroom, we were fine. The breakfast was good, the laundrette very cheap and convenient (with soap powder free!) & the lift up to Yamashiro much appreciated. The suite was large, effectively (if slightly noisily) air-conditioned and clean (with some charming original fitted furniture mixed with the modern items), and the bed big and comfortable. The staff were exceptional - very friendly, helpful in giving advice and booking taxis, restaurants, etc, and quick to mend a faulty safe in our room. The house keeping staff even did our washing up on 2 days. Yamashiro's was terrific - stunning views, a great atmosphere, and not too expensive. The hotel's location is very good - 5 minutes walk to Grauman's, 10 minutes to Hollywood and Highland metro station (and next door to the hotel where Janis Joplin died, rock fans). We felt safe walking around the area during the evening. We hope to return to LA, and if we do, we'd love to stay at the Magic Castle again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly and nice!”
Reviews.Author: Ducati40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle hotel for five nights in October 2005. Being a family of five, we were given a nice suite â€“but unfortunately with a roll out bed which wasnâ€™t too good for our boys of 11 and 14. We asked in the reception if they had an extra mattress or any thing to make it more comfortable - and they immediately upgraded us to another and bigger suite, one with two bedrooms. This is a very nice hotel â€“ it is not big â€“ you get the personal touch, you are remembered by name,- and the staff are extremely friendly. We were always given maps, good advices and help whenever we asked. Our favorite staff member, Gretchen â€“even lent us her own book to bring with us down-town! Relaxing at the pool one of the staff member came and offered complimentary ice cream or a relaxing towel for your faceâ€¦â€¦ these small tings that make you remember your stay at this hotel! Another great thing is the breakfast with smiling ladies who keeps bringing fresh croissant and juice â€¦and of course; the complementary videos! When reading about different hotels at www.tripadvisor.com I always look for the cleanliness â€“ and YES â€“ the magic castle hotel IS clean! The suit had a kitchen and I get a bit suspicious about â€œliving creaturesâ€� in these arrangementsâ€¦ but no â€“ everything was nice and clean. We would without hesitation recommend all our friends to stay at the magic castle hotel A very lovely hotel â€“ and for the location; it couldnâ€™t be better!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here if you're a light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magic Castle based purely on the reviews on Trip Advisor.... and unfortunately it didnt match up to them. If you are the kind of person who values your sleep, dont stay here. However, if you like listening to the bathroom habits of complete strangers in the next room, or you like hearing every word of other guests conversations while youre lying in bed, or if you like being woken up every 5 minutes by slamming doors, TVs and children running around in the bedroom below, then this is definitely the place for you. Having read other reviews saying this hotel should be a 5 star hotel, I can only assume that none of those reviewers have ever stayed in a decent 5 star hotel. The carpets were filthy, the kitchen was ill-equipped and we had a colony of spiders living on the living-room ceiling. Our toilet backed up and overflowed and when i contacted reception to ask for help, no one came. When I called again, I got told that the member of staff Id spoken to had forgotten about it. There were one or two staff who were helpful but no more than I would expect from a hotel. My boyfriend was really unwell at the time and he needed peace, quiet and rest so I ended up spending a day searching for alternative accomodation in LA. When we told the staff that the noise in the bedroom of our suite was intolerable, they couldnt understand as that was supposed to be the quite part of the hotel!! We would never stay there again. If youre a noisy person with noisy kids, maybe your own noise would drown out that of everyone else. If youre a quiet couple looking for a romantic get-away with privacy - forget it.

Reviews.Title: “The Magic Castle Hotel is Magical!”
Reviews.Author: lawmitch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently went to L.A. for a wedding and to visit our daughter. With all the rave reviews of the Magic Castle Hotel, how could we not try it? We arrived there in the evening with high expectations, but we were quickly disappointed. The carpeting in our room had numerous holes like cigarette burns (it turned out that these were dark spots). The next morning we debated about complaining to the management. After some hesitancy, we decided that management should know that our experience was not consistent with the reviews that we had read. After all, we were going to be there for three more nights. We started wondering whether the reviews were written by real guests of the hotel. We addressed the carpet problem with the person at the front desk. She was very understanding and offered to place us in another comparable room. However, this room was near the street, and we did not want to risk the possible noise. So we decided to stay put and thought that was the end of it. As we were enjoying our breakfast at poolside, we were approached by the general manager. He apologized and offered us further assistance. He indicated that another room was opening up that morning. A little later that morning he gave us the key for this newly vacated room. Were we surprised! The room was enormous with a full kitchen, dining area, living room, etc. Besides this free upgrade, he advised us that the first night would be deducted from our bill. With large smiles upon our faces, we promptly moved over our luggage to our new luxury suite. We then went back to the pool for swimming and sunbathing. Upon our return to the suite, we found a beautiful bouquet of flowers from a florest with a note apologizing for the inconvenience from the general manager. This was astonishing! Where do you get such service from a hotel? The remainder of our stay there could not have been better. The location is 2 blocks from Grauman's Theater and other tourist sites, as well as the subway that we took to Olvera St. The pool was refreshing with staff members bringing out popsicles and cool towels. The staff members were incredible - from helping with directions to caring for our every needs. The general manager was awesome and went over the top in making sure that we were satisfied. Would we stay there again? In a heartbeat. For us, the Magical Hotel was magical!

Reviews.Title: “I hope this place never changes”
Reviews.Author: crouchhill
Reviews.Content: Three guys. All from London. Stayed at Magic Castle off the reviews from this site. My god were they right. Jason, Gretchen, Amy and the others were SO SO helpful and friendly that it is quite unbelievable. The hotel was magical and I will go as far to say it was my best ever hotel experience. The only worry I have of putting in a good review is that they will think 'hmm, maybe we shouldn't be a 2 star hotel' and jack up the prices for the future... If I go back to LA, this is where I will stay cos the location on Franklin is perfect and the rooms are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in L.A”
Reviews.Author: DarrenLawbuary
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of a 4 day whirlwind visit to the Magic Castle, so, naturally, I stayed in the Magic Castle Hotel. From the first minute of arrival, to the last minute of check out, I was treated like a Lord. Impeccable friendly service from EVERY member of staff. A big shout out to Gretchen and Ashley at Reception for the countless complimentary lifts up the hill to my room, and for patiently answering all my questions! If visiting L.A, you MUST say here.........PERIOD. Thank you all. I shall return, I promise. Darren Lawbuary United Kingdom magicdaz@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle staff are the absolute best! They are very warm, friendly and patient. I just spent my 30th birthday there and it was such a wonderful experience. I rented a one-bedroom/kitchen suite that was just darling, and so unexpected when you arrive from the outside! It was clean, spacious and decorated with modern furniture. When I first walked in, a birthday cake and card, signed by each staff member, greeted me. We swam in the heated pool and the staff served us popsicles! It was so awesome and all my guests had a great time! It was the best hotel experience that I have had... Thanks Magic Castle Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: miloumilou
Reviews.Content: What everyone has said is true! We stayed for a week. We've traveled all over the world and it really doesn't get much better than this. The Magic Castle is simply the best!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ferriby
Reviews.Content: After a lovely welcome from the staff , we unpacked our swimming gear and went into the warm pool.It was nightime and the lights made it seem magical. We put on our plush robes (provided) and settled down for the evening. The following morning the staff helped us book and print our tickets for our front of line passes for Universal Studios which was a saving on the gate price. Breakfast included fruit , cereal, and buns delivered by the local bakery which were delicious. This can be eaten in your room, or at the tables around the pool. Whilst sunbathing the following morning, ice pops and cold lavender face cloths were brought to us, this was a very nice touch. The rooms are very comfortable; we had two queen beds, dining table , kitchen, and dvd player .( dvd's can be chosen from a list at reception)..chocolates are provided at bedtime. The staff are the most helpful we have come across and we cannot praise the hotel enough. I thank all other trip advisors for helping us choose this hotel. As it was our first trip to the USA we valued your comments.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Josula
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 days at the Magic Castle Hotel with my daughter. I don't remember ever having such wonderful service. The staff is perfect, willing to help with anything, always so pleasant! They go above and beyond to please you. All were great, but Shawn sticks out in my mind as outstanding. It is a good location and felt like I was in my own home. Great for families. Also liked the continental breakfast in the A.M.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars in Our Book!!!”
Reviews.Author: JAL25
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling for over twenty years. Never have we encountered a staff like the crew employed by the Magic Castle Hotel. These young people go the extra mile to make your stay in Hollywood memorable. We returned from a month-long vacation of the West Coast having stayed in 22 hotels and the Magic Castle was without a doubt the best experience. I was leery booking a hotel for a week which AAA rated only two diamonds but after reading the reviews by the "folks" on Trip Advisor, I decided to ignore the pros. Wise choice. The hotel is in an excellent location for tourist yet quiet. We did not want to rent a car as my husband had already driven 1,200 miles on the first leg of the trip. This hotel is close to all forms of public transportation and sightseeing venues. We arrived three hours before check-in time in hopes of storing our luggage. To our shock, the staff said our room was ready and we had been given a complimentary upgrade to a suite!!! The suite was immaculate. The staff recommended which tours were worthwhile, what to see on our own and how to get there and advised us what we should NOT do via public transportation. I had wanted to take the transit system to Long Beach to tour the Queen Mary. They were adamant it would not be safe to do so. Only my mother has ever been this concerned for my well-being. The staff even went so far as to call taxi services on my behalf (without my asking) to check rates to Long Beach. They advised public transportation to The Reagan Library in one day was not do-able either....too many stops thus not enough time to tour the Library. The staff booked tours for us, which when we tried to book ourselves, were told there were no openings....hence the name Magic! The heated outdoor pool in the courtyard is open 24/7. They just ask you keep the noise level reasonable after 9pm. The on-site laundry facility is suppose to close at 9pm but when I was doing laundry after that hour, they said "no problem". When I inquired as to why AAA only rated the hotel two diamonds, they explained that several factors are considered by AAA in their assessment which they don't tell the reader. 1. There is no bathroom in the lobby. This is silly as all 39 guestrooms are a short walk from the lobby. 2. There is no elevator. Another stupidity as there are only two floors. 3. No restaurant on site. Another no-brainer......there are two very classy restaurants right next door. The AAA rating of two diamonds is a terrible injustice to this wonderful hotel and their employees. To Ashley, Gretchen, Jason, Nick, Shawn and everyone else we came in contact with during the week......thank you.....you are all five stars in our book!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four recently stayed at this glorious place in West Hollywood. Although the builing is a little older and it does show in places, it is definitely worth the stay. The facilities are clean, safe and exceptionally located. The staff is fabulous, very polite, helpful! The bedding is exquisite, feather duvets, luxurious robes, great towels, etc. Chocolate on the bed tables every night and locked parking. I was lovely eating the continental breakfast on our private balcony overlooking the pool every morning...the pastries were gourmet and plentiful, in addition to fresh fruit, cereal, juices, milks (all kinds) and coffee. Free wireless internet access everywhere on the property, two televisions in the suite (one for kids and one for us), free CD library at the front desk, great soaps and shampoos....and I could go on and on. This hotel is fabulous and is worth a try...you will not be dissappointed!
